〈名〉An addition; an addendum(複数―da); an appendix; a supplement:(=する) to add, append (something to the body):(=の) additional; supplementary

content.content: 追加条款
an additional article
追加条約
a supplementary treaty
追加予算
a supplementaray budget
(簿記の)追加記入
post entry

content:
ついかい〔追懐〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ついそう〔追想〕

ついきゅう〔追及〕
〈名〉Overtaking:(=する) to overtake (one); to come up with, catch up with, fetch up with (one)

content:
ついきゅう〔追求〕
〈名〉Pursuit:(=する) to pursue

content.content: 快楽を追求する
to pursue pleasure
知識の追求
pursuit of knowledge

ついきゅう〔追究〕
〈名〉Close inquiry; thorough investigation:(=する) to inquire into (a matter) closely; to investigate (a matter) thoroughly; to probe (a matter) to the bottom

content:
ついく〔対句〕
〈名〉An antithesis

content.content: 対句になっている
It forms an antithesis.

content:
ついげき〔追撃〕
〈名〉Pursuit; chase:(=する) to pursue, chase (the enemy)

content.content: 敵の追撃を始める
to give chase to―start in pursuit of―the enemy
敵艦は逃げる、本艦は追撃した
We gave chase to the flying enemy.
敵を追撃中
We are in pursuit of―in chase of―the enemy.
烈しく追撃している
We are in hot pursuit of the enemy.
烈しく追撃される
to be hotly pursued

content:
ついごう〔追号〕
〈名〉A posthumous title

content.content: 追号を贈る
to give the deceased a posthumous title

ついじょ〔追叙〕
〈名〉Posthumous honours:(=する) to confer posthumous honors on (one)

content:
ついしょう〔追従〕
〈名〉Flattery; adulation; blandishment; sycophancy; toad-eating; honeyed words; soft sawder:(=する) to flatter (one); to adulate (one); to blandish (one); to lay it on thick

content.content: あの男は人に追従する
He is a flatterer―a sycophant―a toad-eater―a toady.
僕は追従などせぬ
I will not descend to flattery―stoop to flattery.
皆彼に追従して好きなことをさせる
They flatter him into doing what they like.

ついしょう〔追賞〕
〈名〉Posthumous honours:(=する) to confer posthumous honours on (one)

ついしん〔追伸〕
〈名〉A postscript (P. S.―と略す)

content:
ついずい〔追随〕
〈名〉Following:(=する) to follow

content.content: 彼はその道にかけては他の追随を許さない
He has no second in the art.

content:
ついせき〔追跡〕
〈名〉Pursuit; chase:(=する) to pursue; to chase; to track; to make tracks for (a runaway); to run after (a man)

content.content: 逃亡者を追跡する
to pursue a runaway―track a runaway―make tracks for a runaway
警察では犯人の追跡中
The police are on the track of the culprit.
泥棒は群衆に追跡されて逃げた
The thief ran with the crowd at his heels.
追跡を避ける
to elude pursuit

content:
ついぜん〔追善〕
〈名〉A mass; a requiem mass; a memorial service

content.content: 追善供養の為
for the repose of one's soul
追善供養を行う
to hold a memorial service for the deceased―have masses said for the repose of one's soul―celebrate a requiem mass for the repose of one's soul
追善興業
a memorial performance

content:
ついそう〔追想〕
〈名〉Retrospection; a retrospect; a review; reminiscence:(=する) to retrospect; to review (the past); to look back upon (the past); to run back over (the past); to run back in the memory

content.content: 過去を追想する
to review the past―look back on the past―go over the past in one's mind
あの頃のことを追想すると皆夢のようだ
As I look back on those days, all seems a dream.
この石垣は昔日を追想せしむ
These stone-walls remind me of the good old times―The stone-wall are reminiscent of the past.

content:
ついたけ〔衝丈〕
〈名〉The length of one's body

content.content: 衝丈の着物
a gown reaching down to one's heels

ついたち〔朔日〕
〈名〉The first day of a month

content:
ついちょう〔追弔〕
〈名〉Mourning:(=する) to mourn (for the dead―over one's death)

content.content: 追弔会
a memorial service
氏の追弔会を催す
We hold a memorial service for Mr. A. B.
追弔の辞を述べる
to give a memorial address

content:
ついちょう〔追徴〕
〈名〉Additional collection:(=する) to collect (money) in addition; to make an additional collection (of money)

content.content: 追徴金
an additional collection―an additional imposition

content:
ついて〔就て〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=関して)about (the matter); on (the subject or point); as to (who or what); regarding; respecting; concerning; touching; in regard to, with regard to; in respect to, with respect to; in reference to, with reference to, as for; as regards; in connection with; apropos of

content.content: そのことについては多少知っていることがある
I know something about the matter―regarding the matter―respecting the matter―concerning the matter―touching the matter.
君はこのことについて何か聞かないか
Haven't you heard anything about the matter?―in regard to the matter?―in respect to the matter?―in reference to the matter?
彼はそのことについては何とも言わぬ
He said nothing about the matter―with regard to the matter―with respect to the matter―with reference to the matter.
あの件について手紙を出しておいた
I have written to him about the matter―on the subject.
売却の件については父に相談しなければならぬ
I must consult with my father about the sale―on the subject of the sale.
その点については君と同意だ
I agree with you on that point.
その点については疑いは無い
There is no doubt about it.
誰が当選するかについては疑いは無い
There is no doubt as to who will be elected.
どちらが偉いかについての争いが起こった
A dispute arose as to which was the greater man.
あの件についてはご安心下さい
As regards that matter,―As for that matter,―you may set your heart at ease.
あのことについては安心している
My mind is easy on that score.
配当についてけんかがあった
They quarrelled about the dividend―quarrelled over the dividend.
今度の試験について無くてならぬ本があるのです
In connection with the examination, there is a book I must have.
今度の戦争について大いに学んだことがある
In connection with the war, I have added greatly to my stock of knowledge.
この語について面白いしゃれがある
Apropos of this word, there is a good joke.

content: 2. (=ゆえに、ために)on account of; owing to; in view of; in honour of; on the occasion of

content.content: 先生病気について今日は休みでした
He did not meet his class on account of illness.
旱魃について断水になった
The water was stopped owing to the drought.
時局について計画は見合わせになった
The project was abandoned in view of the situation.
本校記念日について明日は休業です
The school will be closed tomorrow in honour of its being the School Anniversary.
彼が結婚したについて披露会があった
A dinner was given on the occasion of his marriage.

content:
ついて〔付いて〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=沿うて、伝いに)along

content.content: この土手について行くと橋があります
If you go along this bank, you will see a bridge.
この塀について曲るとその横町です
If you go along this wall and turn the corner, you will find yourself in the alley.

content: 2. (=共に)with

content.content: 母についてよく芝居へ行きます
I often go the play with my mother.
君は早くてとてもついて行けない
I can not keep up with you, you walk so fast.
級について行けるか
Can you keep up with the class?
僕について来給え
Come along (with me)!
この犬はどこへでもついて来る
My dog follows me everywhere.

content: 3. (=誰の下に)under; with

content.content: 教師に付いて学ぶ
to study under a teacher
君は誰に付いて英語を学んだか
Under whom did you study English?―(と言うよりも普通は)―Who taught you English?
この本は誰に付いて学んだか
With whom did you read this book?
この本は田中さんに付いて学びました
I read this book with Mr. Tanaka.

content: 4. (=ごとに)a; per; for

content.content: 一ダースについて一円は儲かります
I make one yen a dozen―one yen per dozen.
一人について三円ずつ
three yen per man―three yen a head―three yen each―three yen apiece
一円について五つの割りに買いました
I bought them at five for a yen.

content:
ついで〔次いで〕
〈前置詞相当〉Next to; second to; after

content.content: 生に次いで愉快なものは死である
Next to life, death is sweet.
彼は三井岩崎に次いでの富豪である
He is a millionaire second only to the Mitsuis and Iwasakis.
三井岩崎に次いでの最大の富豪である
He is the greatest millionaire after the Mitsuis and Iwasakis.

content:
ついで〔序〕
〈名〉
1. (=順序)order
2. (=幸便、機会)occasion; opportunity; chance

content.content: ついでが有ったら話しておこう
I will take occasion to speak to him.
ついでの有り次第に話しておこう
I will speak to him on the first opportunity―on the first occasion―as occasion serves.
ついでながら御礼申上げます
I take this occasion―take this opportunity―to thank you.
幸い明日あそこへ行くついでがある
I have occasion to go there tomorrow.
ついでが有ったら遊びに来給え
Come to see me when you have occasion to come (up or down) my way―when you happen to come (up or down) my way.
おついでの節この品を先方へお届け下さいませんか
Will you please forward the article when you have occasion to send there?―when you have a chance?―at your convenience?
わざわざ傘を返しに来たのかついででよかったに
Have you come for the purpose of returning the umbrella? You might have done it at your convenience.
ここは不便だからついでの時に買い置きをしておきます
As this is an inconvenient place, we lay in a supply when we have a chance―whenever we have a chance.

content: 〈副〉(=に、=ながら)by the way; in passing; en passant; apropos; at the same time

content.content: ついでに寄って来よう
I will look in by the way.
ついでに言っておくが
Let me remark, in passing, that...
ついでに君に言うことが有る
By the way,―Apropos, I will tell you what.
ついでながら言う
to remark in passing
ついでにこの手紙を出して下さい
Please post this letter for me at the same time.

content: 〈接続詞〉(=に) while; when; as; since; now that

content.content: 思い出したついでに君に聞きたいことが有る
I want to ask you something while I think of it.
この話のついでにいま一つ言うことが有る
While I am on the subject,―While I am speaking of it,―I have another observation to make.
手を濡らしたついでにこれも洗っておいて下さい
Please wash this one also, while you are about it.
手を汚したついでにこの魚もこしらえてくれ
Get this fish ready for the pot while you are at it.
はだしになったついでに水を一杯汲んでおくれ
Get me a pail of water while you are about it.
来たついでに少し買物をして行こう
While I am here,―Since I am here,―Now that I am here,―I will make some purchases.
本の話の出たついでに君に見せたいものが有る
Talking of books, I want to show you something.
京都へ行ったついでに嵐山の花を見て来給え
You should see the blossoms at Arashiyama when you go to Kyoto.
仙台へ行ったついでに松島を見て来よう
I will pay a visit to Matsushima when I am at Sendai.
京都へ行くついでに伊勢へ参詣した
I paid a visit to Ise on my way to Kyoto.
世話になりついでにまたお世話になろう
As I owe you a debt, I may as well increase the debt.

content:
ついてくる〔付いて来る〕
〈他動〉To follow (one)

content.content: この犬はどこへでもついて来る
My dog follows me everywhere.

content:
ついては〔就ては〕
〈副〉In this connection

content.content: ついては一つお尋ねしたいことがある
In this connection, I want to ask you something.
この事については少し金が要る
I want some money in connection with this affair.

content:
ついてまわる〔付いて廻る〕
〈他動〉To pursue (one)

content.content: あの人には不運がついて廻る
He is pursued by misfortune.

content:
ついてゆく〔付いて行く〕
〈他動〉To keep up with (one)

content.content: 君は早くてとてもついて行けない
I can not keep up with you, you walk so fast.
級について行けるか
Can you keep up with the class?

content:
ついとう〔追悼〕
〈名〉Mourning:(=する) to mourn (for the dead―over one's death)

content.content: 追悼会
a memorial service―a requiem mass
追悼の辞を述べる
to give a memorial address―offer a tribute to the memory of the deceased

content:
ついとう〔追討〕
〈名〉Subjugation; chastizement:(=する) to subjugate; to chastize; to hunt down

content.content: 賊軍を追討する
to subjugate the rebels―chastize the rebels―hunt down the rebels

content:
ついとうかい〔追悼会〕
〈名〉A memorial service; a requiem mass

content.content: 誰の為に追悼会を催す
to hold a memorial service for―celebrate a requiem mass to the memory of―the late Mr. A. B

content:
ついとうぐん〔追討軍〕
〈名〉A punitive force; a punitive expedition

content.content: 追討軍を差し向ける
to send a punitive force against the rebels

ついとうし〔追討使〕
〈名〉A punitive force; a punitive expedition

ついな〔追儺〕
〈名〉An old-time court-ceremony of driving out the devils

content:
ついに〔終に、遂に〕
〈副〉Finally; at last; at length:(打ち消しに伴えば)after all:(接続詞に訳せば)until (at last)

content.content: 彼らは無二無三に攻め立ててついに成功した
They went at it, tooth and nail, and finally succeeded.
彼はついに目的を達した
At last, he attained his object.
(久しく待った後)ついに好機会があった
At length an opportunity presented itself.
僕は洋行するはずであったがついに実行する機会を得なかった
I was to have gone abroad, but I had no chance to carry my design into execution after all.
彼は五六度も試みたがついに成功しなかった
He made several attempts, but he did not succeed after all.
彼はそのことをあまり気にしてついに発狂した
He took the matter too much to heart, until (at last) he went mad.
この問題をしきりに苦心してついに思い通り解決した
I worked and worked at the problem, until (at last) I solved it to my satisfaction.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は病床に臥してついにまた起たず
He lay down on a bed of illness, never to rise again.
始め人を欺き欺きするとついには己を欺くようになる
If you begin by deceiving others, you will end by deceiving yourself.
彼はそのことをあまり気にしてついに発狂した
He took the matter so much to heart that he went mad.
衆議ついに決せず
The assembly came to no decision.

content:
ついに〔終に、遂に〕
〈副〉Finally; at last; at length:(打ち消しに伴えば)after all:(接続詞に訳せば)until (at last)

content.content: 彼らは無二無三に攻め立ててついに成功した
They went at it, tooth and nail, and finally succeeded.
彼はついに目的を達した
At last, he attained his object.
(久しく待った後)ついに好機会があった
At length an opportunity presented itself.
僕は洋行するはずであったがついに実行する機会を得なかった
I was to have gone abroad, but I had no chance to carry my design into execution after all.
彼は五六度も試みたがついに成功しなかった
He made several attempts, but he did not succeed after all.
彼はそのことをあまり気にしてついに発狂した
He took the matter too much to heart, until (at last) he went mad.
この問題をしきりに苦心してついに思い通り解決した
I worked and worked at the problem, until (at last) I solved it to my satisfaction.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は病床に臥してついにまた起たず
He lay down on a bed of illness, never to rise again.
始め人を欺き欺きするとついには己を欺くようになる
If you begin by deceiving others, you will end by deceiving yourself.
彼はそのことをあまり気にしてついに発狂した
He took the matter so much to heart that he went mad.
衆議ついに決せず
The assembly came to no decision.

ついにん〔追認〕
〈名〉Ratification:(=する) to ratify (another's deed)

content:
ついはく〔追白〕
〈名〉A postscript (P. S.―と略す)

content.content: 手紙に追白がある
There is a P. S. to the letter.

ついばむ〔啄む〕
〈他動〉To peck, pick (seed, etc.)

content:
ついびする〔追尾する〕
〈他動〉To follow, pursue, shadow (one); to dog one's steps

content.content: 追尾電報
a faire suivre telegram

ついふく〔対幅〕
〈名〉A pair of hanging-scrolls

ついふく〔追福〕
〈名〉A mass for the dead; a memorial service

content:
ついほう〔追放〕
〈名〉Banishment; exile; deportation; expatriation; ostracism:(=する) to banish; to exile; to deport; to expatriate; to ostracize

content.content: 国外に追放する
to banish one from the land―deport one from the country
追放人
an exile

content:
ついぼする〔追慕する〕
〈他動〉To look back to (the past); to cherish one's memory

content.content: 西郷隆盛を追慕している人がたくさんある
Many people cherish the memory of Saigo Takamori―Saigo Takamori is enshrined in many hearts.
過去を追慕する
to look back to the past
老人が昔日を追慕するのは無理は無い
It is quite natural that old men should talk of the good old times.

content:
ついやす〔費す〕
〈他動〉To spend; to expend; to lay out; to waste

content.content: 金を費やす
to spend money―(何に)―on something―(消耗品なら)―in something
彼は月給を本に費やしてしまう
He spends his salary on books.
彼は着物にだいぶ金を費やす
He spends much money on clothes.
人が酒やタバコに費やす金は莫大なものだ
People spend enormous sums of money in wine and tobacco.
子どもは菓子を買って金を費やす
Children spend money in confectionery.
これは多大の金を費やして建てた家だ
The house was built at great cost―at great expense.
三万円を費やして建てた家だ
The house was built at cost of 30,000 yen.
金を無益に費やす
to waste money―squander money―make ducks and drakes of one's money
時を費やす
to spend time in―pass one's time in―devote one's time to―anything
僕は読書に時を費やす
I pass my time in reading―devote my time to reading.
雑談に時を費やす
We spend time in idle talk.
英語を修めるには十年を費やさなければならぬ
It takes ten years to master English.
僕は英語を修めるのに十年を費やした
It took me ten years to master English―I was ten years in mastering English.
その宮を建立するのに四十年の年月を費やした
The temple was forty years in building.
これは多大の時と金を費やして建てた家だ
The house was built at a considerable cost of time and money.
時を無益に費やす
to waste time
そんなことをするのは時と金を無駄に費やすのみだ
It will be time and money thrown away.
労を費やす
to cost labour
この本を書くのに七年の労を費やした
The book cost me seven years' labour.
これは著者が多年の労を費やした苦心の作である
It is a work which cost the author years of labour.
彼は多大の金と労を費やして目的を達した
He attained his object at a great cost of money and labour.
そんなことをするのはいたずらに労を費やすのみだ
It will be a waste of labour―It is lost labour.
愚者には千万言を費やすも何の益無し
You will waste words on a fool―you will waste words on him.

content:
ついらく〔墜落〕
〈名〉Precipitation; fail:(=する) to fall; to drop; to come to the ground

content.content: 機は故障を生じ一千メートルの高さより墜落した
The machine become disabled, and crashed to the ground from a height of 1,000 meters.
操縦者は墜落の犠牲となる
The pilot was killed by the fall.

ついろく〔追録〕
〈名〉An addition (to a writing); an addendum(複数―da); a supplement; a postscript:(=する) to add (something to a writing); to supplement (a record)

content:
つう〔通〕
〈名〉
1. (=世間や花柳界の事情に通じていること)knowledge of the world; knowledge of the town

content.content: 通を振りまわす
to parade one's knowledge of the world
通を利かす
to display one's knowledge of the town
あの男はなかなか通だ
He is a knowing fellow―He knows a thing or two―He is up to a thing or two.
彼は通がっている、通を気取っている
He sets up for a man about town.

content: 2. (=何通、その道に通じている人)one versed in the subject; an authority (on some affairs); a connoisseur (in art)

content.content: あの人は支那通だ
He is versed in Chinese affairs―conversant with Chinese affairs―an authority on Chinese affairs.
あの西洋人は日本通をもって自ら任じている
He professes to be an authority on Japanese affairs.
彼は骨董通だ
He is a connoisseur in art―a judge of curios―a virtuoso.
なかなか世間通だ
He is very much of a man of the world.

content: 〈助数詞〉A copy

content.content: 正副二通
original and copy―duplicate copies
書類は正副二通に作成する
The papers are drawn up in duplicate.
三通
triplicate copies
三通作る
to be drawn up in triplicate

content:
つういん〔痛飲〕
〈名〉Carouse:(=する) to carouse; to booze; to drink deep; to drink hard

content.content: 痛飲夜を徹す
They caroused all night―caroused the night away―spent the night in carousal―made a night of it.
痛飲会
a carousal―a booze―a drinking-bout
痛飲家
a deep-drinker―a hard-drinker

content:
つううん〔通運〕
〈名〉Transportation; forwarding

content.content: 通運会社
a transportation company―a forwarding agency―an express company
通運で送る
to send by express
品物は通運で送った
We have sent the goods by express―The goods have been sent by express.

content:
つうか〔通貨〕
〈名〉Currency; current money; current coins; a circulating medium

content.content: 通貨で千円
1,000 yen in currency

influx of currency―inflow of currency

inflation of currency

contraction of currency

monetallism

bimetallism

content:
つうか〔通過〕
〈名〉Passage; transit; carriage (of a bill):(=する) to pass; to pass through; to go through; to get through; to be put through; to be carried

content.content: 議案が通過した
The bill has passed―got through―been put through―been carried.
議案が両院を通過した
The bill has passed (through) both Houses―gone through both Houses.
原案通り通過した
It passed as drafted.
議案を通過させる
to pass a bill―carry a bill―put a bill through―get a bill through
議案を大急ぎで通過させる
to rush a bill through the House
議案が通過しなかった
The bill did not pass―failed to pass―failed of passage.
貨物が税関を通過する
The goods pass the custom-house.
税関で貨物を通過させる
The custom-house passes the goods.
試験を通過する
to pass an examination
彼はどうかこうか試験だけは通過する
He manages to pass his examinations―He scrapes through his examinations.
志願者を通過させる
to pass a candidate
品はあまり上等ではないがどうか通過しよう
The articles are not of the best quality, but they may pass―pass muster.
ヨーロッパへ行く時米国を通過した
I passed through America on my way to Europe.
米国を通過してヨーロッパへ行った
I went to Europe by way of America.
次の駅は通過です
We pass the next station without stopping.
通過駅
a non-stop station
通過荷物(表記用語)
transit
(貨物の)通過税
transit-duty―transit-dues
金星の太陽面通過
the transit of Venus

content:
つうかい〔痛快〕
〈形〉Giving keen pleasure; affording intense satisfaction; incisive (argument); trenchant (wit); stunning (blow); home (hit); merciless (criticism); thorough-going (man, etc.)

content.content: あの人の演説を聞くと実に痛快だ
It gives me keen pleasure―affords me intense satisfaction―does my heart good―warms the cockles of my heart―to hear him speak.
痛快痛快、実に痛快
It does my heart good―It warms the cockles of my heart.
論鋒鋭利痛快を極む
His arguments are delightfully incisive.
痛快な文章だ
It is an incisive style.
痛快な弁舌だ
He has trenchant wit.
痛快な評
merciless criticism
彼の新作を痛快に批評した人がある
His new work has been mercilessly criticized.
それは痛快な適評だ
It is a home hit.
彼は痛快に政府を攻撃する
He makes home thrusts at the government.
彼は誰のことでも痛快に攻撃する
He spares nobody.
実に痛快な演説だった
It was a stunning speech.
実に痛快な男だ
He is a thorough-going fellow.

content.content: 通券が無くてはこの関所は通れん
You can not pass this barrier without a ticket.
実力はどこへでも入れる通券だ
Real ability is an “open sesame” to all careers.

content:
つうこう〔通行〕
〈名〉Passage; traffic; transit:(=する) to pass along (a street)

content.content: 町を通行する
to pass along a street―walk down a street
この通りは通行ができない
The street is impassable.
道路が狭くて自動車が通行しない
The road is so narrow that a motor-car can not run through it―The road is too narrow to admit a motor-car.
左側通行(立て札)
Keep to the left of the road.
橋の修繕中通行が止まっている
Traffic is stopped―Traffic is closed―Traffic is blocked―Traffic is held up―Traffic is tied up―while the bridge is under repairs.
この通りが通行が止まっている
This street is closed to traffic―blocked to traffic.
警察でこの通りの通行を止めた
The police closed the street to traffic.
通行が杜絶した
Traffic ceased―The streets were deserted.
通行を妨害する
to obstruct traffic
通行の妨害となるもの
an obstruction to traffic
通行止(立て札)
No thoroughfare.
通行人
a passenger―a foot-passenger
通行税
transit-duty
通行規制
the rules of the road
通行権
right of way
(戦時などの)通行券
a pass―a safe-conduct―a safeguard―a protection

〈名〉A pass; a safe-conduct; a safeguard; a protection

content.content: 通行止(立て札)
No thoroughfare.
車馬通行止(立て札)
No thoroughfare for horses and vehicles.
この通りは通行止めになっている
The street is closed to traffic―blocked to traffic.
橋の修繕中通行止めだ
Traffic is stopped―Traffic is closed―Traffic is blocked―Traffic is held up―Traffic is tied up―during the repair of the bridge.

〈名〉A passenger; a foot-passenger

content.content: これは痛恨事なり
This is a matter for deep regret.

つうさん〔通算〕
〈名〉(事)summing up:(物)the sum total:(=する) to sum up, add up, total (the figures)

content.content: 服務年間を通算する

content:
つうじ〔通じ〕
〈名〉
1. (=便通)passage; evacuation of the bowels; action of the bowels; movement of the bowels; state of the bowels

content.content: 通じが有りますか
Have you any passage?―What is the state of your bowels?
通じが有ります
My bowels move well―My bowels act well―My bowels are open.
毎日通じが有ります
My bowels act every day.
通じが有りません
My bowels do not act―I am constipated―I am costive.
通じが無くなる
to become constipated―become costive
通じをつける
to open the bowels―loosen the bowels
小便の通じをつける
to aid the flow of urine
通じ薬
a laxative―an aperient―(は緩慢なもの。激烈なのは)―a cathartic―a purgative

content: 2. (=感応)effect

content.content: 通じが無い
to have no effect
いくら謎をかけても通じが無い
My hints were lost upon him.

content:
つうじて〔通じて〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=経て)through; through the medium of

content.content: ある友人を通じて頼んだ
I made a request through a friend.
鎖国の日本は長崎のオランダ人を通じて外界の事情を知るのみであった
It was only through the medium of the Dutch at Nagasaki that the exclusive Japan learned about the external world.

content: 2. (=全部に亙って)through; throughout; all over

content.content: 全巻を通じて読んだ
I have read through the whole volume.
全国を通じて行われる
It prevails throughout the land―all over the country.
全校を通じて彼一人
He is the only man in the whole school.
各階級を通じて然り
So it is in all classes of society.
彼は前後通じて十年の知己だ
I have known him, first and last, for ten years.
古今を通じて彼に匹敵する者は無い
He has no equal in all ages.
古今東西を通じて
in all ages and land
これは古今東西を通じての真理である
This is true of all times and places.

content:
つうしょう〔通商〕
〈名〉Commercial intercourse; commerce; trade:(=する) to trade (with America):(=の) commercial

content.content: 日本が外国と通商を開始してから六十年になる
It is sixty years since Japan opened commercial intercourse with foreign countries.
日本は六十年このかた欧米と通商をしている
Japan has been trading with Europe and America these sixty years.
通商条約
a commercial treaty
通商局
the Bureau of Commercial Affairs

content:
つうしょう〔通称〕
〈名〉A popular name

content.content: 彼は通称儀助で通っている
He goes by the name of Gisuke.

content:
つうじょう〔通常〕
〈副〉Usually; commonly; generally:(=の) ordinary; common; usual; regular

content.content: 彼が酒を飲んで暴れるのは通常のことだ
It is usual with him to get drunk and commit excesses.
祭日のことを通常「旗日」と言う
A national holiday is commonly called “flag-day.”
通常会
an ordinary meeting―a regular meeting
通常総会
an ordinary general meeting
通常議会
an ordinary session of the Diet―a regular session of the Diet
通常会員
an ordinary member
通常礼服
a dress-coat

content:
つうじる〔通じる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: つうずる〔通ずる〕

つうしん〔痛心〕
〈名〉Grief; distress:(=する) to grieve, be grieved (at the news―over the event―for a person); to distress oneself, be distressed (about some matter)

content:
つうしん〔通信〕
〈名〉Correspondence; communication; intelligence; news; a despatch; a report:(=する) to correspond (with one); to communicate (with one); to report (for a paper)

content.content: あるロンドンの新聞と通信している
I correspond with―report for―a certain London paper.
その問題について彼の方から通信が有った
He has communicated with me on the subject.
パリより通信に曰く
A Paris despatch says that...
通信員
a correspondent―a reporter
特派通信員
a special correspondent
軍事通信員
a war correspondent
本社パリ通信員の電報に曰く
Our Paris correspondent cables that...
通信社
a news-agency
通信機関
an organ of communication―a means of communication
通信局
the Correspondence Bureau―the Bureau of Posts and Telegraphs
通信部
the intelligence department
通信事務
correspondence business―post-office business
通信線
the line of communication
通信船
a despatch-boat
通信販売業
mail order business
通信教授
teaching by correspondence―a correspondence course―correspondence lessons
英語の通信教授をする
to teach English by correspondence
英語の通信教授を受ける
to take correspondence lessons in English
学校の通信簿
a school report-book

content:
つうじん〔通人〕
〈名〉A man of the world; a man about town; a man of fashion; the knowing one

content.content: あの男はなかなか通人だ
He is a knowing fellow―He knows a thing or two―He is up to a thing or two.
彼は通人ぶる
He sets up for a man about town―He affects the man of the world.

つうしんしゃ〔通信社〕
〈名〉A news-agency

content:
つうずる〔通ずる〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=通う)to communicate

content.content: この室はあの室と通じている
This room communicates with that―This room opens into that.
湖水は運河によって海と通じている
The lake communicates with the sea by a canal.
鉄道が通ずる
Railway communication is opened (between two places).
主なる都会は鉄道が通じている
The chief towns are connected by railways.
この鉄道は下関まで通じている
This railway runs as far as Shimonoseki―connects Tokyo with Shimonoseki.
この町もいまに汽車が通じます
This town will soon be brought into railway communication―A railway will be laid ［extended］ to this town very soon―There will be a railway here very soon.
ここは汽車が近頃通じました
The place has lately been brought into railway communication―The railway has been laid ［extended］ here but lately.
ここからそこまで鉄道が通じている
A railway runs there from here.
その地方は鉄道が四方八方に通じている、縦横に通じている
Railways cross the country in every direction―Railways cross the country like network―A network of railways intersect the country―The country is a network of railways.
鉄道が都より四方八方へ通じている
The railways radiate from the metropolis in all directions.
電車が通ずる
The electric cars begin to run.
あそこは電車が通じますか
Do the cars run there?
いまにここも電車が通じます
The cars will be running here very soon.
電車が通じてからこの辺は繁華になりました
Since the cars began to run here, this part of the city has become quite flourishing.
電話が通ずる
Telephone communication is established (between two places)
故障があって電話が通じなくなった
Telephone communication is interrupted.
電話がまた通じました
The telephone communication is restored.
電話が通じない
The telephone will not work―The telephone refuses to work.
さっき電話をかけても通じなかった
I rang him up, but there was no reply―I could not get him on the telephone.
電信が通ずる
Telegraphic communication is established (between two places)
故障があって電信が通じなくなった
Telegraphic communication is interrupted.
電信がまた通じました
The telegraphic communication is restored.
道がどこへ通ずる
A road leads somewhere.
この道は山の頂上まで通じている
This road leads to the summit of the mountain.
この山奥へ通ずる道があるか
Is there a road leading to the recesses of these mountains?
言葉が通ずる
to speak―understand
あの西洋人は日本語に通じている
He speaks Japanese―understands Japanese.
英語は世界中に通ずる
English is spoken all over the world.
あの人は数カ国の語に通じている
He speaks several languages.
南米では何語が通じますか
What languages do they speak in South America?
言葉が通じなくて困る
I can not understand them―I can not make myself understood.
二人は言葉が通じない
They can not understand each other―can not make themselves understood by each other―can not make themselves intelligible to each other.
僕の意味が通じましたか
Have I made myself understood?―made myself intelligible?―made myself clear?
意を通ずる、意味を通ずる
to make oneself understood―make known one's intention
君は英語で意を通ずることができるか
Can you make yourself understood in English?
下等動物は何か互いに意志を通ずる方法があるに違いない
The lower animals must have some means of making known their wants to each other.
彼は何を言っているものやら僕にはさらに通じない
I can not comprehend what he is driving at.
謎をかけても先へ通ぜぬ
My hints were lost upon him.
読書百遍義自ら通ず
Read a hundred times over, and the meaning will become clear of itself.
一念天に通ず
“Faith will move a mountain.”
僕の一念が天に通じた
My prayer is heard.

content: 8. (=伝える)to communicate (the news to one)

content.content: この報は皆に通じておく必要がある
The news must be communicated to everybody.
御申越しの趣先方へ通じ置き候
I have communicated the contents of your letter to the other party.
来意を通ずる
to state the object of one's visit

content: 9. (=暁通する)to know (the world); to be familiar with (a subject); to be acquainted with (life); to be conversant with (the affairs); to be versed in (history); to be skilled in (the art); to be learned in (the law); to be well read in (literature); to be posted up in (current literature); to be deep in (philosophy); to be in touch with (the times)

content.content: 彼は東西の学に通じている
He is versed in―conversant with―Eastern and Western lore.
英文学に通じている
He is versed in―well read in―English literature.
当世文学に通じている
He is posted up in current literature.
法律に通じている
He is learned in the law.
人情に通じている
He is versed in human nature―deep in the human heart.
文武両道に通じている
He is skilled in letters and arms.
武芸に通じている
He is practised in the use of arms.
万事に通じている
He is versed in everything―conversant with everything.
彼は長く洋行しているから泰西の事情に通じている
His long stay abroad had made him conversant with Western affairs.
彼は世間に通じている、世事に通じている
He is versed in the ways of the world―He knows the world―He has a knowledge of the world―He is a man of the world.
万芸に通じている
He is an all-round man―He is a versatile man―He can turn his hand to anything―(悪く言えば)―He is a Jack of all trades.
万芸に通じて一芸を極めよ
Know something of everything and everything of something.
敵情に通じている
We are in touch with the enemy.
彼は世情に通じている、世情に通じない
He is in touch with the world―out of touch with the world.
時世に通じている、時世に通じない
He is in touch with the times―out of touch with the times.
英語を研究すると泰西の事情に通ずる
The study of English will keep you in touch with the West.
彼は下情に通じている
He is acquainted with low life―familiar with the conditions of the people.
商業界の消息に通じている
He is posted up in commercial affairs.
政界の消息に通じている
He is posted up in political affairs.
上流社会の消息に通じている
He is in the fashion.
その道の消息に通じている
He is in the line―in the trade―in the business.
内部の消息に通じている
He is in the swim―in the know.
裏面の消息に通じている
He is behind the scenes.

content: 10. (=密通する)to have a connection with, have an improper connection with, have a liaison with, hold illicit intercourse with, intrigue with, misconduct oneself with (a man or a woman):(姦通する)to commit adultery with, have criminal connection with (a man or a woman)

content.content: 彼は女と通じている
He has an improper connection with a woman.
隣りの女房と通じている
He has criminal connection with his neighbour's wife.
女と情を通ずる、慇勲を通ずる
to have a connection with―have a liaison with―have intimate relations with―keep company with―intrigue with―a woman

content: 11. (=内通する)to have a secret communication with (the enemy); to betray one's cause; to turn traitor to one's cause

content.content: 彼は敵と通じている
He is in secret communication with the enemy―He is a traitor.
彼は敵と通じていはせぬかと思う
I suspect him of treachery.
彼は敵と通じているという者がある
He is accused of treachery.
彼は敵に軍機を通じた
He has betrayed a military secret to the enemy.
刺を通ずる
to send in one's card―send up one's card
電気を通ずる、電流を通ずる
to turn on an electric current―switch on an electric current―close an electric circuit
電気を通じている
The current is on―turned on.
電気が通じておらぬ
The current is off―cut off.
連絡を通ずる
to establish a connection (with something)
両社は連絡を通じている
There is a connection between the two companies.
甲線は乙線と連絡を通じている
One line is connected with―in connection with―the other line.
汽車は汽船と連絡を通じている
The train connects with the steamer.
気脈を通ずる
to enter into understanding with each other―come into rapport with each other―keep in touch with each other
二人は互いに気脈を通じている
There is a secret understanding between the two―They are in rapport with each other.
教員は互いに気脈を通じて授業をしている
The teachers work in touch with each other.
案内者は馬賊と気脈を通じていた
The guide was in league with the bandits.

content:
つうせい〔通性〕
〈名〉A common quality; a common property

content.content: 弾力は金属の通性なり
Elasticity is a property common to all metals.

content:
つうせき〔痛惜〕
〈名〉Deep regret; deep lamentation:(=する) to regret deeply; to lament deeply

content.content: 彼の早世は痛惜に堪えず
His premature death is deeply to be regretted―deeply to be lamented.

content:
つうせつ〔痛切〕
〈形〉
1. (=最も切)acute; keen:(=に) acutely; keenly

content.content: その欠乏を痛切に感ずる
The want is keenly felt―acutely felt.
痛切なる苦痛を感ずる
I feel an acute pain―an exquisite pain.

content: 2. (=最も適切)apposite; appropriate

content.content: その言至誠より出でて痛切なり
His words are apposite, as proceeding from his heart.

つうそく〔通則〕
〈名〉A general rule

content:
つうぞく〔通俗〕
〈形〉Popular

content.content: 通俗教育
popular education
通俗文学
popular literature
通俗文庫
a popular library―the people's library―everybody's library
通俗文体
a popular style―a colloquial style
通俗語
popular language―colloquial language―familiar language
通俗科学
popular science
科学を通俗化する
to popularize science

content:
つうだつ〔通達〕
〈名〉
1. (=通知)→『

content.content: つうち〔通知〕
つうぎょう〔通暁〕

content:
つうたん〔痛歎〕
〈名〉Deep lamentation; bitter grief:(=する) to lament deeply; to grieve bitterly; to deplore

content.content: かかることの行わんとは痛歎すべきことである
It is deplorable―to be deplored―that such things should prevail.

content:
つうち〔通知〕
〈名〉Notice; notification; communication; information; advice:(=する) to give (one) notice (that or of); to notify (one that or of); to inform (one that or of); to advise (one that or of); to apprise (one that or of); to communicate (news to one―with one)

content.content: そのことは会計から通知があった
The treasurer has given me notice of the fact―notified me of the fact―apprised me of the fact.
まだ何の通知も無い
I have had no notice yet.
明日は臨時休業に付御通知申上候
I beg to inform you that we have a special holiday tomorrow.
売れたという通知があった
I have been advised of the sale.
御通知の有り次第店員を差出可申候
We shall call on you immediately on receipt of your notice.
役所へは私の方から通知しておきます
I shall communicate the news to the office―communicate with the office.
変更の都度ご通知致します
I will let you know whenever there is an alteration.
通知書
a notice―a notification
通知状
an advice note―a letter of advice
鉄道貨物着荷通知書
a railway advice
通知預金
a deposit at notice―a deposit at call

content:
つうちょう〔通牒〕
〈名〉A note; a notification:(=する) to notify (one that or of...)

content.content: 最後の通牒
an ultimatum
同文通牒
an identic note

content:
つうどく〔通読〕
〈名〉Reading through:(=する) to read through (a book)

content.content: この本を通読してご覧、誤りが一つも無いから
Read through this book, and your shall not find a single mistake.
この本を通読する人は少ない
Few people read this book through―read this book from cover to cover―read this book from title-page to colophon.

つうにょうき〔痛尿器〕
〈名〉A catheter

つうば〔痛罵〕
〈名〉Denunciation; condemnation; an invective; a diatribe:(=する) to denounce (one's conduct); to condemn (a new work); to inveigh against (a person); to rail at (religion, etc.)

つうひ〔通比〕
〈名〉A common ratio

content:
つうふう〔通風〕
〈名〉(家や室内の通風)ventilation:(汽缶の通風)draught

content.content: この家は通風が好い、通風が悪い
The house is well ventilated―badly ventilated.
(汽缶の)自然通風、強圧通風
natural draught―forced draught
通風器
a ventilator
通風機関
a fan-engine
(鉱山の)通風竪坑
an air-shaft

つうぶん〔通分〕
〈名〉Reduction of fractions to a common denominator:(=する) to reduce (fractions) to a common denominator

つうぶんぼ〔通分母〕
〈名〉A common denominator

content:
つうへい〔通弊〕
〈名〉A common evil; a common abuse

content.content: 嫉妬は社会の通弊である
Envy is one of common evils of society.

content:
つうべん〔通弁〕
〈名〉(事)interpretation:(人)an interpreter:(=する) to interpret

content.content: 通弁をして下さい
Please interpret for me.
僕が通弁をしましょう
I will act as interpreter.
彼は西洋人に面会する時は通弁付きだ
When he sees a foreigner, he speaks through an interpreter.
彼の言うことは通弁が無きゃわからない
What he says, must be interpreted for you.
彼の英語はいわゆる通弁英語だ
He speaks “the guide-boy's English.”

content:
つうほう〔通宝〕
〈名〉A coin

content.content: 天下の通宝
the coin of the realm

content:
つうぼう〔痛棒〕
〈名〉A hard blow; severe criticism; slashing criticism; scathing criticism

content.content: 痛棒を食わす
to give one a hard blow―subject one to server criticism

つうほうかん〔通報艦〕
〈名〉A despatch-boat; an advice-boat; an aviso

content:
つうやく〔通約〕
〈名〉Reduction to a common measure; commensuration:(=する) to reduce to a common measure; to commensurate

content.content: 通約し得べき数量
commensurable quantities
通約し得べからざる数量
incommensurable quantities
通約性
commensurability

content:
つうやく〔通訳〕
〈名〉(事)interpretation:(人)an interpreter:(=する) to interpret

content.content: 通訳官
an official interpreter―a secretary-interpreter
通訳をする、通訳官をする
to act as interpreter
彼は通訳官で従軍した
He followed the army as interpreter.
彼は西洋人に面会する時は通訳官が付く
When he sees a foreigner, he speaks through an interpreter.
通訳生
an ?l?ve interpreter

content:
つうゆう〔通有〕
〈形〉Common

content.content: 物質の通有性
a common property of matter―a property common to all matter

content:
つうよう〔痛痒〕
〈名〉Interest; concern

content.content: 日本は支那の治乱には大いに痛痒を感ずる
Japan has a vital interest in the maintenance of peace in China.
痛痒を感ぜぬ
I have no interest in the matter―have no concern in the matter―I am indifferent about the matter―careless about the matter.
彼が成功しようと失敗しようと僕は少しも痛痒を感ぜぬ
I have no interest in his success or failure―I am indifferent about his success or failure―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His success or failure makes no difference to me―does not matter to me.
どちらが勝とうと負けようと僕は痛痒を感ぜぬ
I don't care―It doesn't matter to me―which side may win or lose.

content:
つうよう〔通用〕
〈名〉Circulation; currency:(=する) to circulate; to be in circulation; to pass current; to pass (for so much):(切符などなら)to be available (for a week); to be good (for a month):(規則などなら)to hold good; to hold true

content.content: この金はまだ通用しているか
Is this money still in circulation?
もう通用しない
It is no longer in circulation―It does not pass any longer.
この証券が金に通用する
These bonds pass as money.
天宝銭は八厘に通用した
The Temposen passed for eight rin.
あれでも学者で通用しているからおかしい
It is strange that he should pass for a scholar.
こんな説が世間に通用しているから妙だ
It is strange that such doctrines should pass current with the world.
そんな古臭い説は昭和の今日通用しない
Such a stale theory will not pass in these enlightened days of Showa.
この無賃乗車券は官線一般に通用する
This free pass is available for the whole service of government railways.
この切符はいつまで通用するか
How long is this ticket available?
一カ月間通用する
It is available for a month―good for a month.
(切符などの)通用期限
an available period
通用期限一週間
available for a week―good for a week
通用期限当日限り
available for the day of issue only―good for the day of issue only
この規則は通用の利かない場合がある
His rule does not always hold good.
あれは通用の利く男だ
He is the sort of man to get on.
英語は世界中に通用する
English is spoken all over the world.
通用切符、通用切手
a pass
通用貨幣
currency―current coins―a circulating medium
通用言葉
a current word
通用口、通用門
a side-door―a side-entrance

content:
つうらん〔通覧〕
〈名〉A general view; a general survey:(=する) to survey; to take a general view of (the world, etc.)

content.content: 宇内の形勢を通覧する
to survey the situation of the world―take a general view of the world

つうりき〔通力〕
〈名〉Supernatural powers; occult powers

つうりつ〔通律〕
〈名〉A general law

content:
つうれい〔通例〕
〈副〉Commonly; usually; generally:(=の) common; usual; ordinary; general

content.content: 監督は通例女だ
The superintendent is commonly a woman.
陪審官は通例十二人よりなる
A jury usually consists of twelve men.
彼は通例晩は在宅だ
He is generally at home in the evening.
彼は通例の人間だ
He is an ordinary mortal.
通例の人間じゃない
He is no common being.

content:
つうれん〔通輦〕
〈名〉(The Emperor's) passing (a place)

content.content: 天皇陛下がここを御通輦になる
The Emperor will pass here.

content:
つうろ〔通路〕
〈名〉A passage; a way

content.content: 通路をふさぐ
to obstruct the passage
通路を開く
to open a passage―(障害物を取払ってなら)―clear the passage (from obstacles)
その家は通路に当たる
The house lies in my way.

content:
つうろう〔通廊〕
〈名〉A passage; a corridor

content.content: 通廊列車
a corridor train―(は英国、米国は)―a vestibule train

content:
つうろん〔通論〕
〈名〉A general view; an outline

content.content: 法学通論
an outline of law

content:
つうわ〔通話〕
〈名〉A telephone message

content.content: 通話度数制度
the message-rate system
通話度数計
a message-register―a service-register

content:
つえ〔杖〕
〈名〉A staff; a cane; a stick, a walking-stick

content.content: 杖を突く、杖にすがる、杖にもたれる
to lean on one's staff
杖をついて歩く
to walk with a cane
弓を杖にして立つ
He stood up leaning on his bow.
彼はいつも杖を携えている
He always carries a stick with him.
杖を振りまわして歩く
He flourishes his cane as he goes.
病人は杖を力にやっと庭を散歩するようになった
The invalid can walk in the garden with the help of a staff.
老人は宮中杖をお許しになる
An old man is permitted to use a staff at court.
盲人の杖
the blind man's eyes
盲人が杖を無くしたよう
He is a sheep without a shepherd.
杖を曳く
to go anywhere
郊外に杖を曳く
to take a walk outside the city
ここに杖を曳く者多し
Many people frequent the place―The place attracts many visitors.
杖を停める
to rest―stay―somewhere
転ばぬ先の杖
“Look before you leap”―“Prevention is better than cure.”
彼は一人息子を杖とも柱とも頼んでいる
His only son is his only prop and stay.
彼は杖とも柱とも頼む息子に死なれた
He lost a son who was his sole prop and stay.

content:
つか〔束〕
〈名〉
1. (=一握り)a handbreadth
2. (=少し)a little

content.content: 束の間
a brief space of time―a moment
束の間も忘れぬ
I do not forget it for a moment.
ああ嬉しいと思いしは束の間で
Her joy was short-lived.

content:
つか〔塚〕
〈名〉A mound; a hillock; a barrow; a tumulus(複数―li)

content.content: 貝塚
a shell-mound
一里塚
a milestone
蟻塚
an ant-hill

content:
つか〔柄〕
〈名〉The hilt (of a sword); the haft (of a dagger); the handle (of a knife, etc.)

content.content: 刀の柄に手をかけた
He grasped the hilt of his sword.
柄も通れと突き込む
to thrust a dagger to the hilt―thrust a dagger home

つが〔栂〕
〈名〉The hemlock; the hemlock-spruce

content:
つかい〔使い〕
〈名〉
1. (=使命)a mission; an errand; a message

content.content: 使いに行く
to go on an errand
小僧はじきそこまで使いに行ってまだ帰りません
The boy has gone on an errand just a step, and is not yet back.
使いにやる
to send one on an errand
小僧をちょっと使いにやりました
I have sent the boy on a short errand.
お使いをする、使い歩きする、走り使いする
to run errands―do errands―undertake messages―do messages―fetch and carry
この小僧は下宿人の使い歩きをします
The boy runs errands―does messages―for the lodgers.
この犬はお使いをする
The dog will fetch and carry.
君ちょっと使いをしてくれんか
Will you do a little errand for me?
使い賃
a tip
使い賃をやる
I'll tip you.

content: 2. (=使者)a messenger; the bearer

content.content: 使いをやる
to send (a messenger)
手紙より使いがよい
You had better send than write.
学校へ使いをやろう
I will send to the school.
使いをやって人を呼ぶ
to send for a man
使いをやって品物を取り寄せる
to send for an article
本屋へ使いをやって一部取り寄せよう
I will send to the publisher's for a copy.
学校から使いを受けた
I am sent for from the school.
使いをもって
by messenger―per bearer
使いに持たしてやろう
I will send it by messenger―send it per bearer.
使いの者に御返事被下度候
Let me have your answer by the bearer―(は普通文、紋切形にすれば)―Send back word by bearer.
使い屋
a public messenger―a porter―a commissionaire

content: 3. (=神のお使い)a familiar; a familiar spirit

content.content: 狐は稲荷のお使い
The fox is sacred to the God of Harvests.

content:
つがい〔番〕
〈名〉
1. (=一対)a pair
2. (=雌雄)a couple; a brace

content.content: 鴨一番
a brace of ducks

content: 3. (=番目)a joint

つかいあるき〔使い歩き〕
〈名〉Running errands:(=する) to run errands; to do errands; to undertake messages; to do messages; to fetch and carry

content.content: この小僧は下宿人の使い歩きをします
The boy runs errands―does messages―for the lodgers.
この犬は使い歩きをする
The dog will fetch and carry.

content:
つかいかた〔使い方〕
〈名〉How to use, the way to use (anything)

content.content: 英語は前置詞の使い方がむずかしい
In English, the use of prepositions is hard to learn.
機械の使い方は知っているか
Do you know how to work the machine?―how to manipulate the instrument?
この機械は使い方がむずかしい
It is hard to get the hang of this machine.
彼は人の使い方を知らぬ
He does not know how to manage men―how to deal with men.
彼は奉公人の使い方が荒い
He works his men too hard.
奉公人は使い方一つだ
Everything depends on how you treat your servants―The treatment of servants is everything.

content:
つかいきる〔使い切る〕
〈他動〉To use up (anything); to spend all (the money)

content.content: こんなに金があってはとても使いきれない
I can not spend all this money.
彼は使いきれぬほど金がある
He has more money than he can spend―more money than he knows how to dispose of.

content:
つかいこなす〔使いこなす〕
〈他動〉To master (a tool); to manage (a man)

content.content: あの難物を使いこなせる人は君くらいのものだ
You are about the only man that can manage that troublesome character.

つかいこみ〔使い込み〕
〈名〉Defalcation

content:
つかいこむ〔使い込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=委託金を費消す)to defalcate; to make free with (money entrusted to one)

content.content: 彼は主人の金を使い込んだ
He made free with his master's money―He was short in his accounts of his master's money.

content: 2. (=使い馴らす)to accustom oneself to using (anything); to use (anything) for a long time

content.content: これは使い込んだ鉄瓶だ
I have used this kettle for a long time.
鉄瓶は使い込むほど好い
An iron kettle improves with use.

content:
つかいごろ〔使い頃〕
〈形〉Handy (volume); wieldy (weapon)

content.content: 使い頃の船だ
She is a handy ship.

content:
つかいさき〔使い先〕
〈名〉The place where one is sent on an errand

content.content: 彼はいつも使い先で道草を食っている
He is always a long time on an errand.

content:
つかいすぎる〔使い過ぎる〕
〈他動〉To use too much; to spend too much

content.content: 君は金を使い過ぎる
You spend too much money―You are too extravagant.
人を使い過ぎる
to work a man too hard―overwork a man
君は身体を使い過ぎる
You work too hard―You overwork yourself―You burn the candle at both ends.

つかいつくす〔使い尽す〕
〈他動〉To use up (anything); to spend all (the money)

つかいて〔使い手〕
〈名〉
1. (=使用者)a user
2. (=雇主)an employer
3. (=浪費者)a spendthrift; a prodigal

content:
つかいで〔使い出〕
〈名〉Yield; durability

content.content: 使いでが有る
to last long―go far
この石鹸は使いでがある
This soap lasts long―wears well.
元は十円あるとずいぶん使いでがあったものだ
Ten yen used to go a long way.
金は使いでが無くなった
Money now goes only a little way.

content:
つかいどころ〔使いどころ〕
〈名〉A use

content.content: どんな物でもそれぞれ使いどころがある
There is a use for everything―Everything is useful in its place.
どんな人でもそれぞれ使いどころがある
Every man is useful in his way.
この人ばかりは使いどころが無い
He is good for nothing.
何か使いどころが有るだろう
He must be good for something.
使いどころによってはきっと役に立つ
If he is put in the right place, he must prove useful.

content:
つかいならす〔使い馴らす〕
〈他動〉To accustom oneself to using (anything); to break in (a horse)

content.content: 使いならした物は使いよい
One likes what one is used to.

content:
つかいなれる〔使い馴れる〕
〈他動〉To be accustomed to using (anything)

content.content: 使い馴れた人を惜しいことをした
I am sorry I have lost the man I was used to.

つかいのこす〔使い残す〕
〈他動〉To leave (anything) unused; to leave (money) unspent

content:
つかいのこり〔使い残り〕
〈名〉The remainder (of money); the remnant (of goods, etc.)

content.content: (鉛筆などの)使い残り
a stub―a stump

content:
つかいはたす〔使い果す〕
〈他動〉To go through, run through (one's fortune); to squander (a fortune); to make ducks and drakes of (one's money); to spend all (the money)

content.content: 彼はたちまち親譲りの身代を使い果たした
He soon went through the fortune left him by his father.
父親がせっかくこしらえた身代をとうとう使い果たした
He finally squandered the fortune which his father had built up with so much trouble.
二百両使い果たして二歩残る
Two hundred ryo I've worked through all but a trifle.

content:
つかいふるす〔使い古す〕
〈他動〉To wear out (anything) by use

content.content: 使い古した道具
a worn-out tool

content:
つかいみち〔使い途〕
〈名〉A use

content.content: この原稿は使いみちがある
I have a use for this manuscript.
あの男は使いみちが無い
I have no use for that man―That man is useless―of no use―good for nothing.
どんな物でもそれぞれ使いみちがある
There is a use for everything―Everything is useful in its place.
どんな人でもそれぞれ使いみちがある
Every man is useful in his way.
天地間に使いみちの無い物は無い
Everything in the universe has its use.
あの人間は使いみちに困る
I do not know what to do with that man.
金の使いみちに困っている人がある
Some people do not know what to do with their money.
金はいくらあっても使いみちに困るようなことは無い
One might do with any amount of money―One can not have too much money.

content:
つかいもの〔遣物〕
〈名〉A present; a bribe

content.content: 遣い物をして頼む
to bribe a man

つかいや〔使い屋〕
〈名〉A public messenger; a porter; a commissionaire

content:
つかいよう〔使い様〕
〈名〉How to use (anything)

content.content: ばかと鋏は使いよう
Fools and scissors need nice handling―(は直訳、意訳すれば)―Tact is needed in dealing with men and things.
金は使いようで倍にもなる
Money well spent will buy twice its value.
彼は奉公人の使いようが荒い
He works his men too hard.
奉公人は使い様一つだ
Everything depends on how you treat your servants―The treatment of servants is everything.

content:
つかいわける〔使い分ける〕
〈他動〉To use (each) properly

content.content: 彼はよく言葉を使い分ける
He uses the right word in the right place.
前置詞を使い分けるのはむずかいし
It is difficult to use the prepositions properly.

content:
つかう〔使う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=物を使用する)to use; to employ

content.content: 教科書を使う
to use a text-book―employ a text-book
学校でこの本を使っている
We use this book in our school.
今度この本を使った(採用した)
We have adopted this book.
この本を使って(試用して)みようと思う
I am going to try this book.
この本は今一般に使っている
The book is in general use.
この本は使わなくなった
This book has fallen into disuse―gone out of use―This book is out of use.
この字書は日々使っている
The dictionary is in daily use.
電話を使う
to use a telephone
宅の電話をお使いなさい
You can use―make use of―our telephone.
彼は金を善く使う
He makes good use of his money―puts his money to a good use.
金を悪く使う
He makes had use of his money―puts his money to a bad use.
彼は生きた金を使う
He makes the most of his money.
この室は何にお使いですか
What is this room used for?
これは使わない室です
This is a spare room.
この室は事務所に使っています
This room is used for the office―This room serves as the office.
この室は教室に使える
This room will serve for a class-room.
この箱は食卓に使える
The box may be used as a table―This box will serve for a table.
ラクダは乗用に使う
The camel is used for riding.
狩に犬を使う
Dogs are used in hunting.
道具を手荒く使ったために損じている
The furniture is damaged by rough usage.
機械は使わないから錆びている
The machine has rusted from want of usage.
この船はまだ使える
The ship is still fit for service.
この馬は五年使える
This horse is good for five year's service.
使える金、使えない金
good money―bad money

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 楊枝を使う
(歯をほじくるのなら)to pick one's teeth―(歯を磨くのなら)―clean one's teeth
手水を使う
to wash oneself
行水を使う
to have one's tub
賄賂を使う
to bribe one
色目を使う
(男なら)to ogle a girl―(女なら)―make eyes at a man
魔法を使う
to practise magic
手妻を使う
to perform conjuring tricks
人形を使う
to pull the wires
蛇を使う
to charm a snake
剣術を使う
to fence
仮病を使う
to feign illness―sham illness
鉱石から金を採るのに水銀を使う
Gold ore is treated with mercury.

content: 2. (=人を使用する)to employ (a man):(使っておく)to keep (a servant); to keep (a man) in one's service; to keep (a man) in one's employ; to keep (a man) in one's pay

content.content: この人を使ってご覧なかなか間に合うから
If you employ the man, you will find him very useful.
誰も怠け者は使わない
No one will employ an idle man.
あんな怠け者を使っておくことはできない
I can not keep such an idle fellow in my service.
宅では女中は三人使っています
We keep three maid-sevants.
彼は大勢人を使っている
He keeps a large establishment.
彼は僕が使っておくのだ
He is in my service―in my employ―in my pay.
僕は彼に使われている
I am in his service―in his employ.
彼を試しに使ってみよう
I will employ him by way of experiment―give him a trial―give him a chance.
私を使って下さい
I beg to offer my services.
彼は英語教員に使ってくれと言った
He offered his services as teacher of English.
人をひどく使う
to work one hard―drive one hard―order one about―hold one's nose to the grindstone
あんな奴に使われるのはいやだ
I object to being ordered about by such a fellow.
側にいる者は親でも使え
Use any one who comes handy.
親を使ってはもったいない
It would be sinful to order about one's parents.
人を使う者は使われる
The master is the servant of servants.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 人を使うならまず人に使われてみる
If you wish to command, you must first learn to obey―Obedience is the best school for command.
あの人なら安心して使える
I can trust him.
あの男はなかなか使える
He is quite useful.
いま一人の男は使えない男だ
The other man is good for nothing.
彼は西洋人に会う時は通弁を使う
When he sees a foreigner, he speaks through an interpreter.
人をだしに使う
to use a man as a blind
彼は部下を頤で使う
He has his people at his beck and call.
人をお先に使う
to make a cat's paw of a man
彼らは彼の手足のように使われている
They are his creatures.

content: 3. (=費消する)to spend (money); to consume (articles of consumption)

content.content: 金を使う
to spend money―(物入りの意味なら)―incur an expense
何に金を使う
to spend money―(着物に)―on clothes―(酒のような消耗品なら)―in wine
あの金を何に使ったか
How did you spend the money?
彼は着物や本に金を使う
He spends much money on books and clothes.
酒やタバコに金を使う
He spends much money in wine and tobacco.
近頃人の為に金を使った
I have incurred an expense―had an outlay―on another's account.
君は金を使い過ぎる
You spend too much money―You are too extravagant.
彼は金を使うから金持ちになれぬ
He is too extravagant to become rich.
あればあるだけ使ってしまう
He spends all he has.
お前に使えるだけ金をやろう
You shall have as much money as you can spend.
こんなに使い切れぬ
I can not spend all this money.
彼は使いきれぬほど金がある
He has more money than he can spend―more money than he knows how to dispose of.
この金を使ってしまったらもっとやる
When you have gone through―run through―this money, you shall have more.
金をやっと使ってしまった
I have worked through the money.
この金を使わずに取っておけ
You must keep the money.
彼は湯水のように金を使う
He spends money like water―squanders his money―makes ducks and drakes of his money.
チビチビ金を使う
He fritters away his money.
ここに使える金が千円ある
Here is 1,000 yen at my disposal.
人に金を使わせる
to put one to expense
君にこう金を使わせては済まない
I am sorry to put you to such expense.
お前の為に金を使った
You have put me to expense―I am put to expense on your account.
日本で使うだけの米は日本でできぬ
Japan can not produce all the rice she consumes.
宅では日に何十となく卵を使います
We consume dozens of eggs every day.
僕は何連という紙を使う
I consume reams of paper.
日本で砂糖をどのくらい使うか
What is the consumption of sugar in Japan?

content: 4. (=行使する)to circulate, pass, utter (counterfeit money)

content.content: 贋造紙幣を使う者がある
Some people are circulating counterfeit notes.
彼は贋造紙幣と知って使ったのだ
He passed what he knew to be counterfeit coin.

content: 5. (=要る)to want(は英国):(米国では)to need

content.content: 君は明日この本を使うか
Do you want this book―need this book―tomorrow?
この金は当分使わぬ
I do not want the money for the present―I do not need this money for the present―I can do without the money for the present.

content: 6. (=扱う)to work (a machine); to handle (a tool); to manipulate (an instrument)

content.content: どれほど好い船があっても使うことができなけりゃ無用の長物だ
The best ships are useless if you do not know how to work them.
この機械を使ってご覧に入れる
I will show you how to work the machine―You shall see the machine work.
この器械は乱暴に使ったために損じた
The machine is damaged by rough handling.

content: 7. (=話す)to speak (English); to hold (a language)

content.content: 誤り無く英語を使う人は少ない
Few Japanese speak English without making mistakes.
彼は下手な英語を使う
He speaks broken English―murders the King's English.
彼は傲慢な言葉を使う
He holds haughty language.

content: 8. (=食う)to eat; to take

content.content: 弁当を使う
to take lunch

content:
つがう〔番う〕
〈自動〉To copulate; to couple:(鳥は)to pair; to mate

content.content: 牡馬が牝馬と番う
A stallion covers a mare.
牡馬を牝馬と番わせる
to serve a mare with a stallion
牡犬が牝犬と番う
A dog lines a bitch.
雄鶏が雌鶏と番う
A cock treads a hen.

content:
つかえる〔仕える、事える〕
〈他動〉To serve (one's master); to render service to (one's country); to minister to (one); to attend on (one's master); to work under (one's employer); to work for (a firm)

content.content: 君に仕える
to serve one's lord
主人に仕える
to serve one's master―attend on one's master
宮中に仕える
to serve at court
忠臣二君に仕えず
A faithful servant will not serve two masters.
二君に仕え難し
One can not serve two masters.
私は彼に仕えております
I am in his service―in his employ.
彼は金を貰って敵国に仕えていたのだ
He was in the enemy's pay.
彼は主人を大事に仕えている
He is faithful in his master's service.
彼は忠実に僕に仕えた
He has served me faithfully―He has been faithful in my service.
父母に仕える
to obey one's parents
彼はよく父母に仕える
He is dutiful to his parents.
我れ無き後は親と思って彼に仕えよ
When I am no more, obey him as you would your father.
彼女はよく夫に仕える
She is faithful to her lord―attentive to her husband.
師に仕える
to be docile to one's teacher―at the feet of one's master
彼は三代に仕えた
He served three generations―saw three reigns.
彼は仕えにくい主人だ
He is a hard master.
仕え好い主人だ
He is a good man to work under.

content:
つかえる〔仕える、事える〕
〈他動〉To serve (one's master); to render service to (one's country); to minister to (one); to attend on (one's master); to work under (one's employer); to work for (a firm)

content.content: 君に仕える
to serve one's lord
主人に仕える
to serve one's master―attend on one's master
宮中に仕える
to serve at court
忠臣二君に仕えず
A faithful servant will not serve two masters.
二君に仕え難し
One can not serve two masters.
私は彼に仕えております
I am in his service―in his employ.
彼は金を貰って敵国に仕えていたのだ
He was in the enemy's pay.
彼は主人を大事に仕えている
He is faithful in his master's service.
彼は忠実に僕に仕えた
He has served me faithfully―He has been faithful in my service.
父母に仕える
to obey one's parents
彼はよく父母に仕える
He is dutiful to his parents.
我れ無き後は親と思って彼に仕えよ
When I am no more, obey him as you would your father.
彼女はよく夫に仕える
She is faithful to her lord―attentive to her husband.
師に仕える
to be docile to one's teacher―at the feet of one's master
彼は三代に仕えた
He served three generations―saw three reigns.
彼は仕えにくい主人だ
He is a hard master.
仕え好い主人だ
He is a good man to work under.

content:
つかえる〔使える〕
〈形〉Useful; serviceable; of service; fit for service

content.content: あの男を使ってご覧、なかなか使えるから
You will find him quite useful.
使ってみたら使える
I find him useful―He has proved of service to me.
いま一人は使えない男だ
The other man is good for nothing.
この船はまだ使える
The ship is still fit for service.
この馬は五年は使える
The horse is good for five years' service.
この室は事務所に使える
This room will serve for the office.
今使える金があるか
Is there any money at our disposal?
ここに使える金が千円ある
Here is 1,000 yen at our disposal.
使える金、使えない金
good money―bad money

content:
つかえる〔支える〕
〈自動〉To be obstructed; to be barred; to be blocked; to be choked; to be clogged; to be stopped up; to stick; to break down

content.content: 管がつかえた
The pipe is choked―clogged―stopped up.
この煙管はつかえている
This pipe does not draw.
市場がつかえている
The market is glutted.
電話がつかえている
The telephone is engaged.
用がつかえている
I am engaged.
先がつかえている
The way is obstructed―The way is blocked―The way is barred.
馬車で先がつかえている
The carriages block the way.
貨物が輻輳して先がつかえている
Congested goods obstruct the way.
人で先がつかえている
People bar the way.
前に電車がつかえている
The cars ahead stand in the way.
頭がつかえて昇進ができない
My seniors bar my way to promotion.
鼻がつかえるようだ
There is not room enough to swing a cat.
胸につかえる食物がある
Some kinds of food sit heavy on the stomach.
胸がつかえた
I feel a pressure on my chest.
胸のつかえを治す
to remove the pressure off one's chest
胸のつかえが治った
I am relieved of the pressure on my chest.
不意を撃たれて返答につかえた
Taken by surprise, I was at a loss for an answer.
言おうと思うことが喉につかえた
The words stuck in my throat.
そこまではどうやら言えたがそこでつかえた
I expressed myself somehow so far, and there stuck.
言葉につかえた
I was at a loss what to say―at a loss for a word―stuck for a word.
演説の半ばでぐっとつかえた
I broke down in the midst of my speech.

content:
つがえる〔番える〕
〈他動〉To pair (two―one with another)

content.content: 矢を番える
to fit an arrow to the string
言葉を番える
to promise―make a promise

content:
つかさ〔司〕
〈名〉
1. (=官職)an office
2. (=官庁)a government office
3. (=長官)the chief official

content.content: 汝を以て国の司と為す
I set thee over the land.

content:
つかさどる〔司る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=支配する)to rule; to govern; to control; to preside over

content.content: 国を司る
to rule over the land―govern the country
校務は校長これを司る
The school affairs are under the control of the principal.
星は人の運命を司る
The stars preside over man's destiny.

content: 2. (=管理する)to administer; to manage; to conduct; to have charge of

content.content: 大臣は国務を司る
The minister administer the affairs of state.
事務を司る
to conduct business―manage the affairs
誰が出納を司るか
Who has charge of revenue and expenditure?―who holds the purse-strings?

content:
つかす〔尽かす〕
〈他動〉To have (anything) exhausted

content.content: 愛想を尽かす
to be disgusted with anything
さすがの彼もあの女には愛想を尽かしたと見える
He seems to be disgusted with her.
彼は友達までも愛想を尽かされた
He was given up even by this friends.

content:
ツカツカ
〈副〉Straight; directly; bluntly

content.content: 一人の男がツカツカと僕の前へ寄って来て言葉をかけた
A man walked up to me―walked straight up to me―walked directly up to me―and accosted me.
ツカツカものを言う
to speak bluntly―speak one's mind
ツカツカものを言う男だ
He is a plain-spoken man―an outspoken man―a blunt fellow.

content:
つかぬこと〔付かぬ事〕
〈名〉Something foreign to the subject

content.content: つかぬことを言うようだが帝劇では何をやっているかね
By the bye, what are they performing at the Imperial Theatre?

content:
つかねる〔束ねる〕
〈他動〉To bundle (sticks); to sheave (corn); to fagot (wood)

content.content: 手をつかねて傍観する
to look on with folded arms
手をつかねて傍観するに忍びぬ
I can not remain a mere spectator―remain an idle spectator―remain an unconcerned spectator.

content:
つかのま〔束の間〕
〈名〉A brief space of time; a moment:(=の) brief; momentary; short-lived

content.content: 束の間も忘れぬ
I do not forget it for a moment.
ああ嬉しやと思いしはほんの束の間
My joy was short-lived.
嬉しいと思ったのは束の間でまた心に心配が湧いて来た
After the first flush of joy was over, anxiety filled my heart again.

content:
つかまえどころ〔掴まえ処〕
〈名〉A hold; a grip

content.content: つかえまどころの無い
(男)a slippery fellow―(考え)―a subtle idea―(言)―a vague statement―(返事)―an evasive answer―an elusive reply
彼は瓢箪鯰{ひょうたんなまず}でつかまえどころが無い
He is as slippery as an eel―You don't know where to have him.
彼はつかまえどころの無い返事ばかりする
He only gives evasive answers―makes elusive replies.
あの先生はつかまえどころの無いことばかり言っている
He always makes vague statements.
あまり高尚でつかまえどころのない思想だ
It is a subtle idea.

content:
つかまえにくい〔掴まえにくい〕
〈形〉Slippery (fellow); subtle (idea); vague (statement); evasive (answer); elusive (reply, etc.)

content.content: つかまえにくい考えだ
It is a subtle idea―The idea eludes my grasp.

content:
つかまえる〔掴まえる〕
〈他動〉To catch; to seize; to clutch; to grip; to identify; to take hold of, catch hold of, seize hold of, lay hold of (anything)

content.content: 泥棒をつかまえる
to catch a thief
犯人をつかまえる
to identify the culprit
この縄をつかまえろ
Take hold of―Catch hold of―this rope!
人の急所をつかまえる
to catch one on the hip
僕は彼の急所をつかえまえているから僕にどうされてもしようが無い
I have a hold on him,―I have a grip on him,―so he is at my mercy.
あの男は何でもつかまえたら放さない
He grips like a vice―He has the grip of a bull-dog.
彼は人をつかまえたら容易に放さない
He will hold you by the button―buttonhole you for hours together.

content:
つかませる〔掴ませる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=賄賂を使う)to bribe (one); to thrust (money) into one's hands; to slip (a coin) into one's hands

content.content: 内証で少しつかませた
I slipped some money into his hands.
少しつかませたら承知するだろう
He will do it for a consideration.
彼に少しつかませて口留めをした
I bribed him into secrecy.

content: 2. (=売り付ける)to impose, foist, pass off, palm off, fob off (anything upon one)

content.content: こんないかさま物をつかませられた
I had this bogus article imposed upon me―foisted upon me.

つがまつ〔栂松〕
〈名〉The hemlock; the hemlock-spruce

content:
つかまつる〔仕る〕
〈自動〉(Honorific for) to do (anything); to do oneself the honour (to do anything)

content.content: 早速参上可仕候{さっそくさんじょうつかまつるべくそうろう}
I shall do myself the honour to wait on you without delay.

content:
つかまる〔掴まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=掴まる)to be grasped

content.content: 考えがつかまらない
The idea eludes my grasp―It is a subtle idea.

content: 2. (=捕えられる)to be caught; to be taken; to be identified

content.content: 泥棒がつかまった
The thief has been taken.
犯人がつかまったか
Has the culprit been identified?
犯人はまだつかまらない
The culprit is still at large.

content: 3. (=手に掛かる)to fall into one's hands; to fall into one's clutches

content.content: 高利貸につかまったら奴隷だ
If you fall into the clutches of a usurer, you will be at his mercy.
つかまったら逃げられない
You can not get out of his clutches.
だからつかまらないようにし給え
That is why I say keep out of his clutches.
あの人につかまったら大変だ、容易に放しはせぬ
He will hold you by the button―buttonhole you for hours together.

content: 4. (=すがる)to cling to, hold on to, hang on to (anything)

content.content: 吊皮につかまる
to hold on to a strap―hang on to a strap
この縄につかまれ
Take hold of―Catch hold of―this rope!
しっかりつかまって放すな
Hold fast!
(電車の車掌)おつかまりなさい
Hold on!

content:
つかみ〔掴み〕
〈名〉A handful

content.content: 一つかみの米
a handful of rice
一つかみにするぞ
I will make a handful of you.
一つかみに七人捕えた
He caught seven men at swoop.

content:
つかみあい〔掴み合い〕
〈名〉Handgrip; grips:(=する) to come to grips (with one); to fall together by the ears

content.content: 二人はつかみ合いを始めた
They came to grips with each other―fell together by the ears.
二人はつかみ合っている
They are at grips with each other.
つかみ合いをさせる
to set people by the ears

content:
つかみあう〔掴み合う〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: つかみあい〔掴み合い〕

つかみだす〔掴み出す〕
〈他動〉To turn (one) out of doors

content:
つかみどり〔掴み取り〕
〈名〉Easy gain

content.content: 濡れ手で粟のつかみ取り
to make easy gain―take with a wet finger―make money as a magnet gathers iron filings

content:
つかむ〔掴む〕
〈他動〉To grasp; to grip; to clutch; to seize

content.content: つかもうとする
to grasp at―catch at―clutch at―grab at―snatch at anything
あまりつかむとかえって損をする
If you grasp at too much, you will lose all―“Grasp all and lose all.”
彼はつかんだら放さない
He grips like a vice―He has the grip of a bull-dog.
溺れかけた人の髪の毛を掴んで引き上げた
I seized the drowning man by the hair, and drew him out of the water.
溺るる者は藁をもつかむ
“A drowning man will catch at a straw.”
空をつかんで苦しむ
to clutch at the air in one's agony
雲をかかむ
to clutch at shadows
雲をつかむような話だ
It is a chimerical scheme―a visionary scheme.
雲をつかむような捜し物だ
It is a wild-goose chase.
濡れ手で粟をつかむ
to make easy gain
あまり択り嫌いするとしまいに屑をつかむ
“Go farther and fare worse.”

content:
つからす〔疲らす〕
〈他動〉To tire; to weary; to fatigue; to exhaust

content.content: 精神を疲らす
to fatigue the mind
いたずらに兵を疲らすのみだ
It will only serve to exhaust the men to no purpose.

content:
つかる〔漬かる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=浸る)to soak, be soaked (in water); to be steeped (in water); to be submerged (in water); to be flooded (with water)

content.content: 全村水に漬かった
The whole village was flood―under water.
なんぼ海水浴でも一日水に漬かっていては毒だ
Sea-bathing may be all very well, but it will do you harm to soak in the water all day.

content: 2. (=漬物が漬かる)to be seasoned

content.content: 漬物が漬かったか
Are the pickles seasoned?
まだ漬からない
They are not yet seasoned.
温かいと早く漬かる
The warm weather seasons them quickly.

content:
つかれ〔疲れ〕
〈名〉Fatigue; weariness; exhaustion:(=る) to get tired, grow weary, become fatigued, become exhausted (with or from toil); to be jaded

content.content: 歩いて疲れた
I am tired with walking.
働いて疲れた
I am tired with working―weary from toil.
徹夜して疲れた
I am fatigued from sitting up all night.
あまり歩いて疲れた
I have walked myself weary.
あまり働いて疲れた
I have worked myself weary.
さぞお疲れでしょう
You are tired, I dare say.
今日は一日働いて疲れ果てた
I am exhausted―tired out―worn out―used up―done up―knocked up―with the day's exertions.
授業は疲れませんか
Doesn't teaching tire you!―take it out of you?
今日は一日授業をしてすっかり疲れた
I am dead tired―dog-tired―completely done up―from teaching all day.
ヘトヘトに疲れた
I am ready to drop.
綿のように疲れた
I am reduced to pulp.
疲れが出る
Fatigue tells on one's constitution.
旅の疲れ
the fatigues of one's journey―the fatigues of the road
旅をの疲れが今出た
The fatigue of my journey are telling on me.
旅の疲れが出てトロリとした
The fatigues of the road made me drop off into a doze.
景色が好いので旅の疲れを忘れる
The beauty of the scenery makes me forget the fatigues of the road.
長途のお疲れでさぞご難儀でしょう
You must feel the fatigues of your long journey.
旅に疲れた人
a wayworn traveller
昼間の疲れでよく寝ている
The day's fatigue makes him sleep soundly.
疲れを休める
to rest one's wearied limbs―rest oneself
彼は戦いの疲れを休めている
He is resting himself after the fatigues of the last campaign.
疲れが抜けたか
Have you recovered from your fatigue?
まだ疲れが抜けない
I have not recovered from my fatigue yet.
寝ると疲れが抜ける
You will sleep off your fatigue.
夢は五臓の疲れ
Dreams are due to the fatigue of the internal organs.

content:
つかれはてる〔疲れ果てる〕
〈自動〉To be exhausted, be tired out, be worn out, be used up, be done up, be knocked up (with or from toil)

content:

content: 2. (=与える)to give

content.content: これは少ないがお前に遣わす

I will give you a reward―You shall have a reward―I will reward you―You shall be rewarded.

入れて遣わす

賞めて遣わす

許して遣わす

content:
つき〔月〕
〈名〉
1. (=太陰)the moon; Luna:(=の) lunar

content.content: 月が出る
The moon rises―The moon comes up―The moon comes out.
月が出た
The moon has risen―The moon is up.
月が出ている
There is a moon.
いま一時間たてば月が出る
The moon will have risen―The moon will be up―in another hour.
月が引込む

月が引込んだ
The moon has set―The moon is down.
いま一時間たつと月が入る
The moon will have gone down―The moon will be down―in another hour.
月が山の端から出る
The moon comes out from behind a mountain.
月が山の端に入る
The moon goes down behind a mountain.
月が無くて真暗だ
The night is moonless and dark.
今日は幾日目の月か
How old is the moon?
十日目の月だ
The moon is ten days old―It is a ten-day-old moon.
三日月
the new moon―the crescent
三日月が出ている
There is a new moon.
十五夜の月
the full moon
月は満月だ
The moon is at the full―There is a full moon.
まんまるい月
a full-orbed moon
有明の月
a waning moon
月が満ちて欠ける
The moon waxes and wanes.
月が冴える
The moon shines bright.
冴えた月、冴え渡った月
a bright moon―a clear moon―an effulgent moon
月が澄む
The moon shines serene.
澄んだ月、澄み渡った月
a serene moon
今夜は月が好い
The moon is bright tonight.
昨夜は読書のできるような好い月だった
Last night the noon was so bright that one could have read by its light.
月が雲に隠れる

月が雲に隠れている
The moon is behind a cloud.
月が雲の蔭から出る

花の顔{かんばせ}月の眉

content:
つき〔就き〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=関して)about (the matter); on (the subject); as to (who or what); regarding; respecting; concerning; touching; in regard to, with regard to; in respect to, with respect to; in reference to, with reference to; as for; as regards; in connection with

content.content: 彼の件に就き御照会申上候
I beg to inquire of you about the matter―regarding the matter―respecting the matter―concerning the matter―touching the matter.
この件に就き御相談致したい
I wish to consult with you about the matter―in regard to the matter―in respect to the matter―in reference to the matter.
例の件に就き参上致す可く候
I shall call on you about the matter―with regard to the matter―with respect to the matter―with reference to the matter.
彼の件に就き御心配は御無用に候
As regards that matter,―As for that matter,―you need not make yourself uneasy about it.
このたびの試験につき重大事件出来せり
In connection with the examination, a serious affair has arisen.

content: 2. (=ゆえに、ために)on account of; owing to; in view of; in honour of; on the occasion of

content.content: 流行性感冒猖獗に就き一週間休業す

氏の結婚につき披露会が催された

3.

content.content: つきあう〔付き合う〕

付き合いが狭い

content: 2. (=お付き合い)company:(=する) to bear (one) company; to keep (one) company

content.content: 僕もお付き合いしよう
I will bear you company―keep you company.
お付き合いに僕も行こう

途中までお付き合いしよう

お付き合いに僕も買った

酒ならお付き合いしよう

そのお付き合いはまっぴらだ
I won't go with you in that.

content: 3. (=付き合いの物入り)social expenses

content.content: 仲間の付き合いがあるからとても二百円ではやりきれない
I can not possibly get along on 200 yen a month, for I have social expenses to meet.

content:
つきあう〔付き合う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=交る)to associate with (one); to keep company with (one); to hold intercourse with (one); to have relations with (one); to consort with (one); to deal with (people); to dine with (lords); to mix with (the multitude); to go with (a set); to live with (foreigners); to move among (men); to move in (a sphere)

content.content: 道徳標準の低い人と付き合うものでない
You should not associate with―keep company with―men of low moral standards.
彼は善い人と付き合っている

悪い者と付き合うな
Avoid bad company.
彼は西洋人と多く付き合っている
He lives much with foreigners.
貴族と付き合っている
He dines with lords.
目上の人と付き合っている
He moves among his superiors.
彼は付き合う社会が違う
He moves in another sphere.
僕はあの連中と付き合わない
I do not go with that set.
君はあの人と付き合ったことがあるか
Have you had any relations with him?
彼と付き合ったことが無い
I never had any relations with him.
彼はあまり人と付き合わない
He generally keeps to his own company―keeps to himself―keeps aloof from society.
彼とは親しく付き合っている
I am in intimate relations with him―on intimate terms with him.
彼は人と深く付き合わない

(彼と深くは付き合わないが)付き合ってみたところでは別に変わったところは無いようだ

人と正直に付き合うものだ

人と美しく付き合うものだ

彼と付き合う者が無い

あんな奴とは付き合わない

付き合ってあんな面白い人は無い
He is the height of good company.
付き合ってみると面白い人だ

あの人は付き合って面白くない

彼は至って付き合いやすい人だ

付き合いにくい人だ

content:

〈他動〉To present (a pistol at one); to thrust (anything) in one's face; to flash (a sword) in one's face; to shake (one's fist) in one's face; to fling (a fault) in one's face; to cast (a fault) in one's teeth; to confront (one with a witness or proofs)

content.content: 強盗は主人の胸先にピストルをつきつけて脅迫した

彼の過失をつきつけて責めた

content:

〈名〉
1. (=月と日、時日)months and days; time

content.content: 月日が経つ
Time passes―Time elapses―Time goes on―Time goes by.
月日のたつのが早い
Time flies―Swift is the flight of time.
月日がたつのに従って決心が堅くなった
As time went by, my resolution became firmer―My resolution became firmer with the lapse of time―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Time made my resolution firmer.
月日がたつにつれて悲しみが薄らいだ
As time went on, my grief subsided―My grief subsided with the lapse of time―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Time blunted the edge of my grief.
月日を送る
to live―lead a life―pass one's time
未亡人はさびしい月日を送っている
The widow leads a lonely life.
いたずらに月日を送る
to live to no purpose
いたずらに月日を送るものでない
You should live to some purpose.
夢のように月日を送る
to dream away one's time
遊んで月日を送る
to idle away one's time
月日に関守り無く早や十年の昔となった
Time rolls on its ceaseless course, and ten years have elapsed.
運と月日は末を待て
The wheel of Fortune turns round.

content: 2. (=運星)the star presiding over one's destiny; one's star

content:
つきまとう〔付き纏う〕
〈他動〉To pursue (a woman); to shadow (one); to follow (one) about; to dangle after or about (a girl); to hang on (one); to fasten on (one); to fix oneself on (a person)

content.content: 女につきまとう
to pursue a woman―dangle after a girl―dangle about a girl
あの女には若い男が始終つきまとっている
She always has some young men dangling after her.
あの男はさかりのついた犬のようにあの女につきまとっている

あれからこっち不運につきまとわれた
I have been pursued by misfortune ever since.
彼は外出するときっと探偵につきまとわれる
He can not go without being shadowed by a detective.
スリが好いカモだと思って彼につきまとった
A pickpocket fastened on him as an easy prey.
水雷艇が終夜敵艦隊につきまとった
The torpedo-boats fixed themselves on the enemy fleet―hung on the rear of the enemy fleet―all the night through.
子どもが始終お母さんにつきまとっている
The child is constantly hanging on mamma.
あそこへ行くと乞食がうるさくつきまとう
You are bothered by beggars there.

content:
つきもの〔付き物〕
〈名〉
1. (=付属物)(colour is) an adjunct (of matter); (a tail is) an appendage (to an animal); (a tool is) an appurtenance (of one's trade); (a machine has many) accessories or attachments
2. (=付いて離れぬ物)something inseparable; a thing commonly associated with another; a thing that always goes with another:(人なら)a fixture:(癖などなら)a besetting sin

content.content: 癖は天才の付きものだ
Eccentricities are inseparable from genius.
あの女優は帝劇の付きものだ
That actress is a fixture of the Imperial Theatre.
書生に貧乏は付きものだ
Student life is associated with poverty―Poverty goes with student life―A student is always poor.
あの人の貧乏は付きものだ
Poverty is his besetting sin.
女に虚栄は付きものだ
Vanity is woman's besetting sin.
成り金に自動車は付きものだ
Upstarts and motor-cars are inseparable.
日本画の梅と鶯は付きものだ
The warbler is associated with the plum-blossoms in Japanese art.
あの女には悪い付きものがある
She has a bully at her back.
あの芸者には付きものがある
