つきよ〔月夜〕
〈名〉A moonlight night; a moonlit night

content.content: 今夜は月夜だ
There is a moon tonight.
好い月夜だ
There is a bright moon.
月夜の散歩
a walk in the moonlight
月夜の蟹は肉が無い
The crabs are lean when there is a moon.
月夜ばかりは無いからそう思え
Beware of dark nights!
月夜に釜を抜かれる
to be hoodwinked
月夜鳥
crows cawing in the moonlight

content:
つきる〔尽きる〕
〈自動〉
1. To become exhausted; to spend itself; to be spent; to be used up; to be played out; to run out; to give out; to end; to come to an end; to come to the end of (one's tether); to fail; to be out; to be up

content.content: 手段が尽きた
I have exhausted all means―I have played my last card.
金が尽きた
My money is out―My money has run out―I have run out of money―My money has come to an end―I have come to the end of my money.
智慧が尽きた
I have come to the end of my resources―come to my wits' end―I am at the end of my resources―at my wits' end―driven to my wits' end―reduced to my wits' end.
百計尽きていかんともするあたわず
I am reduced to my wits' end―driven to my last shifts.
兵糧が尽きた
Provisions have given out―run out―We have run out of provisions.
力が尽きた
My strength is exhausted―My strength fails me.
彼は力尽きて倒れた
His strength failed him, and he sank to the ground.
途中で力が尽きて倒れた者がある
Some gave out on the way.
暴風雨の力が尽きる
A storm will spend itself.
風力が尽きた
The storm is spent―The storm has spent itself―The storm has raged itself out―The wind has blown itself out.
怒るだけ怒らせると勢が尽きてしまう
His rage will spend itself.
弾薬が尽きた
The ammunition is exhausted―all spent―The ammunition has run out―We have run out of ammunition.
酒が尽きた
The wine is out.
時間が尽きた
The time is up.
地球の石炭がいまに尽きる
It will not be long before the earth's supply of coal runs out―gives out.
気根が尽きた
My energy is exhausted.
材料が尽きた
The materials are exhausted―used up.
種が尽きた
The country is played out.
彼は書く種が尽きた
He has written himself out.
話の種が尽きた
We have exhausted the topics of conversation.
それは町はずれの家の尽きる所だ
It is on the outskirts of the town, where the houses end.
力の尽きた玉
a spent ball
生産力の尽きた土地
effete land
勢力の尽きた国民
an effete people
尽きぬ
to be inexhaustible―exhaustless―endless―never failing―never wanting
話の種は尽きぬ
Topics for conversation are never wanting.
自然の富源は尽きぬ
Natural resources are inexhaustible―There is no end of natural resources―“There is as good fish in the sea as ever came out of it.”
その地方は石炭が尽きない
The country has an inexhaustible supply of coal.
あの人は金が尽きない(いくらでも金がある)
He has no end of money.
専門の研究は愉快が尽きぬ
The special study of any subject is a never-failing source of pleasure.
世に盗人の種は尽きまじ
The world will never be free from robbers.
いつまで話しても話が尽きぬ
You may talk all night, and yet have as much to say to each other as ever.
いつまで話ても名残りは尽きぬ
You may talk all night, and yet be as sorry to part as ever.
尽きぬ名残りを惜しむ
to have endless sorrow at parting

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 汝の命数尽きなんとす
Thy days are numbered.
その頃は旅順の命数は尽きかかっていた
The days of Port Arthur were numbered.
我が命数尽きぬ(時節到来)
My time has come―My hour has struck.
彼は命数が尽きたのだからしかたがない
His race is run―His career is run.
彼は運が尽きた
He is doomed―His doom is sealed―His fate is sealed―His star has set.
運の尽きた国
a doomed country―a devoted land
運の尽きた人
a doomed man―a devoted head

content:
つきわり〔月割〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: げっぷ〔月賦〕

content:
つく〔就く〕
〈他動〉
1.

content.content: 教師に就く、先生に就く
to study under a teacher―study with a teacher―have a teacher
君は誰に就いて英語を学んだか
Under whom did you study English?―With whom did you study English?―(普通は)―Who taught you English?
君は西洋人に就いたことがあるか
Have you ever had a foreign teacher?
僕の就いた西洋人はあなたが初めてである
You are the first foreign teacher I ever had.
任に就く、職に就く
to take office―assume an office―take up one's office―take up a post―enter upon one's office―be installed in one's office―be inaugurated
職務に就く
to enter upon one's duties
職業に就く
to enter a profession―take to an occupation―take up a calling―engage in a business
彼は何職にも就いておらぬ
He is out of employment―at a loose end.
官途に就く
to enter government service
彼は官途に就いている
He is in government service―He holds a post under government.
実業に就く
to go into business
同窓の中には官途に就いた者もあり実業に就いた者もある
Some of my fellow-students are in government service, and the others in business.
定業に就く
to settle down to a regular occupation
正業に就く
to return to honest life―become an honest man
彼はばくちを止めて正業に就いている
He has given up gambling, and leads an honest life―lives on the square.
彼は職を辞して閑地に就いた
He has resigned his office, and retired to private life.
食卓に就く
to sit down to table
一座は食卓に就いている
The company are at table.
食事に就く
to sit down to one's dinner ［breakfast, lunch, supper］
一座は食事に就いている
The company are at breakfast―at lunch―at dinner―at supper.
床に就く
to go to bed―retire to repose―turn in―(病気でなら)―take to one's bed
家族は床に就いている
The family are in bed―snug in bed.
彼は病気で床に就いている
He is ill abed―confined to his bed―laid up with an illness―laid by the heels―He must keep his bed―He lies on a bed of illness.
久しく床に就いている
He is bedridden.
眠りに就く
to go to sleep
席に就く
to take one's seat―take one's place―take a chair
皆様お席にお就き下さい
Please take your seats!―Pray be seated!
皆席に就いた
They are all seated.
会長が席に就く
The president takes the chair.
誰が会長の席に就いているか
Who is in the chair?
部署に就く
to go to quarters
部署に就けー(号令)
To quarters!
部署に就けと号令する(もとは太鼓を用いしより)
to beat to quarters
皆銘々の部署に就いている
They are each at his post.
列に就く
to fall in―fall into line
縛に就く
to be arrested―be apprehended―be caught―be taken
犯人は未だ縛に就かず
The culprit is not yet apprehended―still at large.
帰途に就く
to start for home―start on one's return
牝鶏が巣に就く
A hen broods―incubates―sits on eggs.
この牝鶏は巣に就きたがっている
The hen wants to sit.
牝鶏は巣に就いている
The hen is sitting―brooding.
巣に就いている牝鶏
a brooding hen

content:
つく〔衝く〕
〈他動〉To strike; to attack

content.content: 中堅を衝く
to attack the main body―(研究のなら)―strike at the heart―(病のなら)―strike at the root of the evil
敵の背後を衝く
to attack the enemy in the rear―strike the enemy in the rear―take the enemy in the rear
嘘を衝く
to take the enemy unawares―take the enemy at vantage
激浪天を衝く
The raging waters rise sky-high.
雲衝くばかりの大男
He is a towering figure―a giant―a colossus.
雨を衝いて進む
We pushed on in spite of the rain―in the teeth of the rain.
臭気鼻を衝く
A vile smell greets the nose.

content:
つく〔即く〕
〈他動〉To accede (to the throne)

content.content: 位に即く、帝位に即く
to accede to the throne―come to the throne

content:
つく〔築く〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: きずく〔築く〕

content:
つく〔着く〕
〈自動〉To arrive (at a station―in Tokyo):(先方へ着く)to reach (a place); to get to (a place)

content.content: 東京に(上野に)着いた時は十二時過ぎであった
It was past twelve when I arrived in Tokyo―when I arrived at Ueno.
東京に着いた時
When I arrived in Tokyo,―On my arrival in Tokyo,...
彼は今頃は京都へ着いたろう
He must have reached Kyoto by this.
今たったら何時に着きましょうか
If I start now, what time shall I arrive?
目的地に着く
to reach one's destination―get to one's journey's end
我が家に着く
to get home
もうじきに着きます
We shall get there very soon.
サア名古屋に着きました
Here we are at Nagoya.
汽車が停車場に着く
A train arrives at a station.
汽車はもう三十分で着く
The train will arrive in half an hour―The train is due in half an hour.
汽車が着いた
The train has arrived―The train is in.
船が港に着く
A ship arrives in port―makes port.
船はもう着く頃だ
The ship ought to arrive by this―The ship is already due.
船が着いた
The boat has arrived―The boat is in.
宿屋に着く
to put up at a hotel
馬車が玄関に着く
A carriage pulls up at the door.
馬車が威勢好く玄関に着く
A carriage dashes up to the door.
救命艇が無事に陸に着いた
The life-boat came safe to land.
船は桟橋に着いている
The ship is lying alongside the pier.
舟が岸に着く
A boat touches the shore.
思いの岸に着く
to reach the goal of one's wishes
(深くて)足が底に着かない
I do not touch bottom―touch ground.

content:
つく〔漬く〕
〈自動〉To be seasoned

content.content: 漬物はまだ漬かない
The pickles are not yet seasoned.
もう漬いた
They are already seasoned.

content:
つく〔点く〕
〈自動〉To be lighted

content.content: ランプがついた
The lamps are lighted―The lamp are alight.
灯火がついている
A light is burning.
蝋燭がついている
The candles are lighted―The candles are burning.
ガスがついている
Gas is lighted―Gas is on.
電灯がついている
The electric lights are on.
この葉巻は火がつかない
These cigars do not light.
このマッチはつかない
These matches do not catch.

content:
つく〔吐く〕
〈他動〉
1.

content.content: 息をつく
to breathe―draw breath
彼はまだ息をついている
He is still breathing―still alive.
ひと息つく
to take breath―take a rest
坂の中段で一息ついた
We took a rest when half-way up the slope.
(安心して)ほっと一息ついた
I drew a long breath―gave a sigh of relief―breathed freely.
息もつかずに駆けつけた
I ran to the scene without stopping to draw breath.
息もつかずに飲み干す
to drain a cup without stopping for breath
肩で息をつく
to breathe with difficulty
鼻で息をつく
to breathe through the nose
鼻を曲げても息をつく
to live by hook or by crook
もう三百円有ると息がつける
Three hundred yen more would relieve me―help me out of the difficulty.
ため息をつく
to sigh―heave a sigh―fetch a sigh
深いため息をつく
to heave a deep sigh―sigh a deep sigh
嘘をつく
to lie―tell a lie―utter a falsehood―draw on imagination
彼は嘘をつくような人でない
He is not the man to tell a lie―He is above telling a lie.
嘘をつくくらいは平気だ
He makes nothing of lying―He will not stick at lying.
言うことが無くなると嘘をつく
When facts fail, he draws on imagination.
彼は嘘をつくことが上手だ(下手だ)
He has a good imagination―a poor imagination.
反吐をつく
to vomit―puke―spew―spue―throw up―cast up―fetch up

content:
つく〔撞く〕
〈他動〉To strike

content.content: 鐘を撞く
to toll the bell―ring the bell

content:
つく〔突く〕
〈他動〉To thrust; to poke; to prod; to strike; to stab

content.content: 剣で突く
to thrust at a man―lunge at a man―stick a rapier through a man―stick a man with rapier
短刀で突く
to stab a man (with a dagger)
槍で突く
to spear a man
銃剣で突く
to bayonet a man
角で突く
(牛なら)to horn a man―gore a man―toss a man―(山羊などなら)―butt a man
針で突く
to prick a finger
棒で突く
to poke anything with a rod
杖で突く
to poke anything with a stick―prod one with a stick
喉を突く
to cut one's throat―slit one's weasand
心臓を突く
to strike one to the heart
羽根を突く
to play (at) battledore and shuttlecock
玉を突く
to play (at) billiards
杖えつく
to walk with a cane
肘を突く
to rest one's elbow on the table
頬杖つく
to rest one's chin on one's hand
手をつく
to put one's hands on the ground
手をついて謝れ
Down on your knees!
手をついて頼む
to beg on one's knees
胸を突くような急な坂
a steep slope―a precipitious slope―an abrupt acclivity―a vertical ascent

content:
つく〔付く〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=くっつく、付着する、付属する)to stick to, adhere to (anything); to attach oneself to, be attached to (anything); to belong to (anything)

content.content: この封筒の糊は付かない
This envelope will not stick.
このバタは歯の裏に付く
This butter sticks to the back of the teeth.
悪名は付いて離れぬ
An evil name will stick fast to you―stick to you like a burr.
手紙は付箋が付いて返って来た
The letter returned with a tag attached to it.
犬は人に付き猫は家に付く
A dog attaches himself to his master; a cat attaches herself to the house.
家には厩が付いている
A stable is attached to the house.
馬には鞍が付いている
There is a saddle to the horse―(鞍が置いてあるの意味なら)―The horse is saddled.
馬車に馬が付いている
Are the horses put to (the carriage)?
箱に鍵が付いている
There is a key to the box―The box has a key to it.
この鍵はこの箱に付いているのだ
This key belongs to this box.
君の顔に墨が付いている
Your face is stained with ink―There is an ink-stain on your face.
着物に血が付いている
The clothes are stained with blood.
血の付いた着物を彼に突き付けてやった
I thrust the blood-stained clothes in his face.
着物に垢が付いている
The clothes are soiled with dirt.
悪銭身に付かず
“Ill-gotten wealth does not prosper”―“Ill-got, ill-spent.”
あぶく銭は身に付かぬ
“Lightly got, lightly spent”―“Lightly come, lightly go.”

content: 2. (=付き随う、随行する、随従する、護衛する、後を付ける)to follow (one's leader); to accompany (one's friend); to attend on (one's master); to escort (a carriage); to shadow (a man)

content.content: 主人の供に付く
to attend on one's master
病人には看護婦が付いている
A nurse attends on the invalid―The invalid is attended by a nurse.
彼は通訳官になって軍に付いた
He followed the army as interpreter.
この犬はどこまでも僕に付いて来る
My dog follows me everywhere.
彼は友人が付いて来た
He came accompanied by a friend.
お嬢さんには女中が付いている
The young lady is attended by a maid―A maid is in attendance on the young lady.
彼は使節に付いて欧米に渡った
He went to Europe and America in attendance on the Envoy.
彼は大使の一行に付いて洋行した
He went abroad with the Embassy.
葬式には儀仗兵が付いた
The funeral was attended by a guard of honour.
御馬車には前後に護衛の騎兵が付く
The Imperial carriage is escorted by cavalry in front and rear.
あの人は外出するときっと探偵が付く
He can not go out of doors without being shadowed by a detective.
彼は西洋人に付いて満蒙を旅行した
He has travelled in Manchuria and Mongolia in attendance on a foreigner―with a foreigner.
母に付いてよく芝居へ行った
I used to go to the play with mother.
君は早くて僕には付いて行けない
I can not keep up with you, you walk so fast.
級に付いていけるか
Can you keep up with your class?
人の下に付く
to work under a man―hold a subordinate position―play second fiddle
彼は大将に付いて諸方に転戦した
He took part in various battles under the general.
狂人には番人が付いている
The madman is (placed) under a keeper.
捕虜には番兵が付いている
The prisoners are (placed) under guard.
あの人には三井が付いている
He has the Mitsuis at his back.
わたしには好い人が付いていますよ
I have a good man at my back.
あの女は悪い者が付いている
She has a bully at her back.

content: 3. (=何伝いに行く)to follow (a street); to go along (a bank)

content.content: この土手について行くと橋が有ります
If you go along this bank, you will see a bridge.
この通りについて行くと停車場の前に出ます
If you follow this street, you will find yourself in front of the station.
この塀について曲るとその横町です
If you go along this wall and turn the corner, you will find yourself in the alley.

content: 4. (=加盟する)to join (a party); to come over to (our side); to go over to (the enemy)

content.content: 賊軍に付く
to join the rebels
彼は味方に付いた
He has joined our party―come over to our side.
敵に付いた
He has gone over to the enemy―deserted to the enemy.

content: 5. (=いくらに付く)to cost (one so much); to stand (one) in (so much)

content.content: この羅紗はヤール十円についております
This stuff costs us ten yen a yard―stands us in ten yen a yard.
この品は高くつきます
This article comes high.
下手な倹約をするとかえって高いものにつくことがある
Bad economy may cost you dear―You may have to pay dear for bad economy.
利が付く
to bear interest―carry interest―draw interest
公債には五分の利が付く
The bonds bear interest at 5 percent.
証券には日付の日から利子が付く
The bonds draw interest from its date.
借金には利息が付く
A debt must be paid with interest.
利息の付く金を使っている
I must use money at interest.
癖が付く
to get into a habit―fall into a habit―acquire a habit―contract a habit
この子は嘘をつく癖が付いた
The child has fallen into the habit of telling lies.
悪い癖は付きやすいが善い癖は付きにくい
Bad habits are easy to contract, but good habits are hard to acquire.
悪い癖は付きやすく直り難い
Bad habits are easy to get into and hard to get rid of.
根が付く
to take root
柳の枝はじきに根が付く
A willow twig soon takes root.
冗談に挿した柳が付いたじゃないか
The willow-cutting I put in in joke, hasn't it taken root?
接ぎ木が付いた
The graft has taken.
種痘が付いた
The vaccine has taken.
火が付く
to catch fire
子どもの着物に火が付いた
The child's clothes caught fire―The fire caught the child's clothes.
たちまち隣家に火が付いた
The neighbouring house soon caught fire―The fire soon spread to the neighbouring house.
跡が付く
to leave a mark
足跡が付く
to leave foot-marks
縁側に足跡が付いている
There are footprints on the verandah.
雪が降ると足跡が付く
The snow show footprints.
本には指の跡が付いている
The book is well thumbed.
実が付く
to bear fruit
この梨の木は今年はだいぶ付いた
The pear-tree has borne well this year.
花が付く
to bear flowers
牡丹にはだいぶ蕾が付いている
The peony has many flower-buds.
肉が付く
to gain flesh―gather flesh―put on flesh
この食物は力が付く
The food gives strength―It is a strength-giving food.
この本は力が付く
The book has a training virtue.
英語の力が付く
to improve in English―become proficient in English
智慧が付く
to grow wiser―grow in wisdom―(子どもなら)―grow in intelligence
分別が付く
to attain one's years of discretion―cut one's wisdom-teeth
虫が付く
to breed worms
木に虫が付いた
Worms are eating up the leaves of the tree.
畑に虫が付いた
There are worms in the garden.
稲に虫が付いた
The rice-plants are suffering from insect-pest.
あの娘に虫が付いている
The girl has a lover.
砂糖に蟻が付く
Ants gather about the sugar.
羽織に紋が付いている
The coat bears a crest.
器具には皆定紋が付いている
The utensils all bear the family-crest.
古びが付く、錆が付く
to acquire an antique look
器物に古びが付いた
The utensils have got an antique look.
庭にだいぶ錆が付いた
The garden has acquired quite an antique look.
名が付く
to bear a name―be named
あの人は唐辛という綽名が付いている
He is nicknamed “Pepper”.
まだ病名が付かぬ
The disease is not yet located―The disease is not yet diagnosed.
買い手が付く
to find a buyer
家は買い手が付いた
The house has found a buyer.
あの男は買い手が付かぬ
He can not find a market for his talents.
あの店は安いから客が付く
The shop draws customers―draws custom―by selling cheap.
目に付く
to catch the eye―strike the eye
あの建物は目に付く
The building strikes the eye―It is a striking building―a conspicuous building.
鼻に付く
to stink in one's nostrils
同じ物ばかりだと鼻に付く
One grows weary of the same thing...
同じ物ばかりだと鼻に付くから何か変わった物にしよう
Let us have something else for a change.
目鼻が付く
to take shape―touch ground―materialize
話に目鼻が付くまで黙っておれ
Keep silent till the plan takes shape.
(漠然とした事件に)やっと目鼻が付いて来た
We have touched ground at last.
先方の相談にはまだ目鼻が付かない
Their proposal has not materialized yet.
手が付く
to be touched
手が付かない
to remain untouched―be left untouched
資本に手が付かない
The capital is left untouched―left intact.
仕事が手に付かない
I can not go about my work―I go about my work mechanically.
沖で櫓橈が手に付かぬ
I can not work the ship at sea.
お手が付いた
He has had connection with her.
足がつく
A crime or a criminal is traced.
犯人は前橋まで足がついた
The culprit has been traced as far as Maebashi.
何から足がつく
Something puts the police on the scent.
質に入れた時計から足がついた
The watch he pawned put the police on the scent.
気がつく
to notice―remark―perceive―become aware of a fact
大勢いたから気がつかなかった
I did not notice him in the crowd.
汽車を乗り違えて一時間経ってからようやく気がついた
I took the wrong train by mistake, and it was an hour before I became aware of it.
正気がつく
to come to (oneself)
冷たい風に当たって正気がついた
The old air brought me to (myself).
酒を飲むと元気がつく
Wine exhilarates.
話がつく
to come to an understanding―come to terms
思案がついた
I have thought of a plan.
見込みがついた
I have formed an opinion―formed an estimate.
判断がつく、鑑定がつく
to form a judgment
どこへ行ったか見当がつかぬ
I can not guess where he can have gone.
この英語には訳が付かない
This English phrase can not be translated.
つかぬことを言うようだが今帝劇で何をやっているかね
By the bye, what are they performing at the Imperial Theatre?
鳬{けり}がつく
to come to an end―be brought to a termination―be brought to a conclusion

content:
つく〔憑く〕
〈他動〉To possess (a man); to haunt (a man)

content.content: 狐に憑かれる
to be possessed with a fox
彼は怨霊が憑いている
He is haunted by the furies of his victim.

content:
つく〔搗く〕
〈他動〉To pound (rice); to hull (barley); to stamp (ore)

content.content: 杵で搗く
to pound with a pestle
臼で搗く
to pound in a mortar
米を搗く
to clean rice
米を搗くと一俵の前で五升の減りが立つ
In cleaning rice, there is a loss of five sho per bag.
麦を搗く
to hull barley
餅を搗く
to pound rice-cake
粉を搗く
to pound rice into flour

content:
つぐ〔継ぐ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=職を継ぐ)to succeed (to one's office―one in one's office)

content.content: 彼は僕の職を継いだ
He succeeded to my office―succeeded me in my office.
彼は父の芸名を継いで六代目菊五郎となった
He succeeded to his father's nom de guerre, and became Kikugoro the Sixth.
彼は小村氏の職を継いで外務大臣の椅子に坐した
He succeeded Mr. Komura (in his office) as Foreign Minister.
兄が死んで弟が継いで立った
The elder brother died, and was succeeded by the younger brother.
彼は爵位を継ぐべき嗣子が無い
He has no heir to his title.
位を継ぐ
to accede to the throne―come to the throne―(は順に位に即く、継位が問題になれば)―succeed to the throne
父の志を継ぐ
to tread in one's father's footsteps―follow in the footsteps of one's father

content: 2. (=何に続く)to succeed; to follow

content.content: 夜は日に継ぐ
Night follows day―Night succeeds day.
夜を日に継いで働く
to work night and day―work double tides―work double hours
馬を継ぐ
to relay horses
炭を継ぐ
to put more charcoal on the fire―feed the fire with charcoal

content: 3. (=つぎを当てる)to patch

content.content: 破れをつぐ
to patch a rent
ボロをつぐ
to patch up rags

content:
つぐ〔嗣ぐ〕
〈他動〉To succeed (one's father―to the property); to accede to, come to (one's property); to inherit (the property)

content.content: 父の後を嗣ぐ
to succeed one's father
弥太郎死して弥之助これを嗣ぐ
Yataro died, and was succeeded by Yanosuke.
跡を嗣ぐ
(子が父の跡を嗣げば)to accede to one's property―come to one's property―(相続が問題になれば)―succeed to the property
父が死んで彼が跡を嗣いだ
When his father died, he came to his property―At the death of his father, he acceded to his property.
彼が死んだら誰が跡を嗣ぐか
When he dies, who will succeed to the property?
彼は子が無いので甥に跡を嗣がせた
He died without issue, and his nephew succeeded to his property.
位を嗣ぐ
to accede to the throne―come to the throne―(は順に位に即く、継位が問題になれば)―succeed to the throne

content:
つぐ〔次ぐ、亜ぐ〕
〈他動〉To be next to, come next to, rank next to (something); to be second to (something); to come after (something)

content.content: ニューヨークは大きさに於てロンドンに次ぐ
New York is next to London in size.
海軍力において英国に次ぐ国は?
What country comes next to―ranks next to―England in naval power?
生に次いで愉快なるものは死である
Next to life, death is sweet.
彼は富においては三井岩崎に次ぐのみ
He is second only to the Mitsuis and Iwasakis in wealth.
安田家は三井岩崎に次いでの最大の富豪である
The Yasudas are the greatest millionaires after the Mitsuis and Iwasakis.
この道にかけては彼に次ぐ者は無い
He has no second in the art.

content:
つぐ〔次ぐ、亜ぐ〕
〈他動〉To be next to, come next to, rank next to (something); to be second to (something); to come after (something)

content.content: ニューヨークは大きさに於てロンドンに次ぐ
New York is next to London in size.
海軍力において英国に次ぐ国は?
What country comes next to―ranks next to―England in naval power?
生に次いで愉快なるものは死である
Next to life, death is sweet.
彼は富においては三井岩崎に次ぐのみ
He is second only to the Mitsuis and Iwasakis in wealth.
安田家は三井岩崎に次いでの最大の富豪である
The Yasudas are the greatest millionaires after the Mitsuis and Iwasakis.
この道にかけては彼に次ぐ者は無い
He has no second in the art.

content:
つぐ〔接ぐ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=接合する)to join (one thing to another); to piece on (one thing to another); to piece (broken pieces) together; to put (broken pieces) together; to cement (a broken cup); to splice (ropes); to set (a bone)

content.content: 梯子を接ぐ
to join one ladder to another
卓子を接ぐ
to join the tables end to end
こわれた茶碗を接ぐ
to cement a broken cup―piece the broken pieces together―mend a cup
こわれた茶碗を接いでみる
to put the broken pieces together―(ようなものだ)―“It is no use crying over spilt milk.”
縄を接ぐ
to splice a rope
骨を接ぐ
to set a bone―set a broken bone―set a fracture

content: 2. (=接木する)to graft (a tree―a scion into or on a stock); to ingraft (the scion of one tree into or on another)

content.content: この木は接いである
The tree is grafted.
台木に接ぎ穂を接ぐ
to graft a scion on a stock―ingraft a scion into a stock―insert a graft on a stock
木に竹を接いだよう
They are incongruous―out of keeping with each other.

content:
つぐ〔注ぐ〕
〈他動〉To pour (tea into a cup); to put (water in a kettle); to fill (a glass with wine); to feed (a lamp with oil)

content.content: 茶を注ぐ
to pour out the tea―pour the tea into a cup
酒を注ぐ
to fill one's cup (with wine)―(お酌をするの意味なら)―serve the wine―serve one with wine
お注ぎなさい
Fill your glass!
注いでくれ
Fill me my glass!
注いでお上げ
Full him his glass!―Serve him the wine!
少し注げ
Give me a little!
少し注ぎましょう
I'll serve just a little.
盃に酒をいっぱいに注ぐ
to fill a glass full of wine
いっぱいに注いだ盃(満盃)
a bumper
盃に酒を半分注ぐ
to fill a glass half full of wine
なみなみと注ぐ
to fill a cup to the brim
なみなみと注いだ盃
a brimming cup
花瓶に水を注ぐ
Put some water in the vase!
ランプに油を注ぐ
to fill the lamp with oil―feed the lamp
火鉢に炭を注げ
Put more charcoal on the fire!

content:
つくえ〔机〕
〈名〉A desk; a table

content.content: 机に向かう
to sit down to one's desk―sit at one's desk
彼は一日机に向かって坐っている
He sits at his desk all day.
机を離れたことが無い
He always keeps at his desk.
机に向かって仕事を始める
to sit down to one's work
机にもたれる
to lean on one's desk
机にもたれて居眠りする
to doze on one's desk
それは机の上の議論だ
It is an academic discussion―a mere theory.
机の上の論には用が無い
I have nothing to do with theories.
彼は机の上の軍師だ
He is a closet strategist.

content:
づくし〔尽し〕
〈接尾詞〉All; an exhaustive collection

content.content: 世界国尽し
all the countries of the world
花尽し
an exhaustive collection of flowers

content:
つくす〔尽す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=尽きさす)to exhaust; to come to the end of (anything)

content.content: 資力を尽す
to exhaust one's means
智慧を出し尽す
to exhaust one's resources―come to the end of one's resources―come to one's wits' end
智慧を出し尽した(智慧が尽きた、途方に暮れた)
I am at the end of my resources―at my wits' end.
手を尽す
to exhaust one's means―try every means
あらゆる手段を尽した、百方手を尽した
I have tried every means in my power―left no means untried―left no stones unturned.
全力を尽そう
I will do all I can―do everything in my power―do my best.

content: 2. ［注意］「何々し尽す」を訳すには形容詞(all, every),副詞(up, out),前置詞(through, throughout, over)等を用いる。

content.content: 米を食い尽した
We have eaten all the rice―eaten up the rice.
酒を飲み尽した
We have drunk all the wine―drunk up the wine.
石炭を焚き尽した
We have burnt all the coal―burnt up the coal.
材料を使い尽した
I have used all the materials―used up the materials.
言い尽す
to say everything―leave nothing unsaid
彼らは悪口を言い尽した
They have left no calumny unspoken.
書き尽す
to write everything―leave nothing unwritten
彼は種を書き尽した
He has written himself out.
鉱山を掘り尽した
The mines are worked out.
彼は日本中歩き尽した
He has travelled all over the country―travelled throughout the land―travelled over every part of Japan―travelled over the length and breadth of Japan.
この図書館の本を読み尽した
I have read all the books in the library―exhausted the library.
文学を読み尽す
to range over literature
友人の数を数え尽した
I have boxed the compass of my friends.
芸を仕尽す
to go through one's paces
彼は道楽を仕尽した
He has drained the cup of pleasure to the dregs.
苦労を仕尽した
He has drained the cup of sorrow to the dregs.
(金の有るに任せて)あらゆるぜいたくを仕尽した
He made use of his money to indulge in every conceivable indulgence.
あらゆるばかなことを仕尽した
He has committed every conceivable folly―left no folly uncommitted―completed the sun of follies―run through the catalogue of follies―ranged over the whole gamut of folly.
あらゆる悪いことを仕尽した
He has done every evil deed―left no evil deed undone―completed the list of crimes―run through the catalogue of crimes―ranged over the gamut of crime.

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼の住居は善美を尽している
His residence is sumptuous―of superb beauty.
委曲を尽す
to enter into details―go into particulars
愉快を尽す、歓を尽す
to enjoy oneself―(酒などを飲んでなら)―make merry
充分に歓を尽して散会した
We broke up after enjoying ourselves to the full.
一夜の歓を尽す
to enjoy the evening―make a night of it
人生の歓を尽す
to enjoy life―enjoy the amenities of life
演説は簡にして尽している
The speech was brief and to the point―It was a speech of pith and point.
一言にして尽す
to say all in one word―put the matter in a nutshell
一言にして尽すべし、曰く忍耐
The whole matter may be summed up in one word: Perseverance―Perseverance! The whole matter lies in a nutshell.
一言にして尽せば忍耐あるのみ
In a word, perseverance is the only thing.
このありがたさは言葉に尽せません
My gratitude is beyond my power of expression.
その絶景筆紙に尽し難し
The scenery is beautiful beyond description―The beauty of scenery defies description―baffles description―beggars description.

content: 4. (=果たす)to do (one's duty); to discharge (one's duty)

content.content: 本分を尽す、義務を尽す
to one's duty―discharge one's duty―play one's part
前後を顧みず本文を尽せ
Do your duty, irrespective of the consequences.
人は何と言おうとも僕は尽すべきだけのことを尽す
Whatever others may say, I will do my duty.
それでは尽すべきことが欠ける
Then I shall fail in my duty.
国家に対して義務を尽さなけりゃならぬ
I must do my duty to my country―I owe my duty to my country.
職務を尽す
to discharge one's duties
職分を尽す
to discharge one's functions
任を尽す
to discharge one's trust―acquit oneself
彼は立派に任を尽した
He has acquitted himself to his credit.
礼を尽す
to do one due honour
親切を尽す
to show one kindness
慇懃を尽す
to pay one's attentions―pay one's devoirs―to a person
忠義を尽す
to be faithful to one's master―loyal to one's sovereign
実を尽す
to be faithful―show one's fidelity―to a lover or a mistress
国家に赤誠を尽す
to prove one's devotion to one's country
彼は国家に赤誠を尽している
He is devoted to his country.
人事を尽して天命を待つ
Do your best, and abide by the event.

content: 5. (=尽力する)to exert oneself; to serve (a friend); to do service to, render service to (one's country); to do something for (a man); to devote oneself to (some cause)

content.content: 友人の為に尽す
to serve a friend
人の為に尽す
to serve others
己を棄てて人の為に尽す
to die to oneself and live for others
彼は僕の為に尽してくれた
He has done much for me.
彼は国家の為に大いに尽した
He has done much for his country―He has rendered great service to his country―He deserves well of his country.
正義人道の為に尽す
to labour in the cause of justice and humanity
公益の為に尽す
to labour for the public good
教育の為に尽す
to labour in the cause of education―devote oneself to the cause of education
彼は終生教育の為に尽した
He devoted his life to the cause of education.
力を尽す
to exert oneself―use one's exertions―use one's endeavours―use one's influence
身に及ぶだけを尽そう(全力を尽す)

I will do all I can―do the best I can―do my best―do my utmost―do everything in my power―do all that in me lies―do all that lies in my power―use my best exertions―use my best endeavours―use my utmost endeavours.
全力を尽して働く
to work with all one's might
全心全力を尽して働く
to work with all one's heart and soul
あの人は全心全力を尽して事に当たる人だ
He will go, heart and soul, into the scheme.
全心全力を尽して英語を研究した
I gave myself, body and soul, to the study of English.
心を尽す、身を尽す
to devote oneself to anything
彼は職務に心を尽している
He is devoted to his duties.
彼らは珍客を心を尽してもてなした
They were assiduous in their attentions to their honoured guest.

content:
つくずくし〔土筆〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: つくし〔土筆〕

つくだに〔佃煮〕
〈名〉Fish or vegetables boiled down with soy (sold by pickle-dealers)

content:
つくづく〔熟々〕
〈名〉Intently; intensely; heartily; over and over

content.content: つくづく眺める
to gaze intently (at anything)
老人はその光景をつくづく眺めておった
The old man stood gazing at the scene.
つくづく考える
to think and think―think hard―think a matter over and over―turn a matter over in one's mind
つくづく考えてみたがどうもお受けする気になれぬ
I have thought the matter over and over, but I can't bring myself to accept your offer.
君に言われたことをつくづく考えてみました
I have turned your advice over in my mind.
つくづく考えてしみじみいやになった
I have thought myself sick at heart.
世の中がつくづくいやになった
I am heartily sick of the world.
つくづく感ずる
to feel intensely
貧乏の辛さをつくづく感じた
The hardness of poverty has come home to my heart.

つくつくぼうし
〈名〉A kind of cicada

content:
つくない〔償い〕
〈名〉Compensation, indemnity, indemnification, reparation (for a loss); compensation, reparation, restitution (for injury); atonement, expiation (for a crime); amends, remedy (for a fault)

content.content: ご損の償いとしてこれを取って戴きたい
You must accept this present in compensation for your loss.
これで充分罪の償いになる
This is sufficient atonement for my crime―sufficient expiation for my sin.
怠けた償いに勉強する
I will work hard to make amends for my past idleness.

content:
つぐない〔償い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: つくない〔償い〕

content:
つくなう〔償う〕
〈他動〉To compensate (for a loss―one for a loss); to indemnify (one for a loss); to make up for (a loss); to make good (a loss); to repair, make reparation for (a loss); to make reparation for, make restitution for (injury); to retrieve (a loss); to cover (a loss―the expenses); to pay (the cost); to make amends for (a fault); to offset (a fault); to atone for (a crime); to expiate (a sin)

content.content: 損を償う
to compensate for a loss―make up for a loss―make good a loss―repair a loss―make reparation for a loss―retrieve a loss―cover a loss
ご損をかけたなら償います
I will compensate you―indemnify you―for any loss you may sustain.
損害を償う
to compensate one for damages―make reparation for injury―make restitution for injury
事業は費用を償って余り有る
The enterprise more than covers the expenses―more than pays the cost.
収支償う
The profits cover the expenses.
この商売は収支償うか
Does the business pay?
収支償わぬ
It does not pay―The profits do not cover the expenses―“The game is not worth the candle.”
どうかして収支を償わす
I manage to meet the expenses―clear the expenses―make both ends meet.
損益相償う
The profits cover the losses.
得失相償う
The advantages cover the disadvantages.
長短相償う
The merits offset the faults.
罪を償う
to atone for a crime―expiate a sin―make amends for a fault
前過を償う
to atone for the past―make amends for one's past faults
こわしたら償わせるぞ
If you break it, you must make good the loss―I will put it down to your account.
人もし名誉を失わば何をもってこれを償わん
What can compensate for the loss of honour?

content:
つぐなう〔償う〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: つくなう〔償う〕

つくねいも〔つくね芋〕
〈名〉A kind of yam

つくねる〔捏る〕
〈他動〉To knead

content:
つくねんと〔ツクネンと〕
〈副〉Listlessly; blankly; vacantly; absently; absent-mindedly; in a fit of abstraction

content.content: 彼は窓に向かってツクネンと空を眺めている
He sits at the window, looking listlessly into the void.

content:
つくねんと〔ツクネンと〕
〈副〉Listlessly; blankly; vacantly; absently; absent-mindedly; in a fit of abstraction

content.content: 彼は窓に向かってツクネンと空を眺めている
He sits at the window, looking listlessly into the void.

つくばう〔蹲う〕
〈自動〉To crouch; to squat

つぐみ〔鶫〕
〈名〉The ousel; the fieldfare

content:
つぐむ〔噤む〕
〈他動〉To shut (one's mouth)

content.content: 口をつぐむ
to shut one's mouth
口をつぐんで言わず
He held his tongue―held his peace.

content:
つくり〔作り、造り〕
〈名〉
1. (=造り工合、出来工合)make; build

content.content: 道具は木口は好いが作りが悪い
The furniture is good in material, but bad in make―of bad make―badly made.
小作りの女だ
She is a woman of slight build.
頑丈な造りの男だ
He is a man of solid build―a man of stout build.
煉瓦造り
a house built of brick―a brick-house

content: 2. (=化粧)toilet; get-up:(役者のは)make-up

content.content: 姐さんはお作りをしている
She is at her toilet.
あの女はお作りすると好い
Toilet improves her.
あの娘はお作りをしているから綺麗だ
Her get-up makes her pretty.
いま一人の娘はお作りをしないでも綺麗だ
The other girl is pretty without any get-up.
あの女は作りが若過ぎる
She gets herself up too young.
あの男(女)は作りが派手だ
He is showity dressed―She dresses gaily.
あの役者は作りが上手だ
He is good at make-up.

content: 3. (=刀の拵え)mounting

content.content: 金作りの刀
a gold-mounted sword

content:
つくり〔作り、造り〕
〈名〉
1. (=造り工合、出来工合)make; build

content.content: 道具は木口は好いが作りが悪い
The furniture is good in material, but bad in make―of bad make―badly made.
小作りの女だ
She is a woman of slight build.
頑丈な造りの男だ
He is a man of solid build―a man of stout build.
煉瓦造り
a house built of brick―a brick-house

content: 2. (=化粧)toilet; get-up:(役者のは)make-up

content.content: 姐さんはお作りをしている
She is at her toilet.
あの女はお作りすると好い
Toilet improves her.
あの娘はお作りをしているから綺麗だ
Her get-up makes her pretty.
いま一人の娘はお作りをしないでも綺麗だ
The other girl is pretty without any get-up.
あの女は作りが若過ぎる
She gets herself up too young.
あの男(女)は作りが派手だ
He is showity dressed―She dresses gaily.
あの役者は作りが上手だ
He is good at make-up.

content: 3. (=刀の拵え)mounting

content.content: 金作りの刀
a gold-mounted sword

content:
つくり〔旁〕
〈名〉The body (of a Chinese character)

content.content: 字の偏と旁
the radical and body of a character

つくりあげる〔作り上げる〕
〈他動〉To finish; to complete

content:
つくりかえ〔作り替え〕
〈名〉
1. Adaptation:(=る) to adapt

content.content: この小説は Dumas の“Monte Cristo”の作り替えだ
This novel is adapted from Duma's “Monte Cristo.”
小説を演劇に作り替える
to convert a novel into a drama―dramatize a novel

content: 2. (=詩や歌のこっけい作り替え)a parody; a burlesque:(=る) to parody; to burlesque

content.content: 忠臣蔵の作り替え
the Chushingura burlesqued

つくりがお〔作り顔〕
〈名〉An affected face; a grimace:(役者のは)a made-up face

content:
つくりかざり〔作り飾り〕
〈名〉Affectation

content.content: あの娘は作り飾りが無い
She is unaffected in her manner―She has a natural manner―She is an artless girl.
彼は作り飾りの無い人だ
He is plain man.
これが作り飾りの無い事実だ
This is the plain truth―the simple truth―the naked truth―the unvarnished truth.
作り飾り無くものを言う
to speak plain

content:
つくりかた〔作り方〕
〈名〉How to make; the way to make

content.content: 料理の作り方
the recipe for a dish―the receipt for a dish

つくりかた〔造り方〕
〈名〉How to brew (sake); how to build (a house); the style of building; construction

content:
つくりごえ〔作り声〕
〈名〉An affected voice; a feigned voice; an assumed voice; a stop

content.content: 彼は悲しそうな作り声でも嬉しそうな作り声でも自在に出す
He can put on the pathetic stop or pull out the rapturous stop at will.

content:
つくりごと〔作り事〕
〈名〉
1. (=作り話)→『

content.content: つくりばなし〔作り話〕
作り事を言う
to fabricate a lie―forge a lie―invent a story―trump up a story―make up a story (out of the whole cloth)
これは作り事に違いない
It must be a fabrication―a pure fabrication.

content: 2. (=狂言)a got-up affair; a put-up job

content.content: あのけんかは作り事らしい
The quarrel must be a got-up affair.

content: 3. (=窮策)a device; an artifice; a shift

つくりだか〔作り高、造り高〕
〈名〉The amount of production; the produce or yield (of a farm); the output or outturn (of a factory); the brew (of sake or beer)

content.content: 米の作り高
the yield of rice
酒の造り高
the brew of sake

content:
つくりだか〔作り高、造り高〕
〈名〉The amount of production; the produce or yield (of a farm); the output or outturn (of a factory); the brew (of sake or beer)

content.content: 米の作り高
the yield of rice
酒の造り高
the brew of sake

content:
つくりだす〔作り出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=産出する)to produce; to yield; to turn out

content.content: 日本では自動車を作り出すようになった
Japan has fallen into the way of turning out motor-cars.

content: 2. (=工夫する)to devise; to invent

content.content: 自動車は誰が作り出したものか
Who invented the motor-car?

content:
つくりつけ〔作り付け〕
〈名〉Crop:(=る) to crop (land)

content.content: 土地に作り付ける
to crop land―place land under crop
畑は作り付けてある
The fields are in crop―under crop.
麦を作り付ける
to crop land with wheat
畑には麦が作り付けてある
The fields are cropped with wheat―under wheat.
土地は何も作り付けてない
The land is out of crop.
作り付け反別
acreage under crop

content:
つくりつけ〔造り付け〕
〈名〉A fixture:(=る) to fix (anything to a building, etc.)

content.content: 机は教室に造り付けになっている
The desks are fixed to the class-room.

つくりなおす〔作り直す〕
〈他動〉To remake (shoes); to make over (a coat); to rewrite (a composition)

content:
つくりばな〔造り花〕
〈名〉An artificial flower

content.content: 造り花が好くできていて本当の花と間違えるようだ
The artificial flowers are mistaken for natural ones.

content:
つくりばなし〔作り話〕
〈名〉A fabrication; a fiction; a fable; an invention; a made-up story; a trumped-up story; a cock-and-bull story

content.content: 作り話をする
to fabricate a lie―forge a lie―invent a story―trump up a story―make up a story (out of the whole cloth)
これは作り話に違いない
It must be a fabrication―a pure fabrication.

つくりわらい〔作り笑い〕
〈名〉A forced laugh; a forced smile; an affected smile; a simper; a smirk:(=する) to force a laugh; to force a smile; to simper; to smirk

content:
つくる〔作る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=こしらえる)to make

content.content: 日本人は紙で種々の物を作る
The Japanese make paper into many things―make many things out of paper.
この石盤は紙で作ってある
This slate is made of paper.

content: 2. (=作成する)to compose; to write; to make

content.content: 本を作る
to write a book―make a book
文を作る
to write a composition―(文法では)―make a sentence
文案を作る
to make a draft
歌を作る
to compose a song―make a song
詩を作る
to compose a poem―write a poem―versify―invoke the Muse
詩を作るより田を作れ
Better work than muse.

content: 3. (=形成する)to form; to describe

content.content: 列を作る
to form a line―form in line
空中へ石を投げると抛物線を作る
A stone thrown up into the air describes a parabola.

content: 4. (=耕作する)to cultivate; to grow; to raise; to rear; to crop

content.content: 田畑を作る
to cultivate the fields―place the fields under crop―crop the fields
田が作ってある
The rice-fields are under crop―in crop.
畑には何も作ってない
The fields are out of crop.
畑に麦が作ってある
The fields are cropped with wheat―under wheat.
米を作る
to raise rice―grow rice
野菜を作る
to raise vegetables―grow vegetables―cultivate vegetables
花を作る
to cultivate flowers―raise flowers―rear flowers

content:
5. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 家庭を作る
to make a home
身代を作る、財産を作る
to make a fortune―build up a fortune
規制を作る
to make rules―frame rules
敵を作る
to make enemies
役者が顔を作る
An actor makes up his face.
新語を作る
to coin a new word
木を作る
to train a tree
松を作る
to trim a pine-tree
庭を作る
to lay out a garden
証文を作る
to draw up a deed
刺身を作る
to slice raw fish
罪を作る
to commit a cruelty
雄鶏が時を作る
A cock crows.

content:
つくる〔造る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=創造する)to make; to create

content.content: 天地万物を造る
to create the universe
始め天神地を造り給う
“In the beginning God made the heaven and the earth.”

content: 2. (=製造する)to make; to manufacture; to turn out

content.content: あの工場では何を造るのか
What do they make―manufacture―at that factory?
家具は木で造る
Furniture is made of wood.
煉瓦は粘土にて造る
Brick is made from clay.［注意］材料その形を変ぜざる場合には“made of”を用い、材料その形を変ずれば“made from”を用いる。
靴を造る
to make shoes
靴屋が靴を造っている
The shoemaker is making a pair of shoes―working at a pair of shoes.
この靴は誂えて造ったのか
Were these shoes made to order?
寸法に合わして造ったのだ
They were made to measure.
あの学校は良い人物を造る
That school turns out good men.
針金を造る
to draw a wire

content: 3. (=建造する)to build; to construct; to erect

content.content: 大工は家を造る
The carpenter builds houses.
大工が家を造っている
The carpenters are building a house―working at a house.
家は木や煉瓦にて造る
Houses are built of wood or brick.
船を造る
to build a ship
船は木や鉄で造る
Ships are built of wood or iron.
日本で戦闘艦を造るようになった
Japan has fallen into the way on building her battleships.
橋を造る
to build a bridge―construct a bridge
緑門を造る
to erect a green arch
鳥が巣を造る
A bird builds (a nest)

content: 4. (=醸造する)to brew (beer); to vint (wine); to make (sake)

content.content: ビールを造る
to brew beer―make beer
日本でビールを造るようになった
Beer is now made in Japan.
酒は米で造る
Sake is made from rice―brewed from rice.
葡萄酒を造る
to vint wine―make wine
葡萄酒は葡萄で造る
Wine is made from grapes.

content:
つくろい〔繕い〕
〈名〉
1. (=修繕)repair; mending

content.content: 繕いをする
(家なら)to repair a house―(靴なら)―mend shoes―(着物なら)―patch up a coat―(靴下なら)―darn stockings
この家はもう繕いが利かぬ
The house is beyond repair―past repair.
この靴はもう繕いが利かぬ
These shoes are past mending.

content:
2. (=弥縫)patching up
3. (=整頓)adjustment

つくろう〔繕う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=修繕する)to repair(a house); to mend(shoes, etc.)

content.content: 家はざっと繕っておこう
I will have the house roughly repaired.
靴を繕わしておいた
I have had my shoes mended―cobbled up.
上衣の破れを繕う
to patch up a coat
靴下の孔を繕う
to darn stockings
綻びを繕う
to sew up a rent
網を繕う
to mend a net

content: 2. (=弥縫する)to patch up, tinker up (a matter); to gloss over, gloze over (a fault)

content.content: 事を一時繕っておこう
We shall patch up the matter―tinker up the matter.
体裁を繕う、人前を繕う、その場を繕う
to save appearances
欠点を繕う
to gloss over a fault―gloze over a defect―smoothe over a defect

content: 3. (=整頓する)to adjust

content.content: 衣紋を縫う
to adjust one's dress―prim oneself―tidy oneself―(米国にては)―fix oneself
鳥が羽交{はがい}を繕う
A bird plumes its feathers―preens its feathers―lays its feathers.

content:
つけ〔付け〕
〈名〉
1. (=勘定書)a bill

content.content: 付けを持って来い
Bring the bill.

content: 2. (=日付け)date

content.content: 本月三日付の御書簡
your letter dated the 3rd inst.―your favor under date of the 3rd inst.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉In connection with

content.content: 祭りにつけ金が要る
We shall want some money in connection with the festival.
なんにつけかんにつけ金が要る
One will need money on every occasion.

content: 〈接続詞〉When

content.content: 照るにつけ曇るにつけ心配が絶えぬ
When the sky smiles, or when the sky frowns, I am never free from anxiety.

content:
つげ〔黄楊〕
〈名〉The box; the box-tree:(黄楊材)box; boxwood

content.content: 黄楊の櫛
a boxwood comb

content:
つげ〔告げ〕
〈名〉(=神の告げ)A revelation

content.content: 夢にお告げがあった
I had a revelation in a dream.
お告げによって知った教えだと彼は言っている
He says the doctrine was revealed to him.

content:
づけ〔付け〕
〈接尾詞〉Dated; under date of

content.content: 本月三日付けのご書面
your letter dated 3rd inst.―under date of the 3rd inst.

content:
つけあがる〔付け上がる〕
〈自動〉To presume (upon one's good nature); to be spoil

content.content: 下から出りゃつけ上がる
You presume upon my condescension.
誉めるとつけ上がる
Praise will spoil him.
女は機嫌を取るとつけ上がる
Try to please a woman, and you will spoil her.

つけあわせ〔付け合せ〕
〈名〉Vegetables to garnish fish; garniture

つけあわせる〔付け合せる〕
〈他動〉To join (things) together

content:
つけおとし〔付け落し〕
〈名〉An omission (in a bill)

content.content: 勘定に付け落としがある
Something is omitted in the bill―There is something not charged in the bill.

content:
つけおとす〔付け落す〕
〈他動〉To omit (an item in a bill)

content.content: 運賃が付け落としてある
The carriage is omitted in the bill―not charged in the bill.

content:
つけかけ〔付け掛け〕
〈名〉Overcharge; surcharge:(=する) to overcharge; to surcharge

content.content: あの家は付け掛けをする
They will overcharge you at that house.

つけぎ〔付木〕
〈名〉A match; a spill

つけぐすり〔付け薬〕
〈名〉A medicine for external application

content:
つげぐち〔告げ口〕
〈名〉Tale-bearing:(=する) to carry tales; to tell tales (out of school); to tell on, blow on, peach on, split on, squeal on (one); to let on (to some one); to sneak

content.content: 告げ口をする人
a tale-bearer―a sneak
あの生徒は告げ口をする
He is a sneak.

つけくわえ〔付け加え〕
〈名〉An addition:(=る) to add (one thing to another)

content:
つけげんき〔付け元気〕
〈名〉Dutch courage; pot-valour

content.content: あれは例の付け元気だ
He is pot-valiant as usual.

content:
つけこむ〔付け込む〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=記入する)to enter

content.content: 帳簿につけ込む
to enter in a book―make an entry in a book

content: 2. (=弱点につけ込む)to take advantage of (one's weakness); to presume on (one's good nature); to impose upon (one's kindness); to practise upon (one's credulity); to trade on (one's superstition); to profit by, benefit by (confusion, etc.)

content.content: 相手の弱みにつけ込むのは卑怯だ
It is mean to take advantage of one's helpless situation.
あれは人の弱みにつけ込む卑怯な奴だ
He will take a mean advantage of you.
その男は主人の不在につけ込んで金をたかりに来たのだ
The man took advantage of the master's absence to obtain money under false pretences.
車屋が僕の土地不案内なのにつけ込んで高いことを言った
The jinrikishaman, taking advantage of my ignorance of the town, asked an exorbitant fare.
彼らは彼の人の好いのにつけ込んで勝手なことをする
They presume on his good nature―trade upon his good nature―and deal with him as they please.
彼の信じやすいのにつけ込んでだまそうとする
They practise upon his credulity.
彼は少し親切にするとすぐつけ込む
He will presume upon your kindness―impose upon your kindness.
あいつらは人の迷信につけ込んで金を儲ける
They make money by trading on people's superstitions.
彼はその混雑につけ込んで逃げ終せた
He profited by the confusion―benefited by the confusion―and made good his escape.
人の油断につけ込む
to take a man off his guard―take a man unawares―catch one napping

content: 3. (=前約する)to engage, book (a seat in the theatre)

content.content: ひと桝つけ込んで置いた
I have booked a box in the theatre.

content:
つけたし〔付け足し〕
〈名〉An addition

content.content: 付け足しをする
to add anything
(馬車の)付け足し席
a dickey

つけだし〔付け出し〕
〈名〉A bill; an account

content:
つけだし〔付け足し〕
〈名〉An extra item

content.content: 宿賃よりも付け足しの方が多い
There are more extras than the hotel-charge.

つけたす〔付け足す〕
〈自他動〉To add to (anything)

content:
つけだす〔付け出す〕
〈他動〉To charge (in a bill)

content.content: その代は僕の勘定に付け出しておくれ
Charge the sum to my account―Put it down to my account.

content:
つけたり〔付けたり〕
〈名〉A mere addition; a mere accompaniment:(=の) additional; empty

content.content: あの人の話は多少付けたりがある

あの家へ行く人は用は付けたりで皆細君を見に行くのだ
They go to look at his wife with business as a mere accompaniment.
付けたりの挨拶
empty civilities
付けたりのお世辞
an empty compliment
「誰某へよろしく」というのはたいがい付けたりだ
“My compliments to him,” is generally an empty compliment.

content:
つけぢえ〔付け智慧〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: いれぢえ〔入れ智慧〕

content:
つけつけいう〔ツケツケ言う〕
〈自動〉To din in one's ears

content.content: ツケツケ言う細君だ
His wife is constantly dinning in his ears.

content:
つけどころ〔付け処〕
〈名〉(=目の付けどころ)A point of view; one's view of things

content.content: 君は目の付けどころが違う
You look from a different point of view―You take a different view of the matter.
専門家は目のつけどころが違う
A professional man takes a different view of things―You take a professional view of things―You see with a professional eye.

つけとどけ〔付け届け〕

つけな〔漬け菜〕
〈名〉A kind of rape (used for pickling)

つけね〔付け値〕
〈名〉The price bidden (for an article); the bid; the price offered (for an article); the offer

つけね〔付根〕
〈名〉The root, the joint, the base (of anything projecting)

content.content: 腕の付け根
the shoulder-joint
股の付け根
the groin
耳の付け根
the root of the ear
頸の付け根
the base of the neck
枝の付け根から折る
to break off a branch at the joint

content:
つけねらう〔付け狙う〕

content.content: 親の仇敵を付け狙う
to seek the life of one's father's slayer―seek to avenge one's father

つけばな〔付け鼻〕
〈名〉An artificial nose

content:
つけび〔付け火〕
〈名〉Arson; incendiarism; fire-raising:(=する) to set fire to (a house); to fire (a house); to raise a fire

content.content: 火事は付け火だろう
The fire must be a case of incendiarism―due to incendiarism.

content:
つけひげ〔付け髯〕
〈名〉A false beard or moustache

content.content: 付け髯をする
to wear a false beard―disguise oneself with a false moustache
彼は付け髯をしていたのだ
He was wearing a false beard―disguised with a false moustache.
付け髯をしていると分からない
You would not know him in his false moustache.

つけびと〔付け人〕
〈名〉An attendant; an assistant; an auxiliary:(若い婦人などのは)a chaperon

content:
つけぶそく〔付け不足〕
〈名〉Undercharge; omission

content.content: 勘定に一つ付け不足がある
There is an item omitted in the bill.

つけふだ〔付け札〕
〈名〉A ticket; a tag; a label; a docket

content:
つけぶみ〔付け文〕
〈名〉A love-letter

content.content: 付け文をする
to write one a love-letter

content:
つけまとう〔付け纏う〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: つきまとう〔付き纏う〕

content:
つけまわす〔付け廻す〕
〈他動〉To follow (one) about

content.content: うるさくつけまわす男だ
He will follow you about like a shadow.
女をつけまわす
to pursue a woman―dangle about a girl―dangle after a girl

content:
つけめ〔付け目〕
〈名〉An object; an aim

content.content: あの男は何かつけ目があるのだ
He has an eye to something.
彼のつけ目は女の財産だ
He has an eye to her fortune.
彼は何かつけ目があってあの女を貰ったのだ
He married her with an eye to something.

content:
つけもの〔漬物〕
〈名〉Pickles; pickled vegetables; salted vegetables

content.content: 漬物を漬ける
to pickle vegetables―salt vegetables
漬物屋
a dealer in pickles
漬物桶
a tub for salted vegetables

content:
つけやき〔付け焼き〕
〈名〉Fish broiled with soy

content.content: 魚を付け焼きにする
to broil fish with soy

content:
つけやきば〔付け焼刃〕
〈名〉Borrowed wisdom

content.content: 付け焼刃ははげやすい
Borrowed plumes will come off―False dye will not wash―Plated work will not stand wear and tear.

content:
つけよう〔付け様〕
〈名〉

content.content: 手のつけようが無い
I can do nothing with it.
手のつけようの無い奴だ
I can do nothing with him―I don't know what do to with him.
消防隊も手のつけようが無かった
The fire-brigade could do nothing with the conflagration.
手のつけようの無いばか者だ
He is a desperate fool.
手のつけようの無い生意気者だ
He is too conceited for anything―conceited enough for everybody.

content:
つける
〈接尾動詞〉(=何々しつける)To be accustomed (to doing something); to be used (to doing something); to be wont (to do something); to be in the habit (of doing something)

content.content: 彼は旅行をしつけているから支度が早い
He is an experienced traveller, and is soon ready for a journey.
あの先生の講義は聞きつけないとわからない
You can not understand him, unless you are used to him.
この魚は食いつけないとあたる
The fish will disagree with you, unless you are used to it.
この辺は歩きつけている

この道は歩きつけない
The road is strange to me.
聞きつけた声、聞きつけない声

仕つけた仕事、仕つけない仕事
familiar work―unfamiliar work
あの店は買いつけている
I am a regular customer at that shop―I patronize that shop.
僕は何でも買いつけの店で買う
I make purchases at the same shop.
あの料理屋は行きつけている
I am a habitu? at that restaurant.
行きつけた料理屋
a restaurant where one is a habitu?

content:
つける〔就ける〕

content.content: 人を職に就ける

content:
つける〔着ける〕

content: 2. (=寄せる)to draw up to (a place)

content:

content.content: 明かりを点ける

〈他動〉

Fix bayonets!
ペン軸にペン先を付ける

道具に柄を付ける
to fix a handle to a tool
卓子に脚を付ける
to fix the legs to a table
ボタンを付ける
to sew on a button
絵に縁を付ける
to frame a picture―mount a picture
馬に荷を付ける
to load a horse―pack a horse
馬に米を付ける

馬に馬具を付ける

馬車に馬を付ける
to harness a horse to a carriage―put a horse to (a carriage)

content: 2. (=付着する)to apply (one thing to another); to put (one thing on or to another)

content.content: 薬を付ける

目薬を付ける
to drop eye-water into the eye
餅に砂糖を付ける

パンにバタを付ける

釣針に餌を付ける

身に付けて放さぬ

肌に付ける

糊を付ける
to starch linen
顔に白粉を付ける

唇に紅を付ける

頭に香水を付ける

髪に油を付ける
to put oil on the hair―oil the hair
色を付ける
to colour anything
話に色を付ける

(これではあまり少ないから)なんとか色を付けて下さい

図に影を付ける
