味を付ける
to season food―flavour food
艶を付ける
(絹になら)to gloss silk―(紙になら)―glaze paper―(布になら)―mangle linen―(人になら)―heighten one's charms
金箔を付ける
to gild anything
しるしを付ける
to put a mark on anything―mark anything
帽子に徽章を付ける
to put a badge on a cap
(室に)番号を付ける
to number the rooms
仮名を付ける
to add Japanese syllabaries to Chinese characters
筆に墨を付ける
to dip a brush in ink―dip a pen in ink
顔に墨を付ける
to smear one's face with ink―stain one's face with ink
利息を付けて返す
to pay it back with interest

content: 3. (=記入する)to enter (in a book); to charge (in a bill); to put (one's name) down

content.content: 帳面に付ける
to enter anything in a book
帳面を付ける
to keep books
日記を付ける
to keep a diary
それが勘定に付けてない
It is not charged in the bill―omitted in the bill.
付けておいてくれ(それを僕の勘定に付けて出せ)
Charge it to my account―Put it down to my account.
付けておきます
I will put it down to your account.
(ご寄付を)いくら付けましょうか
What shall I put your name down for?―put you down for?
十円も付けて下さい
Put me down for 10 yen.
十円も付けておこう
I will put my name down for ten yen―put myself down for 10 yen.
手を付ける
(食物になら)to touch food―(仕事になら)―put one's hand to a task―(女になら)―have a connection with a woman
彼はどんなご馳走を出しても手も付けない
He never touches anything set before him―leaves the dishes untouched.
資本に手を付けるな
Leave the capital untouched―Leave the capital intact.
値を付ける
(売る方では)to set a price on an article―(買う方では)―offer a price for an article―bid (a price) for an article
百円に付けても売らなかった
I offered 100 yen for it, but he would not part with the article.
名を付ける
to name anything
子どもに名を付ける
to name a child
太郎と付けました
We have named him Taro.
巡洋艦には山や河の名を付ける
Cruisers are named after mountains and rivers.
綽名を付ける
to nickname a man
火をつける
to set fire to a house
火打ち石で火をつける
to strike a light
導火線に火をつける
to apply a match to the train
導火線をつける
to lay a train
タバコに火をつける
to light a pipe―light a cigar―light a cigarette―light up
人の後をつける
to follow a man―shadow a man―dog one's steps
見え隠れに後をつけた
I followed him at a distance.
探偵に後をつけられた
I was shadowed by a detective.
跡をつける
to leave a mark―leave a track―leave a trail
足跡をつける
to leave foot-marks―leave footprints
供をつける
to be attended by a servant
彼は供を二人つけておった
He was attended by two servants.
彼は顧問をつける必要がある
He must have some one at his elbow (to advise him).
病人に看護婦をつける
to attach a nurse to the invalid―keep a nurse in attendance on the invalid―place the invalid under the care of a nurse
(狂人などに)番人をつける
to place a madman under a keeper
狂人に番人がつけてある
The madman is under a keeper.
捕虜に番兵をつける
to place a prisoner under guard
人を味方につける
to win over―gain over―a man
気をつける
to take care―be careful
風邪を引かぬように気をつける
Be careful not to take cold.
目をつける
to keep an eye on a man―have an eye to anything
警察ではあの男に目をつけている
The police have an eye on that man.
彼はあの地位に目をつけている
He has an eye to that position.
正気をつける
to bring one to (oneself)
片をつける
to dispose of anything―get rid of anything―despatch one's business―make an end of one's business
見込みをつける
to form an opinion of―form a judgment of―a person or thing
節をつける
(唄になら)to set a song to music―(歌うのなら)―sing a song to a tune
訳をつける
to translate a word or a passage
下の句をつける
to complete a couplet
道をつける
to make a road―open a road―to a place
通じをつける
to open the bowels―loosen the bowels
ご飯をつけましょうか
Shall I serve the rice?―fill the bowl with rice?
お燗をつけてくれ
Please warm the sake.
子どもに財産を付ける
to settle a fortune on a child
娘に持参金を付けて嫁にやる
to endow one's daughter at marriage―provide for a daughter―portion a bride
力をつける
to encourage one
元気をつける
to raise one's spirits―freshen one's spirit
智慧をつける
to suggest an idea to one―inspire one with an idea
癖をつける
to acquire a habit―cultivate a habit
僕は早起きの癖をつけた
I have cultivated the habit of early-rising.
話をつける
to arrange a matter
債権者と話をつける
to compound with one's creditors
景気をつける
to enliven a place―make things hum
一杯飲んで景気をつけようじゃないか
Let us liven up with a drink!
酒は元気をつける
Wine exhilarates.
景品をつける
to offer a premium
鳬{けり}をつける
to put an end to anything

content:
つげる〔告げる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=知らせる)to tell (one that or of); inform (one that or of); to signify (one's intention); to intimate (one's wish to one)

content.content: 君の来たことを皆に告げた
I have told them that you have come―told them of your arrival―informed them of your arrival.
主人に来意を告げた
I informed the master of the object of my visit―told the master why I had called.
彼は出発の意を告げた
He signified his intention of leaving.
彼は去りたいという意を僕に告げた
He intimated to me a wish to leave.
実を告げる
to tell the truth
時計は時間を告げる
The clock tells the hour.

content: 2. (=公示する)to announce; to proclaim

content.content: 之を天下に告げん
I will announce it to the world―proclaim it from the housetop.
会員諸君に告ぐ
The members of the society are hereby informed that...
鶏鳴暁を告ぐ
The cock's crow proclaims the hour of dawn.

content:
3. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 別れを告ぐ
to bid one farewell―say good-by―take one's leave
終りを告ぐ、完結を告ぐ、終結を告ぐ
to come to an end―come to a termination―come to a conclusion
集会は終りを告げた
The meeting has come to an end.
事業は完結を告げた
The work has come to a conclusion.
食料不足を告ぐ
The provisions have come short―We have come short of provisions.

content:
つごう〔都合〕
〈名〉
1. (=便宜)convenience

content.content: 都合の好い
(時なら)a convenient time―(家なら)―a suitable house
その日は僕に都合が好い
The day will be convenient to me―The day will suit my convenience―The day will suit me.
その時間は都合が悪い
The hours are in convenient to me―The hours do not suit my convenience―The hours do not suit me.
その方が都合が好い
That would be more convenient to me―That would suit me better.
そう来なくちゃ都合が悪い
That will suit me best of all.
そうすれば双方に都合が好い
That would be convenient to both parties.
この金が有ると都合が好い
This money will be convenient to me―The money will be welcome to me―This money will not come amiss to me.
明日でご都合はいかがですか
Will tomorrow be convenient to you?―Will tomorrow suit you?―Will tomorrow do?
ご都合が好くば明後日にして下さい
Please make it the day after tomorrow if it is convenient to you―if it is agreeable to you―if it suits you.
君の都合の好い時そう言い給え
Please say so when it is convenient to you.
ご都合の好い時に(ご都合次第に、ご都合で)金を返して下さい
You may pay me at your own convenience―You may pay me whenever convenient to yourself―You may consult your own convenience for payment―You may take your own time for payment.
ご都合でなるべく早く(ご都合のつき次第に)返して下さい
Please pay me at your earliest convenience.
人の都合を図る
to consult one's convenience
自分の都合を図る、自分の好いようにする
to consult one's own convenience―suit one's own convenience―suit oneself
それなら君の都合の好いようにし給え
Then consult your own convenience!―suit your own convenience!―suit yourself!
あの人は自分の都合の好いことばかり考えている
He only consults his own convenience.
人にはそれぞれ都合というものがある
Each man has his own convenience to consult.
人の都合も考えなければならぬ
We must consult the convenience of others―have regard to others' convenience.
学校を起こそうと思うがどうも都合の好い家が無い
I think of starting a school, but I can not find a house suited for the purpose.
都合の好い家が無ければ新築する
If I can not find a suitable house, I will have a new one built.
これは住むにまことに都合の好い家だ
This is a commodious house.
そう都合の好いように法律を曲げることはできぬ
I can not pervert the law to suit myself.
この金を貸して下さるご都合はできますまいか
Couldn't you make it convenient to lend me the money?
都合を好くする
to facilitate anything
お名前を出して下さればたいそう都合が好いが
Your name would facilitate matters.
一言添えて下さればたいそう都合がよろしいのですが
A word from you would facilitate matters.
人は都合の好いことを信じたがる
“The wish is father to the thought.”

content: 2. (=首尾)fortune; luck; success

content.content: 都合好く
fortunately―luckily―successfully―favourably―satisfactorily
好い都合でした
It was fortunate―It was lucky.
彼は都合好く在宅でした
I was so fortunate as to find him at home―I had the good fortune to find him at home.
都合好く彼に逢いました
By good luck I met him―I luckily met him―I was so lucky as to meet him―I had the good luck to meet him.
今度は都合好くいきました
I have been successful this time―I have fared well this time―It has fared well with me this time―Things have gone well with me this time.
これまでは万事都合好くいきました
So far all has gone well.
今度は都合好く入学しました
I have succeeded in entering the school.
今はこの事業を起こすに都合が好い
The times are favourable to the enterprise―propitious to the enterprise.
改革を行うには都合の好い時期だ
The times are favourable for a reform.
闇夜で泥棒には都合の好い夜であった
The night was dark and propitious to the enterprise.
天気の都合が好ければ明日出帆する
We sail tomorrow if the weather is favourable―We sail tomorrow, weather permitting.
天気の都合で遠足会を延期した
The excursion has been postponed owing to the unfavourable weather.
風の都合が好い
The wind is favourable―The wind is fair.
風の都合が悪い
The wind is unfavourable―The wind is adverse―The wind is contrary―The wind is against us.
彼は自分の説に都合の悪い事実があるとごまかしてしまう
He will slur over an unfavourable fact.
事が都合好く運んだ
The matter has progressed satisfactorily.
彼は近頃都合が好いと見える
He seems to be well off.

content: 3. (=事情、理由)circumstances; conditions; reasons

content.content: 都合有之延期す
The matter is postponed for certain reasons.
家事上の都合で学校を止めます
I must leave school for family reasons.
少々都合があってお暇を戴きたいのです
I wish to leave your service for certain reasons of my own.
彼は内々都合があって止めたのだろう
He must have resigned for private reasons―for reasons of his own.
内々都合があってしたことだろう
He must have done so to gain some private ends.
いろいろ都合があって死ぬのを見合わした
I have given up the idea of dying for various reasons.
経費の都合で訴訟を止めた
The lawsuit has been abandoned for financial reasons―owing to the expenses involved.
都合が悪くて洋行することができなかった
Circumstances did not admit of my going abroad.
都合によっては金を増してもさし支え無い
The money may be increased according to circumstances.
その時の都合でどちらでもよろしい
Either will do according to circumstances―as the case may be.
都合が好いとこの植物は好く発育する
The plant will grow very well under favourable conditions.
この子は都合好くいけば天才を発揮する
His genius will assert itself under favourable conditions―under favourable circumstances.
都合が悪くいくと危険人物だ
He will turn out a dangerous character under unfavourable conditions―under unfavourable circumstances.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 時間の都合で余興を省きました
The additional entertainments have been omitted, as we are pressed for time.
お座敷の都合でここでご辛抱を願います
You must put up with this apartment, as we are pressed for room.
金の都合で普請を延ばした
I have put off the construction, as I am pressed for money.
場所の都合でよそへ持って行きました
The proceedings have been carried elsewhere, for we are confined for space.
紙面の都合にて以下は次号とす
The subject will be continued in the next number for want of space.
経費の都合で学校を閉じました
We have closed the school, as we can not meet the expenses.
材料の都合で本を小いさくした、本を大きくした
The book has been condensed owing to scarcity of materials―The book has been enlarged owing to abundance of materials.
準備の都合も有之候間諾否御一報願上候{じゅんびのつごうもこれありそうろうあいだだくひごいっぽうねがいあげそうろう}
As we must make the necessary preparations, we request you will let us know whether or no you will honour us with your acceptance.
懐の都合が悪い
I can't afford it just now.

content: 4. (=機会)opportunity; occasion

content.content: 都合次第に話しておこう
I will speak to him on the first opportunity―on the first occasion―as occasion serves―when opportunity serves.

content: 5. (=予定、繰合、取計い、予期)arrangement; management; expectation:(=する) to arrange; to manage; to expect

content.content: 弟が僕の代理をする都合になっております
It is arranged that my brother will take my place.
休暇中に箱根へ行く都合になっております
(It is arranged that) I shall be at Hakone during the holidays.
明日は在宅の都合です
I shall be at home tomorrow―I expect to be at home tomorrow.
明日来て下さるご都合はできまいか
Could you arrange―manage―make time―to come tomorrow?
どうか夜学に出て下さるご都合はできますまいか
Could you arrange―manage―to teach evenings?
どうか都合してみましょう
I will manage it somehow―I will see about it.
何とか都合してそうしてくれ給え
Do manage to do so!
時間の都合をする
to arrange the hours
時間の都合がつきますか
Can the hours be conveniently arranged?
時間の都合がつかない
The hours can not be arranged―The hours do not lend themselves to arrangement.
時間の都合がついた
The hours are arranged.

content: 6. (=融通、調達)accommodation:(=する) to accommodate (one with a loan); to raise (money); to find (money); to have (money) ready

content.content: 金を都合する
to raise the money―find the money
大金のことですから即座には都合致しかねます
As it is a large sum of money, I can not have it ready at a moment's notice.
彼はどう都合したものか翌日千円持って来た
He brought 1,000 yen the next day, however he may have raised the sum.
五百円だけ都合してくれんか
Can you accommodate me with 500 yen?
その金を友人に都合して貰いました
I got a friend to accommodate me with the sum.
どうか座敷を都合して貰えまいか
Couldn't you accommodate me with a room?

content: 7. (=総計、合計)the total amount; the total number; the sum total; the total:(副詞に用いれば)in all; all told; all together

content.content: 都合三百
The total number is 300―There are 300 in all.
都合いくつあるか
How many are there in all?
都合いくらになるか
What do you make the total?―What does the total come to?
都合七百円になる
The total comes to 700 yen―The total amounts to 700 yen―The total foots up to 700 yen―It totals 700 yen.

つごもり〔晦〕
〈名〉The last day of a month

content:
つじ〔辻〕
〈名〉
1. (=四辻)a crossing; a cross-roads
2. (=市街)the streets
3. (=路傍)roadside; wayside

content.content: 辻車
a public ricksha
辻馬車
a cab―a hansom
辻自動車
a taxi―a taxi-cab―a motor-cab
辻店
a stall―a booth
辻商人
a stall-keeper―a booth-keeper―a street-vendor
辻君
a street-walker―a night-walker
辻堂
a wayside shrine
辻説法
street preaching
辻強盗
a highway robber
辻斬り
street-murder

つじあきんど〔辻商人〕
〈名〉A stall-keeper; a booth-keeper; a street-vendor

content:
つじうら〔辻占〕
〈名〉
1. (A slip of paper with) a fortune-telling motto (on it)

content.content: 恋の辻占
a slip of paper telling one's fortune in love
辻占売り
a tsujiura-vendor

content: 2. (=前兆)an omen

content.content: 辻占が好い、辻占が悪い
It is a good omen―a bad omen.

つじぎみ〔辻君〕
〈名〉A street-walker; a night-walker

つじぎり〔辻斬り〕
〈名〉Street murder; trying a new-bought sword on a chance passenger

つじぐるま〔辻車〕
〈名〉A public jinrikisha

つじじどうしゃ〔辻自動車〕
〈名〉A taxi; a taxi-cab; a motor-cab

つじせっぽう〔辻説法〕
〈名〉Street preaching

content:
つじつま〔辻褄〕
〈名〉Consistency; coherence

content.content: つじつまが合う
to cohere―be coherent―be consistent―hang together
彼の話はつじつまが合わぬ
His story is incoherent―inconsistent―self-contradictory―His story does not hang together.
彼はつじつまの合わないことを言う
He talks incoherently―He contradicts himself―There is neither rhyme nor reason in his statement.
つじつまの合わない言い訳だ
It is a lame excuse.
つじつまを合わせる
to make one's statement consistent

つじどう〔辻堂〕
〈名〉A wayside shrine

つじばしゃ〔辻馬車〕
〈名〉A cab; a hansom

content:
つじまち〔辻待ち〕
〈名〉Waiting for hire in the streets

content.content: 辻待ち車
a jinrikishaman looking out for a fare

つじみせ〔辻店〕
〈名〉A stall; a booth

content:
つた〔蔦〕
〈名〉The ivy

content.content: 蔦の絡んだ井
an ivy-mantled well

content:
つたいに〔伝いに〕
〈前置詞相当〉→『

content.content: づたいに〔伝いに〕

content:
づたいに〔伝いに〕
〈前置詞相当〉Along

content.content: 塀伝いに行くと門がある
If you go along the wall, you will see a gate.
土手伝いに道がある
A road runs along the bank.
飛び石伝いに行く
to walk over the stepping stones
彼は屋根伝いに逃げた
He fled from roof to roof.
畦路伝いに田圃を横切った
I crossed the rice-fields by a foot-path.

つたえきく〔伝え聞く〕
〈他動〉To learn by hearsay; to know by hearsay

つたえばなし〔伝え話〕
〈名〉A tradition; a legend

content:
つたえる〔伝える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=伝達する)to communicate, impart (the news to one); to convey, deliver (a message to one); to transmit, carry (orders); to circulate (a rumour); to tell (one the news)

content.content: 報を伝える
to communicate the news to one―impart the news to one―tell one the news
僕が遺族に悲報を伝える役に当たった
I took it upon myself to break the sad news to the family.
警報を伝える
to give the alarm―raise the alarm
虚報を伝える
to circulate a false report―give a false report―give a false alarm―cry “wolf”
彼によろしくと伝えて下さい
Present my compliments to him!―Give my best regard to him!―Remember me kindly to him!
きっとご伝言を伝えます
I will convey your message to him―deliver your message to him.
令旨を伝える
to convey an Imperial message
命令を伝える
to transmit orders―carry orders
一汽船敵の消息を伝う
A steamer brought intelligence of the enemy.
言葉は意味を伝える、思想を伝える
A word conveys a meaning―conveys an idea.
伝うるところによれば
Rumour says―Rumour has it―that...
ロンドン電報の伝うる処によれば
A London telegram says that...

content: 2. (=世伝する)to transmit (anything to posterity); to hand down (anything from father to son); to bequeath (a fortune to one's son); to leave (one a fortune)

content.content: 子孫に伝える、後世に伝える
to transmit anything to posterity―hand down anything to posterity
その名を後世に伝えた
He transmitted his name to posterity―handed down his name to posterity.
その名を永久に伝えた
He immortalized his name―won an immortal fame―achieved an immortality.
この魂を子々孫々に伝える
This spirit is handed down from father to son―transmitted to one's children's children.
子に財産を伝える
to bequeath a fortune to one's son―leave one's son a fortune

content: 3. (=伝導する)to transmit; to conduct; to propagate

content.content: 熱や電気を伝える
to conduct heat―conduct electricity
(地震の)震動を伝える
to propagate the vibration

content: 4. (=伝来する)to introduce (anything into our country)

content.content: 仏教は朝鮮人によって日本に伝えられた
Buddhsim was introduced into Japan by the Koreans.

content: 5. (=伝授する)to impart (a secret to one); to initiate, induct (one into mysteries)

content.content: 後進に知識を伝える
to impart knowledge to the young
秘訣を伝える
to initiate one into the mysteries of an art―induct one into the mysteries of an art
彼は剣法の奥義を伝えられた
He was initiated into the mysteries of swordsmanship.
道を伝える、法を伝える
to preach the truth

content:
つたって〔伝って〕
〈前置詞相当〉Along; up; down

content.content: 河に伝って行くと海へ出る
If you go along a river, you will come to the sea.
この土手に伝って行くと橋がある
If you go along this bank, you will see a bridge.
崖に伝って降りる、崖に伝って登る
to go down a precipice―go up a cliff
木の枝に伝って谷間に降りた
I descended into the ravine by help of branches.

content:
つたない〔拙い〕
〈形〉
1. (=拙劣)unskilful; clumsy; awkward; sorry; wretched

content.content: 文極めて拙し
It is a clumsy style―It is wretched stuff.

content: 2. (=不運)unfortunate

content.content: 日本の敵は武運拙し
Japan's enemies are unfortunate in war―Fortune frowns on Japan's enemies.
彼は武運拙く戦死した
He was deserted by Fortune and fell in battle.

content:
つたわる〔伝わる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=子孫に伝わる)to be transmitted (to posterity); to be handed down (from father to son); to descend (from father to son); to go down (to posterity); to come down (from one's fathers); to pass (to one's heirs); to devolve (upon one's successor)

content.content: 後世に伝わる、子孫に伝わる
to be transmitted to posterity―handed down to posterity
これらの作のうち後世に伝わるものはどれだろうか
Which of these works will go down to posterity?
代々伝わる
to be transmitted from generation to generation―be handed down from father to son―descent from father to son
この魂が代々伝わって行く
This spirit is handed down from father to son.
これは先祖から伝わった宝物である
This is an heirloom handed down from my fathers―This treasure has come down from my fathers.
その名は万世に伝わらん
His name shall be handed down to all ages―His name shall endure through all ages to come―His name shall be immortalized―His name shall be immortal.
財産は相続人に伝わる
One's property passes to one's heir―devolves upon one's successor.

content: 2. (=世間に伝わる)to spread; to get abroad; to be circulated; to pass (from hand to hand―from mouth to mouth)

content.content: 新説が広く世間に伝わっている
The new theory has spread abroad―been introduced everywhere.
噂が伝わる
A rumour gets abroad―A rumour is circulated.
噂は甲から乙へと伝わる
A rumour passes from mouth to mouth.
その品が甲から乙へと人手でに伝わった
The article passed from hand to hand.
坊間に伝わる
It is rumoured abroad―noised abroad―in everybody's mouth.
その音が風に伝わって来る
The sound is heard on the breeze―The sound comes floating on the breeze.
花の香が風に伝わって来る
The fragrance of flowers comes floating on the breeze―comes wafted by the wind.

content: 3. (=伝来する)to be introduced (into our country)

content.content: 仏教は始め朝鮮から日本に伝わった
Buddhism was first introduced into Japan from Korea.
過激思想は方々に伝わっている
Bolshevism has spread everywhere.
外界の知識が種々の経路を経て鎖国の日本へ伝わった
The knowledge of the outer world found its way into the exclusive Japan through various channels.
つたって〔伝って〕

content:
つち〔槌〕
〈名〉(金槌)a hammer:(木槌)a mallet:(大槌)a maul:(鍛冶屋の大槌)a sledge, a sledge-hammer:(汽槌)a steam-hammer

content.content: 槌で打つ
to hammer
槌で釘を打つ
to drive a nail with a hammer―hammer a nail
槌の頭
a hummer-head

content:
つち〔土〕
〈名〉
1. (=土壌)earth; soil; clay; dust; mould

content.content: 土を踏む
to tread on the soil
外国の土を踏んだことが無い
I never trod on foreign soil.
日本の土を初めて踏んだ英国人は Adams
Adams was the first Englishman that ever trod on Japanese soil.
彼ら如き者に日本の土だに踏ませるのはもったいない
It is not for them to tread on Japan's sacred soil.
土をかける
to cover anything with earth―earth anything
菊を植えるには土を吟味しなければならぬ
The chrysanthemum must be planted in fine mould.
相撲に土が付く
A wrestler is beaten.
あの相撲は土が付かない
He has left a clean record.
人間は土だ
Man is clay―Man is dust.
土より出て土に帰る
“From dust thou comest, to dust returnest.”
土になる
to return to dust―die
異郷の土となる
to die in a strange land
あの西洋人は日本の土になると言っている
He has expressed his resolution to die in Japan.
面色土の如くになった
He turned ghastly pale.

content: 2. (=地面)the ground

content.content: 土を掘る
to dig in the ground―delve the ground
草を分け土を掘って捜す
I will find him out if he be above ground―I will leave no stones unturned.
土へ埋める
to bury in the ground―consign to the earth
あの辺は土一升金一升だ
The ground there is worth weight in gold.

content:
つちいろ〔土色〕
〈名〉Earth-colour

content.content: 顔が土色になった
He turned ghastly pale.

つちかう〔培う〕
〈他動〉To cultivate

つちけむり〔土煙〕
〈名〉A cloud of dust

つちだんご〔土団子〕
〈名〉A mud-pie; a dirt-pie

content:
つちつかず〔土付かず〕
〈名〉Being unbeaten throughout; a clean record

content.content: あの相撲は本場所で土付かずた
He left a clean record at the Annual Matches.

つちなげ〔槌投げ〕
〈名〉Throwing the hammer

つちならし〔土均し〕
〈名〉A roller

つちばち〔土蜂〕
〈名〉The digger; the digger-wasp

つちふまず〔土不踏〕
〈名〉The planter arch

つちふるい〔土篩〕
〈名〉An earth-sieve; an earth-screen

つちろう〔土牢〕
〈名〉A subterranean cell; a dungeon

content:
つつ
〈助辞(現在分詞に相当)〉

content.content: 地球は今現に動きつつあるのか
Is the earth actually moving at this moment?
危険が刻一刻と迫りつつある
Danger is impending every moment.
彼は時々見返りつつ立去った
He left me, looking back from time to time.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 酒を飲みつつ談じた
We talked over our wine.
キズ者と知りつつ貰った女だ
He married her with his eyes open.
悪いことと知りつつ承諾した
I consented against my better judgment.

content:
つつ〔銃〕
〈名〉A gun; a rifle

content.content: 捧げ銃
Present arms!

content:
つつ〔筒〕
〈名〉
1. (=円筒)a tube; a pipe

content.content: 竹筒
a bamboo tube
茶筒
a canister

content:
2. (=銃身、砲身)a gun-barrel
3. (=銃砲)a gun
4. (=井戸側)a well-curb

つつい〔筒井〕
〈名〉A round well

content.content: 筒井筒
a round well-curb

つついじゅんけい〔筒井順慶〕
〈名〉A time-server; a temporizer; a trimmer; an opportunist

つついづつ〔筒井筒〕
〈名〉A round well-curb

content:
つづいて〔続いて〕
〈副〉
1. (=継続して)continuously; continually; uninterruptedly; without intermission

content.content: 一週間続いて降った
It has rained continuously for a week.
あれから続いて東京に居ます
I have continued to live in Tokyo ever since―I have live in Tokyo ever since.
続いて滞在する
to continue in a place
続いて奉職する
to continue in one's office
続いて通学する
to continue in school

content: 2. (=連続して)successively; in succession; one after another; consecutively

content.content: いろいろのことが続いて起こった
Various events happened in succession―one after another.
続々続いて来た
They came in rapid succession―quickly one after another.
三回続いて震動があった
There were three successive shocks.

content:
つつうらうら〔津々浦々〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: つづうらうら〔津々浦々〕

content:
つづうらうら〔津々浦々〕
〈名〉The remotest parts of the country; the utmost limits of the land:(=に) in the remotest parts of the country; to the utmost limits of the land; in every nook and corner; throughout the land; all over the country; over the length and breadth of the land

content.content: 彼の名は津々浦々にまでも知れ渡っている
His name is known over the length and breadth of the land―His fame has reached the utmost limits of the land.

content:
つっかい〔突支〕
〈名〉(=突支棒)A prop; a support

content.content: 松の枝につっかえをする
to prop a pine-bough

content:
つっかえす〔突返す〕
〈他動〉To thrust back; to reject; to spurn

content.content: 贈物を突返す
to reject a present―spurn a gift

content:
つっかかる〔突掛かる〕
〈他動〉To fall on (one)

content.content: 彼は機嫌が悪いと誰にでも突っかかる
When he is out of humour, he will fall foul of everybody.

content:
つっかけ〔突掛け〕
〈副〉Directly; straight

content.content: 突っかけ彼の宅へ行く
I shall go straight to his residence.
突っかけ会いに行って会ってくれるだろうか
Can I see him without any introduction?

content:
つっかける〔突掛ける〕
〈他動〉To ship (shoes) on

content.content: 靴を突っかけて歩く
to walk slipshod

content:
つつがなく〔恙無く〕
〈副〉Without mishap; safely; in safety

content.content: 彼はつつがなく到着した
He has arrived in safety.
さらば道中つつがなく
A safe journey to you!
彼はつづがなく年期を勤め上げた
He has served his time without mishap.

content:
つづき〔続き〕
〈名〉
1. (=継続)continuance; the continuation; the sequel; a run; a spell

content.content: 話の続き
the continuation of a story―the sequel of a story
この話の続きが早く見たい
I am curious to read the sequel of the story.
前号よりの続き
Continued from the last number.
近頃は天気続きだ
We have had a run of fine weather―a spell of fair weather.
雨天続きだ、降り続きだ
We have had a run of rainy weather―a spell of wet weather.
あのような熱心は長続きしない
Such enthusiasm does not last long.
母はあれから病み続きです
My mother has been suffering from a continued illness ever since―She has been ill ever since.
芝居は三十日打ち続き
The play had a run of thirty days.

content: 2. (=連続)succession; a series; a run

content.content: 彼は好運続きだ
He has a run of luck.
なんという好運続きだろう
What a run of luck!
不幸続きだ
He has a run of ill luck―He has met with a series of misfortunes―He has had a chapter of accidents―He has been the sport of chance.
(旅館などの)続きの間
a suite of rooms
二枚続きの毛布
a double blanket
二軒続きの家
a double house
五軒続きの長屋
a tenement-house divided into five sections

content:
つづきあい〔続き合い〕
〈名〉A relation; a connection

content.content: 君は彼とどういう続き合いですか
What relation is he to you?―How are you related to him?―How are you connected with him?

content:
つづきがら〔続き柄〕
〈名〉Relationship

content.content: 君は彼とはどういう続き柄ですか
What relation is he to you?―How are you related to him?

つづきばなし〔続き話〕
〈名〉A serial story

content:
つづきもの〔続き物〕
〈名〉A series; a serial story

content.content: 新聞の続き物
a serial story in a newspaper
その小説は朝日に続き物で出た
The story appeared serially―in serial from―in the Asahi.
この本は皆続き物になっている
These books form a series.

content:
つっきる〔突切る〕
〈他動〉To cross

content.content: 線路を突っ切る
to cross the track
原を突っ切る
to cross the field―take a short cut across the field

content:
つつく〔突つく〕
〈他動〉
1. To poke (anything―at anything); to peck (anything―at anything); to pick (anything―at anything)

content.content: ステッキでつついてみた
I poked it―poked at it―with my stick.
鳥が嘴でつつく
A bird pecks with its bill.
餌をつつく
It pecks at food.
二人で牛鍋をつついた
We ate off the same pan between us.
(人の注意を引くために)肘でつつく
to jug one―nudge one―dig one in the ribs―poke one in the ribs
つついて孔を明ける
to pick a hole in anything―poke a hole in the wall

content: 2. (=教唆する)to instigate (one to crime); to incite (the people to rebellion); to urge, set, edge, egg (one) on (to acts of violence, etc.)

content.content: 彼は誰かにつつかれたに違いない
He must have been instigated by some one―He must have done it at somebody's instigation.
彼は若い者をつついて悪いことをさせる奴だ
He will set young people on to evil deeds.
あれは人につつかれるとどんな乱暴でも働く男だ
You can egg him on to any act of violence.
誰か陰でつつく者があるに違いない
There must be somebody at the bottom of the affair.
彼は生徒につついて僕を排斥さした
He tampered with the students against me.

content:
3. (=仲を裂く、水を差す)to make mischief; to estrange (friends); to alienate (lovers)
4. (=いじめる)to tease

つづく〔続く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=継続する)to continue; to last; to run; to extend

content.content: 地震が十分続いた
The earthquake continued―lasted―for ten minutes.
お祭りが一週間続く
The festival lasts a week.
この不景気はいつまで続くだろう
How long will this depression last, I wonder?
この状態は長くは続くまい
This state of things will not last long.
事件が長く続いた
The affair was of long continuance.
雨が長く続いた
The rain was of long duration.
雨が一週間続いた
It has continued to rain―It has kept raining―It has been raining―for a week.
天気が長く続いた
We have had a long run of fine weather.
この頃は天気が続く
We have a run of fair weather.
任期は四年続く
The term of office runs for four years.
契約はいま一年続く
The contract runs for another year―The contract has another year to run.
行列は一マイルも続いた
The procession extended for a mile.
前号より続く
Continued from the last number.
次号へ続く
To be continued in the next number.

content: 2. (=連続する)to succeed; to follow; to ensue; to come after (something)

content.content: 震動がしきりに続いた
One shock followed another―Shock followed shock.
軽い震動が続いて強い震動があった
A slight shock was followed by a severe one.
不幸ばかり続く
One misfortune succeeds another―Misfortune succeeds misfortune.
不幸が頻々続く
One calamity follows on the heels of another.
すぐ後ろから続く
to tread close on the heels of―follow close on the heels of―something
戦争にすぐ続いて飢饉があった
A famine followed close on (the heels of) war.
彼は不幸が続く
He has a run of ill luck―He has met with a series of misfortunes―He has had a chapter of accidents―He has been the sport of chance.
悪いことは続く
“Misfortunes never come singly.”
近頃悪いことが続く
One calamity has followed on another―We have had a run of ill luck―We have met with a series of misfortunes.
それから従業員の怠業が続いた
Then ensued a sabotage of the operatives.
馬車が長く続いた
There was a long string of carriages.
者ども、続け
My men, follow me!
フランス語では形容詞が名詞に続く
The French adjective comes after its noun.
学問では彼に続く者は無い
He has no second in scholarship.

content: 3. (=持続する)to endure; to last; to keep; to hold; to persevere; to persist; to have sustaining power; to have staying power

content.content: 永久続く国は無い
No empire endures for ever―lasts for ever.
この天気が続きましょうか
Will this weather hold?
この天気が続けば工事はじきに済む
If the weather holds, the works will soon be completed.
この風が続けばじきに行き着く
If this breeze helds, we shall soon be there.
晴天三日続けば豊年だという
If fine weather lasts for three days, it is said to be a sign of abundant harvest.
この種の雑誌で長く続くのは少ない
Few of these magazines last long―continue long in existence.
この雑誌も長くは続きそうもない
This magazine is not likely to last long―not likely to have a long life.
あのような熱心は長く続かない
Such enthusiasm does not last long.
あの熱心がもう半年続いたらお目にかからない
I am blest if his enthusiasm lasts for another six month.
あの勉強が続けば、始めの勉強が続けばきっと成功する
If he perseveres in his efforts,―If he keeps on as he has begun,―he will be sure to succeed.
油は今晩中続くか
Will the oil last through the night?―hold through the night?
この薪は冬中続くか
Will the fuel last through the winter?―hold through the winter?
石炭は航海中続くか
Will the coal last through the voyage?―hold through the voyage?
若い者は何をさせても続かない
Young men have no perseverance―no persistence―no sustaining power―no staying-power―no stay in them.
身体が続かない
I can not sustain the strain―stand the strain.
君は好く身体が続くね
How can you stand such strain?
あのように働いてああ遊んでは身体が続くまい
He is burning the candle at both ends.
不正の富は三代続かぬ
“Ill-gotten wealth seldom descends to the third generation.”
あれは十代も続いた旧家だ
It is an old family lasting for ten generations.

content: 4. (=隣接する)to adjoin (a field); to be adjacent to (a land)

content.content: 庭が墓場に続いている
The garden adjoins a graveyard.
二人の所有地は続いている
The estates are adjacent to each other.
居間が寝室に続いている
The sitting-room adjoins the bedroom―opens into the bed-room.
この道は停車場に続いている
This road leads to the station.

content:
つつぐち〔筒口〕
〈名〉The muzzle (of a gun); the nozzle (of a hose)

content.content: 筒口を向ける
(銃口なら)to point a gun at a man―level a gun at a man―(水管のなら)―play on a burning house

content:
つづけさまに〔続け様に〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: つづけて〔続けて〕
人を続けざまに打つ
to pommel a man

content:
つづけて〔続けて〕
〈副〉
1. (=継続して)continuously; continually; uninterruptedly; without intermission; (so many hours) at a stretch; (so many hours) together

content.content: 僕は五時間続けて働ける
I can work five hours at a stretch.
僕は彼と何時間でも続けて哲学を談じたものだ
We used to talk philosophy for hours together.
続けて読み給え
(止めずになら)Go on reading!―Read on!―(いったん止めてからなら)―Please go on with your reading!
続けて話給え
Please go on with your story!
人が半分した話を続けて話した
I took up the thread of the story.
あれから続けて東京に居ります
I have continued to live in Tokyo ever since―I have lived in Tokyo ever since.
学校へ続けて通う
to continue in school
続けて居る
to continue to stay―continue in a place

content: 2. (=連続して)successively; in succession; one after another; consecutively; (so many days) on end; (so many times) running

content.content: いろいろなことが続いて起こった
Various events happened in succession―one after another.
続々続いて来る
They come in rapid succession―quickly one after another.
彼は幾日も幾日も続けて家を明けることがある
He is sometimes away from home for days on end.
十日続けて病院へ通った
I attended the hospital for ten days on end―for ten consecutive days.
三番続けて勝った
I won three times running―three times in succession.

content:
つづける〔続ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=継続する)to continue (something―to do something); to keep (doing something); to keep on (doing something); to go on (doing something―with something); to proceed (with something)

content.content: この物語りは次号に続けます
We shall continue the story in our next number.
あれから続けて東京に居ります
I have continued to live in Tokyo ever since―I have lived in Tokyo ever since.
話を続ける
(談話を止めずになら)to keep talking―keep on talking―go on talking―(いったん止めた物語りなら)―go on with one's story.
昨夜は一晩語り続けた
We kept talking all last night.
二人はまだ語り続けている
They keep on talking still.
打っちゃっておいたらいつまで語り続けるかわからん
If you let them alone, they will go on talking for ever.
今の話を続け給え
Please go on with your story!―proceed with your narration!
一週間降り続けた
It continued to rain for a week―It kept raining for a week―(今日までなら)―It has been raining for a week
今日は一日読み続けた
I have kept reading all day.
君はこの新聞を読み続けているか
Do you keep on reading this paper?
続けて読み給え
(止めずになら)Go on reading!―Read on!―(いったん止めてからなら)―Go on with your reading!
二人で一晩飲み続けた
We kept drinking all night.
彼はまだ飲み続けている
He keeps on drinking still.
仕事を続ける、勉強を続ける
to continue one's work―keep working―keep on working―go on working―work on
それからまた旅行を続けた
Then I proceeded on my journey―went on my way.
この目が治らなけりゃ学問を続けることができなくなる
If my eyes do not get better, I shall be unable to continue my studies.

content: 2. (=持続する)to maintain (a war); to sustain (a character); to keep up (a conversation); to persevere in (a course); to persist in (a course)

content.content: 戦争を続ける
to maintain a war
訴訟を続ける金が有るまい
They can have no money to maintain an action at law.
英語で人と話を続けることができるか
Can you keep up a conversation in English?
二人は交際を続けている
They keep up their intercourse―maintain their intercourse.
彼と文通を続けている
I keep up my correspondence with him―I still correspond with him.
あまり長く飲み続けた
I kept drinking too long―I kept it up too long.
彼は彼女と関係を続けている
He keeps it up with her.
軍艦は長く続けて航海ができぬ
A warship can not keep the sea for a long time.
忍耐して勉強を続ける
to persevere in one's efforts
強情に反対を続ける
to persist in one's opposition
この方針を続けなければならぬ
We must persevere in this course―This course must be persevered in.
この方針を続けてはならぬ
We must not persist in this course―This course must not be persisted in.
あの芝居は長く打ち続けた、三十日打ち続けた
The play had a long run―a run of thirty days.

content: 3. (=切らさないように続けて供給する)to keep (one in something)

content.content: 働くつもりなら仕事を続けよう
If you mean to work, I will keep you in work.
伯(叔)母が小遣いを続けてくれた
My aunt kept me in pocket-money.
遠征軍に糧食を続けるのは困難だろう
It would be difficult to keep an expeditionary army in provisions.

content:
つっけんどん〔突慳貪〕
〈形〉Harsh; sharp; tart; snappish

content.content: つっけんどんにものを言う
to speak harshly―use harsh language
「話し中」とつっけんどんに言った
“Engaged!” said he sharply―snappishly.
つっけんどんな返事
a sharp answer―a snappish answer―a tart rejoinder

content:
つっこむ〔突込む〕
〈他動〉
1. To thrust in; to shove in; to plunge (anything into the water); to immerse (anything in the water); to duck (a man in the water)

content.content: ポケットに手を突っ込む
to thrust a hand into one's pocked―dive into one's pocket
新聞をポケットへ突っ込んだ
I thrust the paper into pocket.
書類を抽斗へ突っ込んでおいた
I shoved the papers in the drawer.
短刀を胸に突っ込む
to plunge a dagger into one's breast
柄も通れと短刀を突っ込む
to thrust a dagger home
頭を水に突っ込んだ
I plunged my head into the water―immersed my head in the water―ducked my head.
彼を水の中へ突っ込んでやった
I ducked him in the water―gave him a ducking.
蜂の巣をそっくり熱湯へ突っ込んだ
He plunged the whole wasps' nest into boiling water.
孔へ頭を突っ込む
to thrust one's head through a hole
何へ頭を突っ込む
to poke one's nose into―thrust one's nose into―meddle in―dabble in―anything
政界に頭を突っ込む
to dabble in politics
彼は何事にでもやたらに頭を突っ込む
He has a finger in every pie.
彼は片足突っ込んでいる
He has one foot in the grave.
片足突っ込んでいながら慾に離れぬ
With one foot in the grave, he can not wean his mind from worldly desires.
一本突っ込んでやった
I gave him a home thrust.
突っ込んで尋ねる
to make a searching inquiry
突っ込んで言ってやった
I talked home to his heart.

つっころばす〔突転ばす〕
〈他動〉To thrust (one) to the ground; to push (one) over

content:
つつさき〔筒先〕
〈名〉The muzzle (of a gun); the nozzle (of a hose)

content.content: 筒先を向ける
(銃のなら)to point a gun at a man―level a gun at a man―(ホースのなら)―play on a burning building
筒先レンズ
the object-lens―the object-glass

content:

〈名〉A tubular flower:(=の) tubular

content.content: 筒咲きの百合
a tubular lily

content:
つつじ〔躑躅〕
〈名〉The azalea; the rose-bay

content.content: つつじが咲いた
The azaleas are in bloom―The azaleas are out.
つつじが過ぎた
The azaleas are over.

content:
つつしみ〔慎み〕
〈名〉
1. (=謹慎)prudence; discretion; circumspection; modesty

content.content: 慎みの有る人
a prudent man
慎みの無い人
an imprudent man
慎みの有る女
a discreet woman―a modest woman
なんという慎みの無い女だろう
What an immodest woman she is!
女の慎み
female discretion―feminine modesty
女が慎みを忘れる(不義いたずらをする)
A woman forgets her discretion―forgets her decorum―forgets her prudent carriage―commits an indiscretion―misconducts herself.

content:
2. (=刑罰の謹慎)domiciliary confinement
3. (=自制)self-restraint; self-control; abstinence; continence

つつしみかしこむ〔慎み畏む〕
〈自動〉To be awed

content.content: 慎み畏みて
in awe and reverence

つつしみぶかい〔慎み深い〕
〈形〉Prudent (man); discreet, modest (woman)

つつしむ〔謹む〕
〈自動〉To be respectful; to be reverent; to be reverential

content:
つつしむ〔慎む〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=謹慎する)to be prudent; to be discreet; to be circumspect; to be modest

content.content: 青年は過ち無きよう慎むべし
A young man should be prudent―circumspect.
若き女は男女関係を慎むべし
A young woman should be discreet―modest.
言行を慎む
to be prudent in speech and behaviour―mind one's P's and Q's
品行を慎む
to be prudent in one's conduct―be continent in one's life―lead a clean life
交遊を慎む
to be discreet in choosing one's companions
演説家は皇室に関することには言葉を慎まねばならぬ
A public speaker must be reverent in speaking of the Imperial House.
君子は独りを慎む
The true man delights in the approbation of his own heart.

content: 2. (=自制する)to restrain oneself; to control oneself; to contain oneself; to be continent; to eschew (evil); to forbear (doing anything); to abstain from (wine); to refrain from (violence); to beware of (quarrelling, etc.)

content.content: 悪事を慎む
to eschew evil
酒やタバコを慎む
to abstain from wine and tobacco―practise temperance
房事を慎む
to abstain from sexual intercourse―practise continence
情慾を慎む
to control one's passions―restrain one's passions―practise continence―be continent
言語を慎む
to control one's speech―restrain one's speech―bridle one's tongue―weigh one's words
言葉を慎んでものを言え
Weigh your words before speaking!
けんか口論を慎むべし
You should beware of quarrelling and wrangling.
女の慎むべきものは悋気
A woman should abstain from jealousy.
演説をする時は人身攻撃に亙ることを慎むべし
In speaking in public, one should refrain from personalities.
冒険を慎むべし
You should refrain from tempting Providence―forbear running risks.

content: 3. (=注意する)to be careful

content.content: 将来は慎みます
I will be more careful in future.

content:
つつしんで〔謹んで〕
〈副〉Respectfully; reverentially

content.content: 謹んで申す
I respectfully beg to state that...
謹んで承れ
Attend to my words!
謹んで賀辞を呈す
I respectfully offer my congratulations.
謹んで弔意を表す
I respectfully offer my condolences.
謹んで訂正す
I respectfully correct myself.
謹んで御訂正を受く
I stand corrected.
謹んで某氏に献題す
Dedicated to Mr. A. B. with the deepest respect.
謹んでお指図を待つ
I respectfully await your orders.
運命は謹んでお受けするよりほかは無い
One must accept one's fate.

つつそで〔筒袖〕
〈名〉
1. A tight sleeve
2. A tight-sleeved gown

つったちあがる〔突立ち上がる〕
〈自動〉To start to one's feet; to spring to one's feet; to jump to one's feet

content:
つったつ〔突立つ〕
〈自動〉To stand up straight; to stand

content.content: ぼんやり突っ立っている
He stands with a vacant stare.

つつっぽ〔筒っぽ〕
〈名〉
1. A tight sleeve
2. A tight-sleeved gown

content:
つっぱり〔突張り〕
〈名〉A prop (for a tree); a bar (for fastening a sliding-door)

content.content: 戸に突っ張りをかう
to fasten a sliding-door with a bar against its edge
松の枝に突っ張りをかう
to prop a pine-bough

content:
つっぱる〔突張る〕
〈他動〉
1. To stretch (an arm or a leg against anything)

content.content: 足を突っ張る
to plant one's feet on the ground
肘を突っ張る
to square one's elbows―(腰に手を当ててなら)―have one's arms akimbo
女が肘を突っ張って僕に向かった
The woman turned on me with her arms akimbo.
横腹が突っ張る
I have a stitch in the side―a twinge in the side.

つつましい〔慎ましい〕
〈形〉Modest

つつましやか〔慎ましやか〕
〈形〉Modest:(=に) modestly

つづまやか〔約やか〕
〈形〉
1. (=こぢんまりした)small and neat; cosy; snug
2. (=倹約な、質素な)frugal; modest

つづまり〔約り〕
〈名〉A termination; a conclusion; an end

つづまる〔約る〕
〈自動〉To be reduced; to be condensed; to be abridged; to be shortened

content:
つつみ〔堤〕
〈名〉
1. (=堤防)a bank; an embankment; a dyke, a dike

content.content: 堤を築く
to construct a bank―embank a river
堤が切れる
A bank gives way―A bank is breached―An embankment collapses.
堤が切れて洪水になった
The embankment collapsed, which caused a flood.
千丈の堤も蟻の穴より崩る
An ant-hole will destroy a dyke―(に相当するは)―“A little leak will sink a ship.”

content: 2. (=ため池)a reservoir

つつみ〔包み〕
〈名〉A bundle; a package:(小包み)a packet; a parcel:(大包み)a bale

content.content: 包みにする
to make a bundle―make a package―make a packet―make a parcel―pack goods―bundle clothes―make clothes into a bundle
風呂敷包み
a bundle
菰{こも}包み
a package wrapped in straw-matting
紙包み
a paper
薬一包み
a paper of medicine

つづみ〔鼓〕
〈名〉A kind of tabor; a hand-drum

content:
つつみかくし〔包み隠し〕
〈名〉Concealment

content.content: これが包み隠しの無いお話です
This is a plain statement―a straightforward story―an unvarnished tale.
あれは包み隠しの無い男だ
He is open as day―outspoken―free and open with everybody―an honest, downright fellow.
お互いの間に何も包み隠しの必要は無い
There need be not secret between us.
包み隠しの無いところその処置は賛成できぬ
To tell the truth,―To be frank with you,―I can not approve of the step.

content:
つつみかくす〔包み隠す〕
〈他動〉To conceal; to cover up (a crime); to stifle up, smother up (facts)

content.content: 包み隠さず
frankly―openly―plainly―straightforwardly
包み隠さず言おう
I will be open with you―frank with you―honest with you―straightforward with you.
包み隠さずに話す
to tell the plain truth―tell the downright truth―speak the plain, unvarnished truth
有りしことを包み隠さずに申します
I shall state the facts as they are.
彼は思ったことを包み隠さずに言う
He speaks his mind―He is plain-spoken―He is outspoken.
包み隠さず白状致します
I will make a clean breast of it.
彼は身元を包み隠している
He sails under false colours.

つつみがみ〔包み紙〕
〈名〉Brown paper

つつみぼたん〔包み釦<包みボタン>〕
〈名〉A covered button

つつみぼたん〔包み釦<包みボタン>〕
〈名〉A covered button

content:
つつむ〔包む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=くるむ)to wrap (a book in a newspaper); to fold (anything in paper); to tie up (things in a handkerchief); to do up (a parcel); to muffle up (one's throat); to pack (goods); to bundle (clothes, etc.)

content.content: 包みを包む
to do up a parcel―wrap up a parcel
果物が一つ一つ紙に包んである
The fruits are each wrapped in paper―folded in paper―done up in paper.
本を新聞紙に包んで下さい
Please wrap the book in a newspaper.
着物を風呂敷に包む
to wrap up clothes―bundle up clothes
小道具を手巾に包もう
I will tie up my things in a handkerchief.
外套に身を包む
to wrap oneself up in an overcoat
頸巻で喉を包む
to muffle up one's throat―muffle oneself up

content: 2. (=覆う)to cover (one's face with a veil); to wrap (anything in mist or darkness); to envelop (anything in mist, mystery, flames, etc.); to veil, shroud (anything in mystery); to fold (anything in mist); to muffle (a bell or a drum)

content.content: 全市暗黒に包まる
The whole city was wrapped in darkness―enveloped in darkness.
山々は霧に包まれている
The mountains are wrapped in mist―enveloped in mist―folded in mist―shrounded in fog.
家はたちまちにして火焔に包まれた
The house was soon enveloped in flames.
家人は火焔に包まれて逃げ場を失った
The inmates were enveloped in flames and caught in a trap.
事件は秘密の幕に包まれている
The affair is wrapped in a shroud of mystery―enveloped in mystery―veiled in mystery―shrouded in mystery.
日本人の起源は神秘に包まる
The origin of the Japanese people is wrapped in mystery―enveloped in mystery.
婦人は顔を包んでいる
Her face is veiled―covered with a veil.
(料理法)苺子をクリームで包む
to smother strawberries in cream
金を包んで出す
to offer one money under cover

content: 3. (=包み隠す)to conceal; to cover up (a crime); to stifle up, smother up (facts)

content.content: 包まず
frankly―openly―plainly―straightforwardly
包まずに言おう
I will be frank with you―open with you―plain with you―straightforward with you.
包まずに話す
to tell the plain truth―tell the downright truth―speak the plain, unvarnished truth
有りしことを包まずに申します
I shall state the facts as they are.
包まずに白状せい
Confess everything!―Make a clean breast of it!
彼は思ったことを包まずに言う男だ
He speaks his mind―He is plain-spoken―He is outspoken.
包みきれずに
unable to conceal it
彼はとうとう包みきれずに皆言ってしまった
At last, unable to keep it from me any longer, he told me everything.
犯人は包みきれずにとうとう白状した
The culprit, unable to cover up his crime any longer, confessed everything.
彼は悦びを包みきれずその光景を眺めておって
He stood gazing at the scene with unconcealed joy―with undisguised pleasure.

つづめる〔約める〕
〈他動〉To shorten; to reduce; to condense; to abridge

a trisyllable

a polysyllable

to misspell a word

orthography

a spelling-book―a speller

2. (=詩文の)composition

2. (=詩文を綴る)to compose (an essay or a poem)

to commit to writing

content:
3. (=本を綴じる)to bind(a book)
4. (=縫い合わせる)to sew together; to patch together

content.content: つづれを着ている

content.content: ツと立ち上がる
to start to one's feet

content:
つと〔ツと〕

content.content: ツと立ち上がる
to start to one's feet

つと〔苞苴〕
〈名〉
1. A straw-wrapper
2. (=土産物)a (visitor's) present

content:
つど〔都度〕
〈副〉Every time; each time

content.content: その都度払うのはうるさいから月末にいっしょに取りに来い
I find it troublesome to pay each time, so bring a bill at the end of the month.
三度彼を訪ねてその都度不在であった
I called on him three times, and found him absent every time―as many times.
変更の都度ご通知致します
I will let you know every time there is an alteration―whenever there is an alteration―as often as there is an alteration.

つどい〔集い〕
〈名〉A meeting; a gathering

つどう〔集う〕
〈自動〉To meet; to gather

content:
つとに〔夙に〕
〈副〉
1. (=朝早く)early in the morning; bright and early

content.content: つとに起き夜半に寝ぬ
to rise early and retire late

content: 2. (=幼い時に)early in life; in one's infancy; early

content.content: つとに語学の才有り
He early showed an aptitude for languages.

content: 3. (=とうから)for a long time; long

content.content: つとにその志を懐いている
I have long cherished the desire.

content:
つとまる〔勤まる〕
〈自動〉Can fill (an office); to be fit for (the post); to be equal to (the task)

content.content: 僕にはこの役は勤まらない
I am unfit for the post―unequal to the task.
あの人ならどんな役でも勤まる
He can fill any office―He is equal to any task.

content:
つとめ〔勤め、務め〕
〈名〉
1. Duty, duties; service; business

content.content: これは国家に対する勤めとしてするのだ
I do this as a duty to my country.
勤めを大事にする
to attend to one's duties―attend to one's business
何人も勤めが大事
Everybody must attend to his business.
まず務めを済ましてしかる後に遊ぶ
Business first and pleasure afterwards.
遊びが務めの妨げにならぬように
Pleasure must not interfere with business.
勤めを怠る
to neglect one's duties―be negligent of one's duties
彼は酒は飲んでも妙なことには務めを怠らぬ
He drinks, but, strange to say, he does not neglect his duties―he is diligent in attending to his duties.
日々の務めをする
to perform one's daily duties
女郎の勤め
prostitute service
わたしゃ勤めの身です
I am a prostitute.
(女郎が)二度の勤めをする
to serve another term
この洋服はだいぶお勤めをしている
This coat has seen much service.
でも裏返しすれば二度のお勤めができる
But if it is turned, it will be good for another term of service.
仏に対する勤め
Buddhistic service.

content:
つとめ〔勤め、務め〕
〈名〉
1. Duty, duties; service; business

content.content: これは国家に対する勤めとしてするのだ
I do this as a duty to my country.
勤めを大事にする
to attend to one's duties―attend to one's business
何人も勤めが大事
Everybody must attend to his business.
まず務めを済ましてしかる後に遊ぶ
Business first and pleasure afterwards.
遊びが務めの妨げにならぬように
Pleasure must not interfere with business.
勤めを怠る
to neglect one's duties―be negligent of one's duties
彼は酒は飲んでも妙なことには務めを怠らぬ
He drinks, but, strange to say, he does not neglect his duties―he is diligent in attending to his duties.
日々の務めをする
to perform one's daily duties
女郎の勤め
prostitute service
わたしゃ勤めの身です
I am a prostitute.
(女郎が)二度の勤めをする
to serve another term
この洋服はだいぶお勤めをしている
This coat has seen much service.
でも裏返しすれば二度のお勤めができる
But if it is turned, it will be good for another term of service.
仏に対する勤め
Buddhistic service.

content:
つとめあげる〔勤め上げる〕
〈他動〉To serve out

content.content: 奉公人が年期を勤め上げる
An apprentice serves his time―serves out his full time.

content:
つとめぎ〔勤め気〕
〈名〉A mercenary spirit

content.content: 彼らは勤め気を離れて働く
They work with a will.
女は勤め気を離れた客を大切にした
Her attentions to him were not those of the woman of the town.

content:
つとめぐち〔勤め口〕
〈名〉A situation; a place; a berth

content.content: 勤め口を捜す
to look out for a situation
勤め口ができた
He has found a situation―got a berth.

content:
つとめさき〔勤め先〕
〈名〉One's employer; one's office; one's headquarters

content.content: 君は勤め先はどこか
Where is your headquarters?
彼は勤め先をしくじった
He has been dismissed in disgrace.

content:
つとめて〔力めて〕
〈副〉As much as one can; to the best of one's ability; diligently; assiduously; sedulously; studiously

content.content: 彼はこの問題に触れることをつとめて避けている
He studiously avoids touching the question.
彼はつとめて主人の機嫌を取っている
He makes it his study to please his master.
病をつとめて出勤した
I attended my office in spite of my illness.
つとめて事実を確かめてみましょう
I will ascertain the fact as far as I can―to the best of my abilities.

content:
つとめにん〔勤め人〕
〈名〉An office-holder; an official; a clerk

content.content: 勤め人向きの家だ
It is just the house for an office-holder.

content:
つとめぼうこう〔勤め奉公〕
〈名〉Prostitute service

content.content: 勤め奉公をする
to do prostitute service―(初めてなら)―sell oneself for a prostitute
二度の勤め奉公をする
to serve another term

content:
つとめむき〔勤め向き〕
〈名〉Attention to one's duties

content.content: 彼は勤め向きは至って忠実だ
He is faithful in attending to his durties.

content:
つとめる〔勤める、務める〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=勤務する)to serve (an office―in an office); to hold (an office); to fill (a post)

content.content: 役を勤める
to hold an office―fill a post
彼は何役を勤めているか
What office does he hold?
侍医を勤めている
He hold the office of court physician―He is a court physician.
どこへ勤めているか
Where does he serve?
宮内省に勤めている
He serves in the Imperial Household―He holds an office in the Imperial Household―He is an official of the Imperial Household.
会社に勤めている
He serves a company―He is in the service of a company―He is in a company's service.
年期を勤める
to serve one's time―serve one's apprenticeship
現役を勤める
to serve with the colours
懲役を勤める
to serve time (in prison)

content: 2. (=芝居の役を勤める)to act, play, perform (a part); to enact (a r?le); to personate (a character)

content.content: 弁慶の役を勤める役者があるか
Can any actor play Benkei?―play the part of Benkei?
誰が正岡を勤めるか
Who will play Masaoka?―personate Masaoka?―do Masaoka?
立役を勤める
to act the leading part―play the leading part
大役を勤める
to play a weighty part

content: 3. (=何役をする)to act as (guide or interpreter); to officiate as (host)

content.content: 僕が仲人の役を勤めよう
I will act as go-between.
亭主役を勤める
to officiate as host―do the honours of the house
彼の細君が死んでから娘が主婦の役を勤めている
Since his wife died, his daughter has officiated as hostess―done the honours of the table.
名代を勤める
to act as deputy―act for another

content: 4. (=人の為に尽す)to do something for (a man); to pay attentions to (a person)

content.content: 彼の為にはずいぶん勤めたつもりだ
I hope I have done something for him―done my duty by him.
西洋人は細君に勤める
A foreigner pays attentions to his wife.
彼は主人に好く勤める
He pays sedulous attentions to his master―He is assiduous in his attentions to his master.
あの女は今までの女中の中で一番好く勤めてくれる
She pays me better attentions than any other servant I ever had.

content:
つとめる〔勤める、務める〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=勤務する)to serve (an office―in an office); to hold (an office); to fill (a post)

content.content: 役を勤める
to hold an office―fill a post
彼は何役を勤めているか
What office does he hold?
侍医を勤めている
He hold the office of court physician―He is a court physician.
どこへ勤めているか
Where does he serve?
宮内省に勤めている
He serves in the Imperial Household―He holds an office in the Imperial Household―He is an official of the Imperial Household.
会社に勤めている
He serves a company―He is in the service of a company―He is in a company's service.
年期を勤める
to serve one's time―serve one's apprenticeship
現役を勤める
to serve with the colours
懲役を勤める
to serve time (in prison)

content: 2. (=芝居の役を勤める)to act, play, perform (a part); to enact (a r?le); to personate (a character)

content.content: 弁慶の役を勤める役者があるか
Can any actor play Benkei?―play the part of Benkei?
誰が正岡を勤めるか
Who will play Masaoka?―personate Masaoka?―do Masaoka?
立役を勤める
to act the leading part―play the leading part
大役を勤める
to play a weighty part

content: 3. (=何役をする)to act as (guide or interpreter); to officiate as (host)

content.content: 僕が仲人の役を勤めよう
I will act as go-between.
亭主役を勤める
to officiate as host―do the honours of the house
彼の細君が死んでから娘が主婦の役を勤めている
Since his wife died, his daughter has officiated as hostess―done the honours of the table.
名代を勤める
to act as deputy―act for another

content: 4. (=人の為に尽す)to do something for (a man); to pay attentions to (a person)

content.content: 彼の為にはずいぶん勤めたつもりだ
I hope I have done something for him―done my duty by him.
西洋人は細君に勤める
A foreigner pays attentions to his wife.
彼は主人に好く勤める
He pays sedulous attentions to his master―He is assiduous in his attentions to his master.
あの女は今までの女中の中で一番好く勤めてくれる
She pays me better attentions than any other servant I ever had.

content:
つとめる〔勉める、努める、力める〕
〈自動〉To try hard, work hard, endeavour, use endeavours, exert oneself, make exertions, make efforts, strive, strain, study, make it one's study, set oneself (to do something)

content.content: 彼は成功せんと力めている
He is trying to succeed―endeavouring to succeed―striving to succeed.
目的を達せんと力めている
He is endeavouring to attain his object―striving after his object.
それから問題の解決に力めた
Then I set myself to solve the problem.
皆一等賞を得んと力めた
Everybody tried for the first prize―strove after the first prize.
彼は新説の宣伝に力めている
He is making efforts to propagandize the new doctrine.
改革に力めます
I will exert myself―make exertions―to effect a reform.
君の幸福を図るように力めます
I will make it my study―It shall be my study―to make you happy.
親を楽にさせるように力めます
I will make it my study―It shall be my study―to make my parents comfortable.
極力努める
to do one's utmost―strive to the utmost―strive amain―strain every nerve―make strenuous efforts
ご満足を与えるように極力努めます
I will do my utmost to give you satisfaction.
極力努めて目的を達します
I will strive to the utmost to attain my object.
極力と努めて遂行します
I will strain every nerve to accomplish my purpose.
忍耐して勉める
to persevere in one's efforts―keep at it
忍耐して勉めればいつか成功する
If you will keep at it, you will succeed in time.
以前に倍して勉めます
I will redouble my efforts―work with redoubled efforts.→『つとめて〔力めて〕』

content:
つな〔綱〕
〈名〉
1. A rope:(太いのは)a hawser:(細いのは)a cord

content.content: 綱を張る
to stretch a rope
綱を引く
to pull the rope
綱で引く
to pull at the rope
綱を渡る
to walk a rope
パンは命の綱
Bread is the staff of life.
この商売は命の綱だ
This business is my only means of livelihood.
この商売は頼みの綱だ
This business is my last resort―my only resource―my only hope.
頼みの綱が切れた
My last resort has failed―My only hope is gone.
彼は僕にとっては出世の綱だ
He has been the making of me―He has made me what I am.

つなうち〔綱打ち〕
〈名〉(事)rope-making:(人)a rope-maker

content:
つながる〔繋がる〕
〈自動〉To be joined together; to be linked together; to be connected (with each other); to be related (to each other)

content.content: 二人は血筋がつながっている
They are related by blood―of the same blood―consanguineous.
つながる縁
relation―connection
彼とはつながる縁でしかたがない
I can not help my relation to him―my connection with him.
彼はつながる縁であのように出世したのだ
His connections have raised him in the world.

content:
つなぎ〔繋ぎ〕
〈名〉A connection; a link:(隙ふさぎ、時間ふさぎの意味なら)a stop-gap; a warming-pan

content.content: 次の人が来るまで誰かつなぎに出しておこう
I will get some one to stop the gap till the next man comes.→『じゅずつなぎ〔珠数繋ぎ〕』

content:
つなぎあわせる〔繋ぎ合わせる〕
〈他動〉To join (things) together; to link (things) together

content.content: 梯子をつなぎ合わせる
to join ladders together―join one ladder to another
卓子をつなぎ合わせる
to join tables end to end
子どもらが手をつなぎ合わせて踊った
The children joined hands and danced.

つなぎいぬ〔繋ぎ犬〕
〈名〉A chained dog; a dog on the chain

つなぎうま〔繋ぎ馬〕
〈名〉A hitched horse; a tethered horse

つなぎなわ〔繋ぎ縄〕
〈名〉A tether

つなぎぶね〔繋ぎ船〕
〈名〉A moored ship

content:
つなぐ〔繋ぐ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=離れぬように繋ぐ、縛る)to tie, hitch, tether (a horse); to fasten, make fast (a boat); to chain (a dog); to moor (a ship)

content.content: 馬を門につなぐ
to tie a horse to the gate―hitch a horse to the door
門に馬がつないである
There is a horse at the gate.
馬を木につないで草を食わせる
to tether a horse
つないだ馬
a hitched horse―a tethered horse
犬を鎖でつなぐ
to chain a dog―chain up a dog
犬をつないでおけ
Keep your dog chained up―Keep your dog on the chain.
つないだ犬
a chained dog―a dog on the chain
糸につないだ玉
beads on a string
船をつなぐ
to moor a ship
小舟を岸につなぐ
to make a boat fast to the beach

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 獄につなぐ
to put a man in prison―cast a man into prison―imprison a man―lay a man by the heels
彼は久しく獄につながれている
He has long been in prison.
獄につながれて善くなる者は少ない
Few people grow better in prison.
女の髪の毛は大象をもつなぐ
“One hair of a woman draws more than a team of horses.”

content: 2. (=途切れぬように繋ぐ、続ける)to string (verses); to thread (beads)

content.content: 玉をつなぐ、珠数をつなぐ
to string beads―thread beads
つないだ玉
beads on a string
糸をつなぐ
to tie strings together

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 命をつなぐ
to support life―maintain life―keep alive―subsist
どうして命をつないでいたか
How did you manage to keep alive?―keep body and soul together?
露命をつなぐ
to keep body and soul together―string out a precarious existence
いくら不景気でも仕事をつないでやる
However bad times may be, I will keep you in work.

content: 3. (=連結する)to connect; to link; to join; to couple; to attach

content.content: 機関車を列車につなぐ
to attach a locomotive to a train―couple an engine to a train
梯子をつなぐ
to join ladders together―join one ladder to another
卓子をつなぐ
to join tables end to end
電話をつなぐ
to connect one person with another―put one on to another―put one through to another
百番へつないで下さい
Connect me with 100―Give me 100.
つなぎました
You are connected―You are on.

content:
つなひき〔綱曳き〕
〈名〉
1. ［遊戯］Tug of war

content.content: 綱曳きをする
to play at tug of war
綱曳きをして遊んだ
We had a tug of war.

content: 2. (=俥の綱曳き)the man who pulls at the rope

content.content: 綱曳きを付ける
to get a man to pull at the rope

content:
つなみ〔海嘯、津波〕
〈名〉A tidal wave

content.content: この海岸は往々津波に襲われる
This coast is frequently visited by tidal waves.
十カ村の漁村が津波のために一掃せられた
Ten fishing-villages were swept away by a tidal wave.

content:
つなみ〔海嘯、津波〕
〈名〉A tidal wave

content.content: この海岸は往々津波に襲われる
This coast is frequently visited by tidal waves.
十カ村の漁村が津波のために一掃せられた
Ten fishing-villages were swept away by a tidal wave.

つなわたし〔綱渡し〕
〈名〉A rope-ferry

content:
つなわたり〔綱渡り〕
〈名〉(事)rope-walking; rope-dancing; tight-rope dancing; funambulism:(人)a rope-walker; a rope-dancer; a tight-rope dancer; a funambulist:(=する) to walk a rope; to funambulate

content.content: そりゃ危ない綱渡りだ
That is an extremely risky business―a dangerous game.

content:
つね〔常〕
〈名〉
1. The usual state of things; the ordinary course of nature; a common occurrence; normal condition; one's habit; one's custom; one's wont:(=の) usual (work); ordinary (life); normal (ability); common (occurrence); habitual (action); customary (proceedings); wonted (civilities); everyday (clothes):(=に) usually; habitually; always; at ordinary times; at other times

content.content: 彼は常に早起きだ
He usually rises early―He is an early riser.
常のように早く起きた
He rose early as usual―as is usual with him―as is his custom―as is his wont.
先生は常にそう言われる
Our teacher always says so.
彼は常に酒を飲む
He is a habitual drinker.
常に冷水浴をすると身体が強壮になる
The habitual use of cold-water bathing will make you robust in health.
彼は常に勉強する
He is in the habit of working hard.
常にもっと勉強すれば試験前にあわてることは無い
If you worked harder at other times, you would not have to get flurried before the examination.
彼はいったい常に勉強しない
He does not work hard at the best of times.
常ならもっと安いのだ
It would be cheaper at other times.
常に養生すれば病気にかからない
Make a habit of taking good care of your health, and you will escape illness.
支那ではそんなことは常だ
Such things are of common occurrence in China.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: それが世の常だ、浮世の常だ
That is the way of the world.
不幸に同情するのは人情の常だ
It is human nature to sympathize with the unfortunate.
一勝一敗は戦争の常である
Success or failure is incidental to warfare.
何々を常とする
to be in the habit of doing something―wont to do something―usual with one to do something―a custom with one to do something―to make it a custom to―make it a rule to―do something
僕は間食をせぬことを常としている
I make it a rule not to eat between meals.
彼は夜更しするのを常としている

He is in the habit of sitting up till late―He is wont to sit up till late―It is usual with him to sit up till late―It is a custom with him to sit up till late―He makes it a custom to sit up till late.
彼は困っている人を助けるのが常だ
He is in the habit of helping people in need―He delights to help people in need.
何々を常とした
He used to do something―was wont to do something.
彼は試験前に徹夜するのを常とした
He used to sit up all night before the examination―He was wont to sit up all night before the examination―He was in the habit of sitting up all night before the examination.
常として
as is usual with...
女の常として彼女は虚栄心が強い
As is usual with women, she is vain―She is vain, as women will be.
虚栄心は女の常だ
It is usual with women to be vain―Women will be vain.
名利に奔走するのは凡俗の常だ
It is usual with people to toil for wealth or fame―People will toil for wealth or fame.
学生の常として彼はあればあるだけ使ってしまう
As is usual with students, he will spend all he has―He will spend all he has, as students will.
あればあるだけ使ってしまうのは学生の常だ
It is usual with a student to spend all he has―A student will spend all he has.
苦学力行は日本学生の常だ
It is usual with Japanese students to pursue knowledge under difficulties.
身体の弱い子どもの常として彼は学問にこりたがる
As is usual with boys of weak constitution, he will fling himself into books―He flings himself into books, as boys of weak constitution will.
身体の弱い少年は学問にこるのが常だ
A boy of weak constitution will fling himself into books.
人を嫉むのは凡夫の常だ
It is usual with ordinary mortals to be envious―Envy is a sign of mediocrity.
常ならぬ
unusual (result)―extraordinary (strength)―uncommon (ability)―unwonted (civility)―abnormal (genius, etc.)
彼は常ならぬ才能を有している
He possesses uncommon abilities―extraordinary powers―abnormal talents.
彼の常ならぬ丁寧さには何か意味があろうと思った
I suspected some design in his unwonted civility.
常ならぬ心地がする
I feel queer.
お顔色が常のようでない
You do not look your usual self.
彼女は常ならぬ身だ
She is with child―in the family way―in an interesting condition.
常無し
to be constantly changing―unstable―mutable
世は変遷常無し
The world is mutable.
人事の常無きことを感じた
I am impressed with the mutability of human things.
森羅万象変遷常無し
The universe is in a state of flux.

content:
つねづね〔常々〕
〈副〉Usually; always

content.content: 子どもらには常々から言って聞かしておきます
I always tell my children so.

content:
つねる〔抓る〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: つめる〔抓る〕

content:
つの〔角〕
〈名〉
1. A horn:(鹿の角)an antler; a buckhorn:(昆虫の触角は)a feeler; an antenna

content.content: 牛は角が有る
A cow has horns―A cow is armed with horns.
角で突く
(牛なら)to horn a man―gore a man―(山羊などなら)―butt a man
牛が角で人を突き殺す
A bull gores a man to death.
牛が人を角で突き飛ばす
A bull tosses a man.
角を出す
o shoot one's horns―(焼餅を焼くの意味なら)―have a fit of jealousy
角を引っ込ませる
to draw in one's horns
鹿の角は春落ちる
The stag sheds his horns in spring.
角を矯めて牛を殺す
“The remedy is worse that the evil.”
角細工
hornwork

content: 2. (=建物の袖)a wing (to a building)

content.content: 角を造る
to add a wing to a building

つのつき〔角突き〕
〈名〉(=牛の角突き)A bull-fight:(=する) to fight (with horns)

content:
つのつきあい〔角突き合い〕
〈名〉Variance

content.content: 二人はいつも角突き合いだ
They are always at variance with each other―at odds with each other―at daggers drawn with each other.

content:
つのや〔角屋〕
〈名〉A wing (to a building)

content.content: 角屋を造る
to add a wing to a building

content:
つのる〔募る〕
〈他動〉(=募集する)to raise (a subscription); to invite, collect, call for, appeal for (contributions); to invite, collect, advertise for (students); to raise, float (a loan); to raise, inaugurate (a fund); to raise, levy, enlist, recruit (troops)

content.content: 寄付金を募る
to raise a subscription―set a subscription on foot―open a subscription-book―invite contributions―collect contributions―call for contributions―appeal for contributions
人の為に寄付金を募る
to make a purse for―send round the hat for―some one
各学校で生徒を募っている
The schools are inviting students―collecting students―advertising for new students―open for new students.
新聞に広告して生徒を募る
to advertise for new students
あの商会では店員を募っている
The firm is inviting candidates for entrance into its service.
公債を募る
to raise a public loan―float a public loan
外債を募る
to raise a foreign loan―float a foreign loan
株を募る
to invite subscriptions for shares
資金を募る
to raise a fund―inaugurate a fund
兵を募る
to raise troops―levy troops―enlist men―recruit men
志願者を募る
to call for volunteers
意見を募る
to invite suggestions
懸賞文を募る
to invite essays by prize competition
懸賞図案を募る
to collect designs by prize competition
同志を募る
to call together men of the same views

content: 〈自動〉(=ますます烈しくなる)to grow worse; to grow more fierce; to grow more violent, grow in violence; to grow more severe, grow in severity; to grow more intense, grow in intensity; to gather (force)

content.content: 彼の乱暴が募る
His violence grows worse.
病勢が募るばかりだ
His illness goes on growing worse and worse.
殿の乱行が日々に募る
My lord's excesses grow worse and worse every day―daily grow worse.
暑さが募る
The heat grows more intense―grows in intensity.
寒さが募る
The cold grows more severe―grows in severity.
火勢が募る
The fire grows more fierce―grows more violent―grows in violence.
折柄の烈風に煽られて火勢ますます募った
The furious wind fanned the flames into greater violence.
風力が募る
The wind grows more violent―The wind grows in strength―The storm gathers.
例の癖がだんだん募ってくる
That habit of his is growing upon him―gaining upon him.
悪い癖は年と共に募る
A bad habit will grow with the lapse of years.
止めるとかえって募る
Remonstrance will make him only the worse.

つまんで言えば
Briefly stated―To sum up―In short―In brief―In a word―in sum―in substance.

Briefly stated, it is this―To sum up, the matter stands thus―The long and short of it is this.

話せば長いことだがつまんで言えば彼は金持ちになる近道をしようとしたのだ

content:
つまらない〔詰らない〕
〈形〉
1. Trifling (thing); trivial (matter); insignificant (man); petty (affair); worthless (man or thing); idle (tale); nonsensical (story); foolish (idea); silly (talk); trashy (book); frothy (literature); poor (result); paltry (man); meagre (life); contemptible (fellow); beggarly (account); trumpery (article); sorry (object); wretched (stuff); miserable (work); pitiful (thing); flimsy (pretext); frivolous (pretence); puerile (reason); absurd (theory); dull (place); dreary (scenery); cheerless (life, etc.)

a trifle―a trifling matter―a trivial matter―an insignificant matter―a matter of no consequence―a petty affair―nothing

He flies into a passion at trifles.
つまらぬことで気をもんでいる
He frets over trifles.
つまらぬことを争っている
They dispute about trifles.
つまらぬことにあくせくする
He makes a fuss about trifles.
つまらぬことに大騒ぎしている
There is much ado about nothing.
つまらないことをしてしまった
I have done a foolish thing.
つまらないことを並べ立てる
to make an imposing array of trivial matters―give “a beggarly account of empty boxes”
つまらない物
a trifle―a trifling thing―a worthless thing―(集合的に言えば)―trash―trumpery―frippery
こんなつまらない物を売り付けられた
I had such trash imposed upon me.
そんなつまならい物を買うものか
I am blest if I buy such trumpery―such frippery.
店にはつまらない物ばかり並べておく
The shop displays only trumpery―frippery―gewgaws―gimcracks―knick-knacks―kickshaws.
つまらない人間だ
He is an insignificant man―a worthless man―a contemptible fellow―a nobody.
あんなつまらない奴を相手にするな
Have nothing to do with such paltry fellows!
彼は名も無いつまらない人間だ
He is a nobody.
彼は金が無かったらつまらない人間だ
He would be a worthless man if he had no money―He is nothing without his money.
来てみるとつまらない所だ
I find a dull place.
つまらない仕事している
I am engaged in trivial work.
彼はなにかつまらない役を勤めている
He holds some insignificant office.
こんなつまらない本を読まぬ
I never read such trashy books―such frothy literature―such wretched stuff.
つまらない作だ
It is a pitiful work―a miserable work―sorry stuff―wretched stuff.
つまらない話
silly talk―idle tales―a nonsensical story―a cock-and-bull story
そんなつまらない話に耳を貸すものでない
You should not give ear to such idle tales.
彼のつまらない話は聞き飽きた
I am weary of listening to his silly talk.
そりゃつまらない考えだ
It is a foolish idea.
そんなつまらない考えを起こすものじゃない
You should not think of doing such a foolish thing.
彼はつまらない口実で学校を休む
He absents himself from school on flimsy pretexts.
つまらない理窟ばかり言っている
He is constantly airing absurd theories.
つまらない異論ばかり唱える
He is always raising trivial objections.
彼はつまらない理由で断った
He refused for a frivolous reason―for a puerile reason.
結果は存外つまらない
The result is poor beyond expectation―very unsatisfactory―a disappointment.
もと偉かった人がつまらなくなった
The once great man has sunk into insignificance―shrunk into insignificance.
彼はつまらない月日を送っている
He leads a dull life―lives a cheerless life―leads a dreary existence.
つまらなそうな顔をしている
He looks cheerless―He has a glum look.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: つまらないことに力こぶを入れている
His zeal is worthy of a better cause.
つまらないことを大仰に言う
He makes a mountain of a mole-hill.
つまらないことを言うな
Don't talk nonsense!―Don't talk rot!
自殺だって?そんなつまらん了簡を出しちゃ困る
Suicide? You must not think of committing such a rashness.
つまらない目に逢った
If was a misfortune―a misadventure.
あんな処へ行ってつまらないことをした
I went on a fool's errand.
こんな処に居てはつまらない
It won't do―It doesn't pay―to stay in such a place.
人生がつまらなくなった
I have lost interest in life―I find life a bore.
宴会はつまらない
A dinner is a bore.
生きているのはつまらない
Life is a bore.
つまらないから帰る
I will go home, for there is nothing doing.
なんだつまらん
Nonsense!―Stuff!―Stuff and nonsense!
ああつまらない

(面白いことが無くてなら)I am bored―I am sick of life―I am weary of the world―(物事が思うようにいかなくてなら)―I am so vexed―I am sick at heart―(なにもかもいやになってなら)―I fell so wretched―I have a fit of the blues―(当てがはずれてなら)―I am so disappointed.

content:
つまり〔詰り〕
〈名〉
1. (=羅紗などの収縮)shrink; shrinkage

content.content: 詰まりを見なければならぬ
We must allow for shrinkage.
みのつまり〔身の詰まり〕

content:
』
〈副〉(=畢竟、結局、要するに)after all; eventually; in the event; in the end; in the long run; in the final analysis; in fine; in a word; in short; in brief

content.content: どれもつまり同じことさ
They all come to the same thing, after all.
つまり正直にしていりゃ損が無いということになる
Honesty is the best policy, after all.
つまり高い物の方が得だ
The dearer thing is more economical in the end.
戦争はつまり財源の問題だ
War is, in the long run, a question of resources.
王侯も乞食もつまり同じ人間だ
Princes and paupers, in the final analysis, belong to the same family.
つまり身分不相応のぜいたくから悪事をするのだ
In fine, they commit crimes by living above their means.
つまりこうさ
In a word, the matter stands thus:
つまりこういうわけさ
In short, this is how it is.

つまりだか〔詰り高〕
〈名〉Shrink; shrinkage

content:
つまる〔詰まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=塞がる)to close; to be closed; to be obstructed; to be blocked up; to be stopped up; to be filled up; to be choked; to be clogged

content.content: 煙管が詰まった
The pipe is choked―clogged.
下水が詰まった
The drain is choked―clogged―stopped up―filled up.
入口が詰まっている
The entrance is blocked up.
息が詰まる
to be choked―stifled―suffocated―smothered
煙で息が詰まった
I was choked with smoke―stifled by smoke―suffocated by smoke.
この室は息が詰まるようだ
This room is close―stuffy―stifling―suffocating.
風邪を引いて鼻が詰まった
I have a cold in the nose―a cold in the head.
泣きたくて喉が詰まる
to feel a lump in one's throat
気が詰まる
to feel constrained―feel oppressed
皆黙っていると気が詰まる
Silence is oppressive.
あの人の前へ出ると気が詰まる
His presence is oppressive.
座敷は気が詰まるから逃げて来た
I have escaped from the oppressive atmosphere of the drawing-room.

content: 2. (=満つる)to be filled; to be packed

content.content: 鞄はいっぱいに詰まっている
The trunk is packed full.
会場はギッシリ詰まっている
The hall is closely packed (with people).

content: 3. (=縮まる)to shrink; to shorten; to become shorter

content.content: ネルは詰まる
Flannel shrinks.
ネルは洗うと詰まる
Washing shrinks flannel.
命が詰まる
Life is shortened.
苦労をすると寿命が詰まる
Care shortens life―“Care preys upon life”―“Care killed the cat.”
寿命の詰まるような思いをした
I had an experience likely to shorten my natural term of existence.
そんな無理をすると寿命が詰まるぞ
You are driving a nail into your coffin―adding a nail to your coffin.
日が詰まってきた
The days are growing shorter.
秋は夜が延びて日が詰まる
In autumn, the night gains upon the day.
春は日が延びて夜が詰まる
In spring, the day gains upon the night.
この靴は爪先の処が詰まって足が痛い
These shoes pinch me at the toes.
この洋服は襟が詰まって苦しい
This coat strangles me.

content: 4. (=差し詰まる)to be reduced to extremity; to be driven to one's wits' end; to be driven into a corner; to be cornered; to be pressed (for money); to be hard up (for money); to be at a loss (for an answer)

content.content: 僕は金に詰まっている
I am pressed for money―hard up (for money).
廓の金には詰まるが習い
One who frequents gay quarters will soon want for money.
人は金に詰まって悪事を働く
People commit crimes from want on money.
グッと返答に詰まって
I was at a loss for an answer―stuck for an answer.
議論に詰まる
to be driven into a corner―to be cornered
彼は議論に詰まって無茶なことを言い出した
Driven into a corner, he came roundly up to the statement that two and two may not always make four.
今度はいよいよ詰まってしまった
I am driven to my wits' end―driven to the last extremity.
身が詰まる
to be ruined―go to ruin
あんなぜいたくをすれば身が詰まるばかりだ
Such extravagance can but end in ruin.

content: 5. (=行き詰まる)to stand still; to come to a standstill; to come to a dead-lock; to stick; to stick fast; to break down

content.content: そこまではどうやら言ったがそこで詰まってしまった
I expressed myself somehow so far, and there stuck.
彼は演説の最中に詰まってしまった
He broke down in the midst of his speech.
談判が詰まってしまった
The negotiations have come to a standstill―come to a dead-lock―The negotiations are at a standstill at a dead-lock.

content:
つみ〔罪〕
〈名〉
1. (=法律上の罪)a crime

content.content: 罪を犯す
to commit a crime―perpetrate a crime―be guilty of a crime
彼は謀殺の罪を犯した
He has committed murder―He is guilty of murder.
さすがは犯せし罪の恐ろしく遂に官憲に自首した
Filled with remorse for his crime, he finally gave himself up to the authorities.
罪を罰する
to punish a crime―satisfy justice―fulfill justice
罪を罰しなければならぬ
Justice must be satisfied―Justice must be fulfilled.
人の罪を罰する
to punish one for a crime
死をもって罪を罰する
to punish a crime with death
窃盗犯は昔は死をもって罰すべき罪であった
Theft was formerly a crime punishable with death.
彼は謀殺の罪で罰せられた
He was punished for murder.
罪を糺す
to inquire into one's crime
罪を問う
to accuse one of a crime―charge one with a crime―call one to account
罪を負わせる
to charge one with a crime―fasten a crime upon one
罪を負う
to answer for a crime
彼は罪が深い
He has much to answer for.
罪が重い
It is a grave crime―a grievous crime―a heinous crime.
罪が軽い
It is a light crime.
罪を重くする、軽くする
to aggravate the crime―alleviate the crime
隠せば罪重し
Concealment aggravates the crime.
自白すれば罪は軽し
Confession alleviates the crime.
罪の疑わしきは軽くせよ
A doubtful crime should not be punished.
罪ある行動
a criminal action
その罪はしばらく措いて問わず、ずいぶんばかなことをしたものだ
Setting apart for the moment the criminality of the action, what a foolish thing he has done!
罪を赦す
to pardon a crime

content: 2. (=宗教道徳上の罪)a sin; a trespass; a transgression

content.content: 罪を犯す
to sin―commit a sin―be guilty of a sin
彼は偽りの罪を犯した
He is guilty of falsehood.
天汝の罪を罰せん
Heaven will punish you for your sin.
罪を悔い改める
to repent of one's sins
罪を悔い改めた人
a repentant sinner
罪を悔い改めた女
a fair penitent
罪を悔い改めた心
a contrite heart
罪を滅ぼす
to atone for a crime―expiate one's sins―do penance for one's sins
過去の罪を滅ぼす
to atone for the past
善行をもって罪を贖{あがな}う
to atone for one's sins by good works
(キリストのように)世の罪を贖う
to redeem man from sin and damnation
罪の深い商売だ
It is a sinful trade―a cruel trade―He has much to answer for.
その罪を悪んでその人を悪まず
Detest the sin, but weep for the sinner.
罪を赦す
to pardon a sin―remit a sin―absolve one of sin
赦されぬ罪
a deadly sin
赦さるる罪
a venial sin
罪ある考え
sinful thoughts

content: 3. (=身に覚えある罪)guilt

content.content: 罪を犯した覚えが有る
I am guilty.
罪を犯した覚えが無い
I am not guilty―guiltless―innocent.
罪を白状する
to confess one's guilt―confess oneself to be guilty―confess that one is guilty
罪に服す、罪に服さぬ
to plead guilty―plead not guilty
彼は恐れ入って罪に服した
He threw himself on the mercy of the court.
罪を断ずる
to conclude one to be guilty
赤面したので罪が顕れた
His blush betrayed his guilt.
罪ある人
a guilty man

content: 4. (=犯した罪)offence

content.content: 法律に対して罪を犯す
to offend against the law
その罪赦し難し
The offence is unpardonable.

content: 5. (=負わせる罪)charge

content.content: そんな罪を犯した覚えが無い
I am innocent of the charge.
彼は忘恩の罪免れ難し
He is open to the charge of base ingratitude.
罪を立証する
to bring a charge home to one

content: 6. (=誰の罪)fault; blame; responsibility

content.content: 誰の罪か
Whose fault is it?―Who is to blame for it?―Who is responsible for it?
この失敗は誰の罪か
Who is to blame for this failure?―Who is responsible for this failure?
この災難は僕の罪ではない
I am not to blame for this calamity―I am not responsible for this calamity―This calamity has happened through no fault of mine―It is through no fault of mine that this calamity has happened.
こうなったのは君の罪だ
You are to blame for this―You are responsible for this―This has happened through your fault.
事が破れても僕の罪ではない
I shall not be to blame or its failure―I shall not be responsible for its failure―It shall fail through no fault of mine.
誰の罪でもない
It is nobody's fault―Nobody is to blame for it―Nobody is responsible for it.
君の罪でなくて誰の罪か
Whose fault is it but your own?―Who is to blame for it but yourself?
こういう人を作るのは社会の罪だ
It is the fault of society that such men are made―Society is to blame for making such men―Society is responsible for making such men.
罪は船長に在り
The fault lies with the captain.
罪は自家に在り
The fault lies with yourself―The fault lies at your own door.
己が罪
one's own fault
君が失敗したら己が罪だ
It is your own fault if you fail―You will have to thank yourself for your failure.
僕が死ぬのは君の罪だ
My blood is on your head.
君が死んだなら己の罪だ
Your blood shall be on your own head.
何百万の人を殺したのは誰の罪か
On whose head is the blood of millions?
この戦争を起こしたのは誰の罪か
Who is to blame for causing this war?―Who is responsible for this war?
知らずして犯せる者には罪無し
No blame attaches to the unconscious doer of wrong.
罪を人に帰す
to impute the fault to one―lay the fault to one's charge―lay the fault at one's door
人に罪をきせる、罪をかぶせる、罪を背負わせる、罪を浴せる、罪を塗り付ける、罪を嫁す
to lay the blame on one―charge the guilt on one―fasten the guilt on one
彼に罪をかぶせるのは可哀想だ
It is cruel to lay the blame on the poor fellow.
互いに罪をきせ合う
to recriminate each other
罪をかぶる、罪を背負う
to bear the blame―bear another's blame
人の罪を責める
to blame one for a fault
彼の怠慢の罪を責めた
I blamed him for his negligence.
罪を免れる
to be absolved of blame
罪が重い、罪が軽い
He is much to blame―not much to blame.
一時の出来心なら罪が軽い
If he acted on impulse, he is not much to blame.
罪を謝す
I apologize for my fault―I acknowledge my fault.

content: 7. (=刑罰)punishment; penalty:(=する) to punish (the culprit); to chastise, correct (the offender)

content.content: 罪に処す
to punish the offender―sentence one to punishment
罪に落とす
to bring one to justice
罪一等を減ずる
to reduce the penalty by one degree
罪あらば朕を
If fault there be, correct this me
罪せよ天津神
For that, ye heavely powers!
民は我が身の
The people are my children born
生みし子なれば
In good or evil hours.

content: 8. (=残酷)cruelty

content.content: 罪を作る
to commit a cruelty
いやいや罪作りをした
Well, well, I have committed an act of cruelty―What a cruel thing have I done!
(返事をせずに)気をもませるのは罪だ
It is cruel to keep him suspense.
(くれもせずに)ただ見せつけるのは罪だ
It is cruel to mock him with the mere sight.
君は女をだましてずいぶん罪なことをする人だ
You are trifling with a girl's feelings―You are a cruel trifler.
罪な人だ
(日本では)You are a cruel man―(西洋では)―She is a cruel beauty.

content:

content.content: 無実の罪
a false accusation―a false charge
無実の罪をきせられた
I was falsely accused.
罪の無い
innocent―harmless
子どもは罪が無い
Children are innocent―guileless.
罪の無い顔をしている
She is innocent-looking.
あれは罪の無い男だ
He is a harmless fellow.
罪の無い遊びだ
Such are innocent amusements―harmless amusements.
何の罪も科{とが}も無い者を
That an innocent man should be so dealt with!
そんなことはまだ罪の無い方だ
Such conduct is pardonable.
ごく罪の無いお囃を一席伺います
I will tell you a story that will make you laugh.
女が男の浮気の罪を責めた
She reproached him with inconstancy.
金を見せるのは罪だ
The sight of money is a temptation.
あの顔付きでは罪を免れぬ
His looks condemn him.
小人罪無し玉を抱いて罪あり
“Opportunity makes the thief.”
延引の罪を謝す
I must apologize for my delay.
無音の罪を恕せ
Do not be offended at my long silence.

content.content: 何の罪科も無い者を

content: 2. (=積載する)to lade (goods in a ship―a ship with goods); to load (goods in a cart―a cart with goods); to stow (goods in the hold―the hold with goods); to freight (a ship); to pack (a horse):(船を主とすれば)to take in (cargo or freight); to take (cargo) on board:(陸から船へなら)to ship (a cargo); to send (a cargo) on board

The ship is taking in cargo―taking in freight―taking cargo on board.

経験を積む

彼は授業にかけては経験を積んでいる

練習を積む

功を積む

蛍雪の功を積む
to burn the midnight oil

〈名〉A nail:(猫などの爪)a claw:(鷹などの爪)a talon:(牛馬の爪)a hoof:(錨の爪)a fluke

content.content: 手の爪
finger-nails
足の爪

爪を生やす

猫は爪を隠す

能ある鷹は爪を隠す(に相当するは)

爪で弾く
to flip―fillip
爪で着物の塵を払う

爪の垢

content:

1. (=填める)to pack (a trunk―a trunk with goods―goods in a trunk); to fill (a cavity―a bottle with wine); to stuff (a fowl with vegetables); to cram (a room with people)

content.content: 鞄に詰める

content: 2. (=縮める)to shorten; to make shorter; to reduce; to condense; to abridge

content.content: 長ければ詰めろ
If it is too long, make it shorter.
文を詰める
to abridge a composition―(文法では)―condense a sentence
修業年限を詰める

帆を詰める

Please take in these trousers by an inch.

少し暮らしを詰めなければならぬ

あんな思いをすると寿命を詰める

(電車の車掌が)どうぞ中ほどへお詰め下さい

content.content: 論じ詰める

content: 7. (=役所などに勤める)to attend (one's office)

content.content: 皆いつもの通り詰めております

content: 8. (=何々し詰める、続ける)to keep (doing something)

content: 9. (=何々し詰める、尽す)to come to the end of (anything)
