content:
つめる〔抓る〕
〈他動〉To pinch; to nip

content.content: つめられて痣になった
I am bruised by a pinch―pinched black and blue.
夢でないかと身をつめってみる
I pinch myself to see if it is not a dream―I can not credit the evidence of my eyes―I doubt the evidence of my senses―I can not realize my situation.
我が身をつめって人の痛さを知れ
Judge of others' feelings by your own.
身をつめって思い出す
to refresh one's memory―jog one's memory―fillip one's memory―touch up one's memory

content:
つもり〔積り〕
〈名〉
1. (=意向)intention; purpose:(=である) to intend, mean (to do something); to purpose (doing something); to propose (to do or doing something)

content.content: どうするつもりか
What do you intend to do?―What do you mean to do?―What are you going to do?
いつまでご滞在のおつもりですか
How long do you intend to stay?―How long are you going to stay?
両三日居るつもりです
I intend to stay a few days―I am going to stay a few days.
欧米を漫遊するつもりです
I intend to travel―purpose travelling―propose to travel―propose travelling―in Europe and America.
何々するつもりで
for the purpose of―with the intention of―with the view of―with a view to―doing something
僕は英語をやるつもりで上京しました
I have come to town with the intention of―with the view of―studying English.
彼は特待生になるつもりで勉強している
He is working hard with a view to gaining scholarship.
始めから英語の先生になるつもりではなかった
I had no intention of teaching English at first.
僕は洋行するつもりは無い
I have no intention of going abroad.
人を害するつもりはもうとう無い
Nothing can be farther from my intentions than to injure others.
お子息をどうなさるおつもりですか
What are you going to do with your boy?―What are your intentions regarding your son?
忰を軍人にするつもりです
I intend to make a soldier of my boy―intend that he shall be a soldier―intend him to be a soldier―intend him for a soldier.
彼はどういうつもりかさっぱりわからぬ
I can not make out his intentions.
お祝いのつもりですからどうぞ取って下さい
Please accept it, for it is intended for a congratulatory present.

content: 2. (=期待)expectation; hope:(=である) to expect (to do something); to hope (to do something); to count on (doing something)

content.content: 今度は成功するつもりだ
I expect to succeed this time―I hope I shall succeed this time.
英国に三年は居れるつもりです
I expect to be able to stay in England for three years.
少なくとも百円には売れるつもりです
I count on getting 100 yen for it at the very least.
何々するつもりで
in expectation of―in the hope of―in hopes of―doing something
友人に逢えるつもりで会に出席した
I attended the meeting in hopes of meeting some friends.
褒美を貰うつもりでしたことだ
He did it in the hope of getting a reward―in expectation of a reward.
戦争があるつもりで仕入れた品だ
The stock was laid in expectation of a war.
僕が去ると君が後へ入るのだからそのつもりでいて下さい
You will understand that you are to take my place when I leave.
そのつもりで待っています
I shall wait in that hope.

content: 3. (=誤想)imagination; fancy; supposition:(=である) to imagine (oneself to be safe); to fancy (oneself to be beautiful); to suppose (it to be so)

content.content: 僕は今度は大丈夫なつもりでいたのに
I imagined myself to be safe this time.
あれで美人のつもりだから驚く
She fancies herself to be beautiful.
あれで英語を教えるつもりだから恐れ入る
He fancies himself to be able to teach English.
彼は自分ではどこまでも間違っていないつもりだから困る
He imagines himself to be right.
彼は神経家で病気でもないのに病気のつもりだ
He is a hypochondriac, and fancies himself to be ill.
僕は君が死んだつもりでおった
I supposed you to be dead.
何々のつもりで
imagining that―fancying that―supposing that―under the impression that―under the apprehension that...
よっぽど好いつもりで買ったのだ
I bought it, supposing that it was a very good one.
好いことをするつもりでとんでもないことをしてしまった
I have committed a folly under the impression I was doing good.
彼は戦死するつもりで書き置きをしたのがこれだ
This is the will he made under the apprehension that he was going to fall in battle.
彼は仇を受けたつもりで悔しがっている
He broods over his fancied wrongs.
禍のつもりで歎いている
He grieves over an imagined evil.
彼は世を益するつもりでいる
He is, as he imagines, benefiting mankind.
敵のつもりでいた者が味方であった
I found a friend in a supposed enemy.

content: 4. (=見積り)an estimate; estimation; calculation

content.content: 積もりがすっかりはずれた
My calculation is upset―I have miscalculated―I am out in my reckoning.

content: 5. (=着物の見積り)cutting (a gown)

content.content: 積もりだけうちでして外へ縫いに出します
We only cut at home, and put out the work.

content:
つもりがき〔積り書き〕
〈名〉A written estimate

content.content: 大工に積もり書きを出させてみた
I had the carpenter make an estimate.

content:
つもりちがい〔積り違い〕
〈名〉A wrong estimate; miscalculation:(=する) to miscalculate; to make a wrong estimate

content.content: ちと積もり違いをした
I have miscalculated a little―I am out in my reckoning.

content:
つもる〔積る〕
〈自動〉(=堆積する)to accumulate; to cumulate; to be amassed

content.content: 塵が積もる
Dust accumulates.
塵が積もっている
Dust lies thick on the floor or furniture.
塵積もって山となる
Dust amassed will make a mountain―“Many a pickle makes a mickle.”
積もりては払うに
When dust amassed a mountain makes,
難くなりぬべし
'Tis hard to shake it off;
塵ばかりなる
So fares it with man who will
事と思えど
At trifles laugh and scoff.
雪が積もる
Snow lies on the ground.
たいそう雪が積もった
Snow lies deep on the ground.
雪が五寸積もった
Snow lies six inches deep―Six inches of snow has fallen.
この雪は積もるね
This snow will stay.
この雪は積もらない
This snow will not stay.
小遣いも積もると大したものだ
Small expenses come up to a large sum.
借金が積もり積もって五百円
The debts have run up to 500 yen.
積もる話
accumulated matter for talk
積もる話をする
to compare notes (with each other)
積もる話がしてみたい
I should like to compare notes with him―I have so much to tell him.
お互いに積もる話が有るだろう
You must have a hundred recollections to exchange with each other.

content:
〈他動〉
1. (=見積る)to estimate (the cost at 1,000 yen); to value (the goods at 10,000 yen); to calculate (the attendance at 100); to put (the number at so many); to rate (anything high or low)

content.content: 建築費は一万円と積もってある
The cost o. building is estimated at 10,000 yen.
物品の価格は五千円と積もってある
The goods are valued at 5,000 yen.
来会者はざっと千名と積もってよかろう
The attendance may be roughly calculated at 1,000―put at 1,000.
費用を積もる
to estimate the expenses―make an estimate of the expenses
ざっと積もる
to make a rough estimate
入費はざっと積もって五百円はかかる
The expenses may be roughly estimated at 500 yen.
高く積もる、安く積もる
to estimate or rate anything high or low
高く積もっても百万円は有るまい
He can not be worth a million at most.
安く積もっても五十万円は有るだろう
He must be worth half a million at least.
この家は金に積もると二万円がものはある
The house may be valued at 20,000 yen.
時価に積もると三万円がものはある
It is worth 30,000 yen at the current price.
人間の価値は金に積もれない
A man's worth is priceless―above price.

content: 2. (=限る)to stint, skimp, pinch (one in food or money)

content.content: 食物を積もって当てがう
to stint one in food―skimp one in food―pinch one in (or of or for) food
小遣いを積もって当てがわれるから自由が利かない
I have my freedom restricted, for I am stinted in my pocket-money.

content:
つや〔艶〕
〈名〉
1. (=光沢)gloss; lustre; polish; brightness

content.content: 艶の有る
glossy―lustrous―polished―bright
艶の有る毛
glossy hair―sleek hair
彼女の毛は絹のような艶がある
Her hair has a silky lustre.
艶のある顔色
a bright complexion
艶のある顔
a bright-complexioned face
艶のある声
a clear voice
艶の無い
lustreless―dull―dim―mat
艶を付ける、艶を出す
to bring out the lustre―(絹なら)―gloss silk―(紙なら)―glaze paper―surface paper―calender paper―(金属なら)―burnish metal―(黒檀なら)―polish ebony―(布なら)―mangle linen―calender cloth
艶出し機械
a mangle―a calender
艶紙
glazed paper―surfaced paper―calendered paper
艶布巾
polishing-cloth
艶を消す
to subdue the lustre―(ガラスなら)―frost glass―grind glass―mat glass―(金なら)―mat gold―(銀なら)―frost silver―(写真なら)―gray a photograph―(漆なら)―mat lacquer
艶消し
(ガラス)frosted glass―ground glass―mat glass―(金)―mat gold―(銀)―frosted silver―(写真)―a grayed photograph―(漆)―mat lacquer

content: 2. (=愛嬌、色気)charm; romance; love

content.content: 艶の有る女だ
She is a charming woman―a romantic girl.
女は男を持つと艶が出る
Love heightens a girl's charms.
話に艶を添える
to give colour to a story
艶っぽい話
a romantic tale―a spicy story―a racy story―a piquant story―an amorous story
艶事
a love affair
艶種
a love scandal

content:
つや〔通夜〕
〈名〉A wake; a lyke-wake; vigils

content.content: 通夜をする
to hold a wake―keep vigils
この地方では人が死ぬと全村集まって通夜をする
When a man dies in this part of the country, the whole village will hold a wake over his body.

つやがみ〔艶紙〕
〈名〉Glazed paper; surfaced paper; calendered paper

content:
つやけし〔艶消し〕
〈形〉Frosted (glass or silver); ground (glass); mat (gold, glass, lacquer, etc.); grayed (photograph)

content.content: 艶消しにする
to subdue the lustre―(ガラスなら)―frost glass―grind glass―mat glass―(金なら)―mat gold―(銀なら)―frost silver―(漆なら)―mat lacquer―(写真なら)―gray a photograph

content:
つやごと〔艶事〕
〈名〉A love affair; a romance

content.content: あの芸者は男嫌いでかつて艶事に関係したことが無い
She is a man-hater, and was never concerned in a love affair―and never lent herself to romance.

つやだし〔艶出し〕
〈名〉A mangle; a calender:(=する) to mangle (linen); to calender (cloth or paper); to glaze, surface (paper); to polish (ebony); to burnish (metal)

content:
つやだね〔艶種〕
〈名〉A love scandal; a romance

content.content: あれは艶種の多い男だ
He often lends himself to romance―He is the hero of many a scandal.

content:
つやっぽい〔艶っぽい〕
〈形〉Romantic, spicy, racy, piquant, amorous (story, etc.)

content.content: 君のことだから艶っぽい話をドッサリ持って帰ったろう
You must have had many romantic adventures on your journey.

content:
つやつやした〔艶々した〕
〈形〉Glossy, sleek (hair, etc.)

content.content: 艶々した老人だ
He is a sleek old man.

content:
つゆ〔汁〕
〈名〉Soup

content.content: 汁を吸う
to eat soup

content:
つゆ〔梅雨〕
〈名〉The rainy season; the summer rains

content.content: 梅雨に入る
The rainy season sets in.
梅雨が明けた、梅雨が上がった
The rains are over.
雷が鳴ると梅雨が上がる
A thunderstorm marks the end of the rainy season.

content:
つゆ〔露〕
〈名〉
1. Dew

content.content: 露が下りる
Dew falls.
露の滴
dewdrops
露を払う
to brush the dew―shake off the dewdrops
草の露を払う
to brush the dewdrops off the grass
露を帯べる花
dew-laden flowers
朝露
morning-dew
夜露にさらす
to expose anything to the night-dew―dew-ret flax or hemp
雨露をしのぐ
to shelter oneself from the rain
着物が露に濡れている
My clothes are wet with dew.
濡れぬ先にこそ露をも厭え
Dry feet dread the dew―Wet feet dread no dew―When a woman once loses her chastity, she will shrink from nothing.
露をだに厭う{いとう}
E'en dew of morning she doth dread,
大和のおみなえし
Yamato's tender maid;
ふるアメリカに
That foreign rain her sleeve hath wet,
袖は濡らさじ
Shall of her ne'er be said.
露の命
transient life
露の世
“Life is a bubble.”
絞首台の露と消える
to come to the gallows―end one's days on the gibbet
彼は戦場の露と消えた
He fell in battle.
露ほども、露いささかも
(not) in the least
そんな考えは露ほども有りません
Far be it from me to do such a thing.
露ほども疑いは無い
There is not the shadow of a doubt.
そんなこととは露知らず
I little knew that it was so.
露の間も
not even for a moment

つゆけき〔露けき〕
〈形〉Dewy (field, etc.)

content:
つゆはらい〔露払い〕
〈名〉
1. (=先導)leading the way; opening the game; introduction:(=に) by way of introduction

content.content: 露払いをする
to lead the way―open the game

content:
2. (=相撲の露払い)the usher (to the champion wrestler when he parades on the ring)
3. (=牛の露払い)the dewlap

つよい〔強い〕
〈形〉Strong; powerful; mighty

content.content: 力の強い人
a strong man―a mighty man
彼は力が強い
He has great strength.
腕っ節の強い男だ
He is a man of great strength.
身体が強い
He has a strong constitution―an iron constitution―a powerful physique.
どちらが強いか
Which is the stronger of the two?
どっちが強いか一つ勝負をしてみよう
We will see which is the better man.
強い者が勝つ
The stronger will win―“The battle is to the strong.”
君は僕には強過ぎる
You are too much for me―more than a match for me.
強い運の人
a mighty warrior―a doughty hero
強い国
a strong country―a powerful state―a mighty power
風が強い
The wind is strong―There is a high wind―It is blowing hard.
ちょいと強い風
a fresh breeze―a smart breeze
強い火
a strong fire
強い地震
a severe earthquake―a severe shock
強い熱
strong heat―intense heat―(体温なら)―high fever
強い光線
strong light―intense light
強い酒
strong wine
彼は意志が強い
He has a strong will―He is strong-willed.
僕は胃が強い
I have a good digestion.
足が強い
I am a good walker―a good pedestrian.
彼は気が強い
He is spirited―plucky.
酒が強い
He is a good drinker―He has a large capacity for wine.
君は船に強いか
Are you a good sailor?
船に強くない
I am a poor sailor.
この葱は匂いが強い
These onions are strong―rank.
この料理は味が強い
The dish is highly seasoned.
この魚は油が強い
This fish is oily―greasy.
君は運が強い
You are very fortunate―Fortune's pet.
悪運が強い
“The devil's child has the devil's luck.”
籤が強い
You are lucky at lottery.
強いばかりが武士でない
Might alone does not make a samurai.
強い中にも優しみが有る
He is strong yet tender.
彼は口では強そうなことを言っている
He brags of his strength―He bluffs.
鼻っ張りの強い男だ
He is a braggart―a blusterer.
悪に強けりゃ善にも強い
“A strong enemy will make a strong friend.”
善にも悪にも強い人だ
He is capable of good and evil―He has a power for good and evil.
弱きを助けて強きをくじく
to help the weak and crush the strong―fight for the oppressed against the oppressor→『つよく〔強く〕』

content:
つようする〔強うする〕
〈他動〉To strengthen; to fortify

content.content: 日本にこの人有りと思えば人意を強うするに足る
The presence of such a man in Japan will fortify the public mind―It is reassuring that Japan should boast such a man.

content:
つよき〔強気〕
〈名〉A strong market; a bullish tone

content.content: 強気連が買いあおる
The bulls boom the market.

content:
つよく〔強く〕
〈副〉Strongly; hard:(=する) to strengthen; to fortify; to confirm

content.content: 風が強く吹く
It blows hard.
頭を強く打ってやった
I struck him a hard blow on the head.
強く出る
to take the high hand with one
女には強く出る
Take the high hand with a woman!
こちらが強く出れば先方が折れるだろう
If we take the high hand with him, the other party will yield.
彼の挙動が僕の疑いを強くする
His behaviour confirms my suspicions―confirms me in my suspicions.

つよさ〔強さ〕
〈名〉Strength (of materials); power (of a state); might (of a sovereign); intensity (of light or heat); vigour (of the body, etc.)

content:
つよみ〔強味〕
〈名〉One's strength; one's strong point

content.content: 彼の強味は実力に有る
His strength lies in real ability.
実力が彼の強味だ
Real ability is his strong point.

つよめる〔強める〕
〈他動〉To strengthen (the medicine); to fortify (the mind); to intensify (the light or heat); to invigorate (the body); to confirm (one's belief); to corroborate (a statement); to emphasize, lay stress on (a word)

content:
つら〔面〕
〈名〉
1. (=顔)a face:(こっけいに言うと)a phiz; a mug

content.content: なんという面だ
What a face!
妙な面をしている
He has a queer phiz.
こんな失敗をしてどの面下げて帰られよう
How can I have the face to go home after such a failure?
あんなことをしておいてどの面下げて来たか
How can you have the face to come after such conduct on your part?→『つらのかわ〔面の皮〕』

content: 2. (=何面する)

content.content: 学者面をする
to affect the scholar―set up for a scholar―pose as a scholar―assume a learned air―pretend to learning
彼は伯(叔)父様面をして家の中をかきまわす
He comes the uncle over me, and carries matters with a high hand.
からかい面をする
to make faces at one

content: 3. (=表面)the surface

つらあて〔面当て〕
〈名〉
1. (=当てこすり)an innuendo; an insinuation; an oblique hint; an allusive remark

content.content: 面当てを言う
to innuendo―insinuate―drop an oblique hint―make an allusive remark
彼に面当てを言ってやった
I spoke at him―talked at him.

content: 2. (=暗に恨みを報いること)spite

content.content: 彼は面当てに自殺したのだ
He committed suicide out of spite―from pure spite.
女中が主婦への面当てに軒先で首を括った
She hanged herself under the eaves to spite her mistress.
彼はキリスト教への面当てに酒を飲んだり女を買ったりする
He pays homage to Bacchus and Venus to spite the Christians―as a protest against Christianity.

content:
つらい〔辛い〕
〈形〉Hard to bear; hard; bitter; trying; trying to the nerves

content.content: 貧乏は辛い
Poverty is hard to bear―It is hard to be poor.
僕は貧乏はそう辛いと思わぬ
I do not find poverty so hard to bear.
ボロを隠そうとしなけりゃ貧乏も辛くなくなる
Have the courage to appear poor, and you disarm poverty of its sting.
朝から晩まで働くのは辛いことじゃ
It is hard that I must work from morning till night.
汗水流してためた金をただ取られるのは辛いことじゃ
It is hard lines for me that I must give up the money I toiled so hard for.
別れが辛い
It is hard to part.
別れが辛かった
I found it hard to part―I felt a great tug at parting―Prating was a tug.
奉公は辛い
Service is trying.
主人の機嫌をとるのが何より辛い
It is most trying to the nerves to keep in your master's good graces.
それを言われるのが何より辛い
I shall never hear the end of the matter.
そう言われるのが何より辛い
That is the hardest part of all.
生きているのが辛い
Life hangs heavy upon me―Life is a millstone about my neck.
身を斬られるよりも辛い
It is more than flesh and blood can bear.
辛いこと
a hardship
僕は辛いことには慣れている
I am inured to hardships―I am used to roughing it.
辛い経験、辛い思い
a trying experience―a bitter experience―a bitter cup―a bitter pill to swallow
辛い思いをした、辛い目に逢った
I had a trying experience―had a bitter experience―bad a hard time of it―had to drink a bitter cup―had to swallow a bitter pill.
辛い生活をする
to live a hard life―lead a dog's life of it
悪い女房のお蔭で辛い生活をした
My wife has led me a dog's life of it.
君にそうされると僕は辛い立場になる
You place one in a delicate position.
旅は憂いもの辛いもの
Travelling is full of hardships and privations.
待つは憂いもの辛いもの
“Hope deferred makes the heart sick.”
辛く当たる
to be hard on one―down on one
彼女は継子に辛く当たる
She is hard on her stepchildren.

content:
つらがまえ〔面構え〕
〈名〉A cast of countenance; an expression of countenance; an expression; a look

content.content: 正直そうな面構え
He looks honest―He is honest-looking.
偉そうな面構えだ
He looks like a great man―He has a heroic expression of countenance.

content:
つらさ〔辛さ〕
〈名〉Hardness; bitterness; pain; strain on the nerves

content.content: 文明生活の辛さ
the strain of civilized life
貧乏の辛さ
how hard it is to be poor
君達のような貴公子は貧乏の辛さを知るものか
How can you, a rich man's son, know what it is to be poor?
ボロを隠そうとしなけれりゃ貧乏の辛さを感ぜぬ
Have the courage to appear poor, and you disarm poverty of its sting.
別れの辛さ
the pain of paring―how hard it is to part―the tug at parting
会うて嬉しや
What a joy it is to meet!
別れの辛さ
How hard it is to part!
会うて別れが
Would that we could ever meet,
無けりゃ好い
Never, never to part!

content:
つらだましい〔面魂〕
〈名〉A (remarkable) countenance; a (villainous) expression; a (daring) look

content.content: あの容易ならぬ面魂で見ると並みの人間じゃない
He can be no common being, for he has a remarkable countenance.
一癖有りそうな面魂だ
He has a sinister countenance―He is sinister-looking.
びくともしない面魂だ
He has an unmoved countenance―an imperturbable countenance.
大悪無双の面魂をしている
He has a diabolical look―a satanical expression.

content:
つらつら〔熟々〕
〈副〉Carefully

content.content: つらつら惟るに国家の為国民の教育より重きは無し
On careful consideration, I find that nothing can be more important to the State than the education of the people.

content:
つらなる〔連る〕
〈自動〉(=列を成す)to range; to lie in a row; to run in a line

content.content: 島は南北に連る
The islands range north and south―lie north and south.
千里山連る
The mountains range a thousand miles―extend over a thousand miles.

content: 〈他動〉(=列席する)to attend (a meeting); to assist at (a ceremony); to be present at (a meeting); to participate in, take part in (a ceremony, etc.)

content.content: 席に連る
to be present (at a meeting)
席に連った者は皆賛成した
Everybody present approved.
僕はその式に連った
I assisted at the ceremony―took part in the ceremony.
僕もその結婚式に連った
I was at the wedding.
僕も末席に連った
I had the honour of being present.
僕も末席に連っている
I have the honour of being a member.

content:
つらにくい〔面憎い〕
〈形〉Provoking; aggravating

content.content: 彼があんなうまい儲けをするのを見ると面憎い
It is aggravating to see him make such a good thing out of it.
彼は面憎いほど落ちつき払っている
He is provokingly serene.

content:
つらぬく〔貫く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=貫通する)to penetrate, pierce, perforate (an iron plate); to pass through (the wall); to run through (the beads)

content.content: 玉の緒が玉を貫く
A string runs through the beads.
鉄道が半島を貫いている
A railway runs through the peninsula.
鉄板を貫く
to penetrate―pierce―perforate―pass through―a steel plate
砲弾が甲鉄を貫いた
A shell penetrated the armour―pierced the armour.
この甲鉄はどんな砲弾でも貫けない
The armour is impenetrable to shot or shell.
銃弾が壁を貫いた

Owing to scarcity of small coin, shopkeepers find difficulty in making change.

content:
つりあい〔釣合い〕
〈名〉
1. (軽重の釣合い)balance; equilibrium; equipoise; poise:(各部の釣り合い)proportion; relation; harmony; congruity; symmetry; keeping:(二者の釣り合い)match; assortment

content.content: 釣り合いの好い
(文)a balanced sentence―(身体)―a well-proportioned body―(結合)―a harmonious combination―(集合)―a congruous collection―(構造)―a symmetrical structure―(対)―a well-assorted pair―(夫婦)―a well-matched couple
釣り合いの悪い

(文)an unbalanced sentence―(身体)―an ill-proportioned body―(結合)―an inharmonious combination―(集合)―an incongruous collection―(構造)―an unsymmetrical structure―(対)―an ill-assorted pair―(夫婦)―an ill-matched couple
釣り合いを取る
to bring things into equilibrium―keep things in equilibrium―poise
身体の釣り合いを取る
to balance oneself
鳥が空中で身の釣り合いを取る
A bird poises itself in the air.
荷が片寄らないように釣り合いを取る
to balance the load―poise the load
不平均の釣り合いを取る
to counterbalance the excess―counterpoise the inequality
収入と支出の釣り合いを取る
to balance the receipts and expenses
収入と支出の釣り合いが取れている、釣り合いが取れておらぬ
The expenses are in proportion to the receipts―out of all proportion to the receipts.
功と賞との釣り合いが取れておらぬ
The reward bears no proportion to the services―The services and the reward do not balance.
目的と費用と釣り合いが取れぬ
The object and expense bear no relation to each other―The object and the expense are out of all relation to each other.

content:
つりあう〔釣合う〕
〈自動〉
1. (軽重なら)to balance; to bear proportion to (each other); to be in proportion to (each other); to be proportionate to (each other); to be proportioned to (each other):(二者なら)to match with (each other); to assort with (each other):(各部なら)to harmonize with (each other); to be in harmony with (each other); to be in keeping with (each other); to be congruous with (each other); to be symmetrical

content.content: 支出が収入と釣り合わぬ
The receipts and the expenses do not balance―The expenses are not in proportion to―out of all proportion to―the receipts.
賞と功は釣り合わぬ
The reward bears no proportion to the services―The services and the reward do not balance.
道具が座敷に釣り合わぬ
The furniture is not in keeping with―out of keeping with―the room―The furniture does not match with the room.
座敷に釣り合った道具
furniture in keeping with the room―furniture to match with the room
油絵は日本間には釣り合わない
Oil-paintings do not harmonize with―fit in with―a Japanese room.
茶碗に釣り合った急須がなければならぬ
There must be a tea-pot to match with the tea-cups.
人体の各部が好く釣り合っている
Each part of the human body harmonizes with the rest―Each part of the human body is in admirable proportion to the rest―The human body is symmetrical.
釣り合った夫婦だ、釣り合わない夫婦だ
They are a well-matched couple―an ill-matched couple.
この縁談は釣り合わない(提灯に釣り鐘)
It is an unequal match―a lop-sided match.
釣り合わない結婚だ
It is an ill-assorted marriage―a m?salliance.
釣り合わぬは不縁の基
“Unequal marriage are seldom happy.”
両方を釣り合わせる
to balance the two sides―make the two sides balance
収入と支出を釣り合わせる
to balance the receipts and expenses―make the accounts balance―make both ends meet
不平均を釣り合わせる
to counterbalance the inequality―counterpoise the excess

content:
つれづれ〔徒然〕
〈名〉Tedium; ennui

content.content: つれづれを慰める
to relieve the tedium―beguile the tedium―beguile the time―while away the time―kill time
つれづれなるままに有りし事ども書き記しぬ
I have, to beguile the tedium, noted down what has been passing of late.

content:
つれて〔連れて〕
〈前置詞〉To; with

content.content: 三味線につれて歌う
to sing to the samisen accompaniment
音楽につれて踊る
to dance to music
ラッパにつれて進行する
to march to the bugle
時世の推移につれて風俗が変わる
Manners and customs change with the change of the times.
時がたつにつれて決心が弱くなった
My resolution grew weaker with the lapse of time―As time went by, my resolution grew weaker.
人智の進歩につれて迷信が絶える
Superstitions die out with the advancement of knowledge―As knowledge advances, superstitions die out.
文明の進歩につれて戦争が無くなる
War will cease with the advancement of civilization―As civilization advances, man will cease from strife.
世の不景気につれて社員を減じた会社がある
Some companies have reduced their staffs in view of the badness of the times.

content: 〈接続詞〉As; in proportion as; the more..., the more...

content.content: 彼は年をとるにつれて頑固になった
He grew more bigoted as he grew older―The older he grew, the more bigoted he became.
彼は金ができるにつれて慾が深くなる
He becomes more greedy in proportion as he grows richer―The richer he grows, the greedier he becomes.

content:
つれていく〔連れて行く〕
〈他動〉To take (somebody) with one

content.content: 連れて行って下さい
Take me with you!―Let me come with you!
今度行く時連れて行こう
I will take you with me―You shall come with me―the next time I go.
彼はよく箱根や日光へあやしい者を連れて行く
He often goes to Hakone or Nikko in questionable company.

content:
つれてくる〔連れて来る〕
〈他動〉To bring (somebody) with one; to come accompanied by (a friend); to come attended by (a servant)

content.content: 友人を連れて来てよろしいか
Have you no objection to my bringing a friend with me?
今度来る時連れて来給え
You may bring him with you the next time you come.
彼は友人を連れて来た
He brought a friend with him―He came accompanied by a friend.
友を連れて来た
He came attended by a servant.

content:
つれない
〈形〉Heartless; unfeeling; cold

content.content: つれない心だ
He has a cold heart―an unfeeling heart.
つれないことばかり言っている
He only talks heartlessly.
有明けのつれなく
The waning moon so cold did shine
見えし別れより
When we at morn did part,
暁ばかり
The hour of dawn is since become
憂きものはなし
A sadness to my heart.

つれびき〔連弾き〕
〈名〉Playing (the samisen or koto) in concert (with another):(=する) to play in concert (with another)

content:
つれゆく〔連れ行く〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: つれていく〔連れて行く〕

content:
つれる〔釣れる〕
〈自動〉To have a bite

content.content: 釣れた
I have a bite.
鯉が釣れた
I have caught a carp.
魚がいても釣れない
The fish do not bite.
釣れましたか
Have you had any game?
だいぶ釣れました
I have had much game.
いっこう釣れません
I have had no game.
ここは釣れますか
Do fish bite here? Is there good fishing here?
ここは釣れます
There is good fishing here.
ここは釣れません
Fish do not bite here―There is not fishing here.
鯉が釣れる
Carp bite―Carp take the hook.

content:
つれる〔連れる〕
〈他動〉To have (somebody) with one; to be accompanied by (a friend); to be attended by (a servant)

content.content: 彼は妻子を連れていた
He had his wife and family with him.
友人を連れて来た
He had a friend with him―He came accompanied by a friend.
供を連れていた
He was attended by a servant.
奥さんをお連れになりましたか
Have you brought your wife with you?
伯(叔)父が僕を連れに来た
My uncle came for me.
伯(叔)父に連れられて芝居へ行った
My uncle took me to the play.
彼は細君を連れて帰った
(こちらへなら)He has brought his wife home―(先方へなら)―taken his wife home.
私を連れて逃げて下さい
Fly with me!
彼はよくあやしい者を連れて箱根や日光へ行く
He often goes to Hakone or Nikko in questionable company.→『つれていく〔連れて行く〕』→『つれてくる〔連れて来る〕』

つわぶき
〈名〉A garden plant like the burdock

content:
つわもの〔兵〕
〈名〉A soldier; a warrior

content.content: 古兵
a veteran

content:
つんけんする〔ツンケンする〕
〈自動〉To be supercilious

content.content: あの女はどうかするとツンケンする
She is apt to toss her head contemptuously.

content:
つんけんする〔ツンケンする〕
〈自動〉To be supercilious

content.content: あの女はどうかするとツンケンする
She is apt to toss her head contemptuously.

content:
つんざく〔劈く〕
〈他動〉To rend; to pierce; to split

content.content: 爆声天をつんざく
The explosion rends the air.
電光一閃天をつんざいた
A flash of lightning rent the sky.
耳をつんざくような女の悲鳴が聞こえた
We heard a piercing shriek―an ear-splitting shriek.
女の悲鳴が闇をつんざいた
A woman's shriek pierced the darkness.
汽車は暗闇をつんざいて走る
The train cleaves the darkness.
北風は肌をつんざくように寒い
The north wind is biting cold.
肌をつんざくような風
a cutting wind

content:
ツンツルテン
〈形〉Very short (clothes)

content.content: 坊っちゃんは伸びるのが早くて着物が皆ツンツルテンになってしまった
Young master has outgrown all his clothes.

つんつんする〔ツンツンする〕
〈自動〉To prim; to look prim; to assume a prim air

つんつんする〔ツンツンする〕
〈自動〉To prim; to look prim; to assume a prim air

content:
つんと〔ツンと〕
〈副〉Primly:(=した) prim:(=する) to prim; to assume a prim air

content.content: ツンと気取る、ツンと澄ます
to put on a prim air―look prim
いつもツンと澄ましている
She always looks prim.
あの女はからかわれるとツンと澄ましてしまう
When she is made fun of, she prims up.

content:
つんと〔ツンと〕
〈副〉Primly:(=した) prim:(=する) to prim; to assume a prim air

content.content: ツンと気取る、ツンと澄ます
to put on a prim air―look prim
いつもツンと澄ましている
She always looks prim.
あの女はからかわれるとツンと澄ましてしまう
When she is made fun of, she prims up.

content:
つんぼ〔聾〕
〈形〉Deaf:(名詞に用いれば)deafness:(人)a deaf man:(集合的に言えば)the deaf

content.content: 聾になる
to become deaf―be deafened
聾にする
to deafen
騒がしくて聾になりそうだ
The noise is deafening.
聾になるような雷だった
It was deafening thunder.
聾の早耳
A deaf man will hear too much.
彼は金聾だ
He is stone-deaf―as deaf as a post.

content:
つんぼさじき〔聾桟敷〕
〈名〉The upper gallery (of a theatre)

content.content: 聾桟敷の観客
the gods
聾桟敷で芝居を見る
to be among the gods

content:
て〔手〕
〈名〉
1. The hand

content.content: 右の手、左の手
the right hand―the left hand
手の指
the fingers
手の平
the flat of the hand―the palm
手の甲
the back of the hand
手の裏
the palm of the hand
手の裏を返すよう
It is like turning a hand.
手の裏を返すような浮薄
weathercock-like faithlessness
手の筋
the lines of the palm
手の筋を見る
to tell fortunes by the lines of the palm―read one's hand
お手の筋
You have guessed right―hit it―hit the right nail on the head.
手を出す
to hold out one's hand―(なお16)熟語の部を見よ)
彼はくれと言って(もっとくれと言って)手を出した
He held out his hand for some―held out his hand for more.
手を上げる
to raise one's hand―hold up one's hand―show one's hand
賛成な人は手を上げて
Let those who are in favour of the proposition, hold up their hands!―show their hands!
(抵抗せぬというしるしに)両手を上げて
Hands up!
(仰天して)両手を振り上げた
He threw up his hands―flung up his hands―in astonishment.
手を伸ばす
to reach one's hand―stretch a hand―make a long arm
手を伸ばして花を取ろうとする
to reach at a flower
手を伸ばして人の時計を取ろうとする
to reach for a watch
手を伸ばして人に物を渡す
to reach one anything
(獲物は)手を伸ばせば取れる
The prize is within my grasp.
手を拍つ
to clap one's hands―(は拍手、人を呼ぶためなら)―clap hands
皆手を拍って賞めた
They clapped their hands in applause.
ご用の節はお手を鳴らして下さい
When you want me, please clap hands.
お手が鳴る
There is a clapping of hands―a handclap.
手を打って約束をきめる
to strike hands (on a bargain)―strike a bargain―close a bargain
手を振る
to wave one's hand
手をもむ
to rub one's hands
手をもみしぼる
to wring one's hands
手を洗う
to wash one's hands
(人の)手を握る
to grasp one's hand―(握手なら)―shake hands with one―shake one by the hand
人の手を取る
to take one by the hand
彼はやにわに僕の手を取って引張った
He seized me by the hand and pulled me.
人の手を引く
to lead one by the hand
彼は僕の肩に手を掛けた
He laid his hand on my shoulder.
手を貸す
to lend one a hand―lend one a helping hand―lend one assistance
手を控える
to stay one's hand―hold one's hand
手を合わせる
to fold one's hands
(この通り)手を合わして頼む(に相当するは)
On knees I implore.
手を突く
to put one's hands on the ground
手を突いて謝まれ(に相当するは)
Beg pardon on your knees!―Down on your knees!
手に本を携えて庭を散歩しておった
He was walking in the garden with a book in his hand―book in hand.
手に取る
to take anything in one's hand―(なお16)熟語の部を見よ)
手に取らぬうちは不安心
You can not be easy in your mind before the thing is secure in your hand.
手に手を取って歩く
They walk hand in hand.
人の手に渡す
to give anything into one's hand―hand over anything to one
その品が人の手に渡った
The article passed into other hands.
手から手に伝わった
It passed from hand to hand.
手を触るべからず
Hands off!―(は米、英は)―The visitor is requested not to touch the articles.
手を経る
to pass through one's hands―(なお16)熟語の部を見よ)
彼の手を経る金は少々の金ではない
Large sums of money pass through his hands.
手を縛る
to tie one's hands
手を縛られる
to have one's hands tied
手を縛らぬ
to give one a free hand―leave one a free hand
手が荒れる
A hand roughens―A hand chaps.
手にひびを切らす
to get one's hands chapped
手に霜焼けができる
to get one's hands frost-bitten
手が震える
My hands shake―My hands are unsteady.
手が震えて書けぬ
I can not write, my hands shake so.
何かするのに手が震えない(仕損じが無い)
to do anything with a steady hand―with a firm hand
手が利く
to be clever with one's hand
手が不器用だ
She has two left hands―Her fingers are all thumbs.
手をかざす
to shade one's eyes with one's hand
火に手をかざす
to warm one's hands over the fire
男の手で育てる
to bring up a child by a man's hand
女の手一つで育てる
to bring up a child by the single hand of a woman
手に唾する
to spit on one's hand―brace oneself for a task
宝の山に入りて手を空しうして帰る
to enter a trasure-mountain and return with empty hands―return empty-handed from a treasure-mountain
飼主の手を咬む犬だ
He is a mean hound who bites the hand that feeds him―(なお16)熟語の部を見よ)
この品は手でこしらえるのだ
These articles are made by hand.
手でこしらえた品物
hand-made goods

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 手を焼く(原意、転意共)
to burn one's fingers
あの男の世話をして手を焼いている
I have burned my fingers in trying to help that man.
手を切る
to cut one's fingers―(なお16)熟語の部を見よ)
深く手を切る
to cut one's finger to the bone
手を吹いて温める
to blow one's fingers
手で触って見る
to feel anything with one's fingers
手を拱く、手を束ねる
to fold one's arms
手を拱いて傍観する、手を束ねて傍観する
to look on with folded arms―remain a mere spectator―remain an idle spectator―remain an unconcerned spectator
手を広げる
to open one's arms―(なお16)熟語の部を見よ)
彼は手を取らぬばかりに僕を迎えた
He welcomed me with open arms.
手を振って歩く
He swings his arms as he goes.
自分の手を握る(拳骨をこしらえる)
to clench one's fist―double one's fist―shut one's fist
手が届く
to be within one's grasp―(なお16)熟語の部を見よ)
手の届く花は無い
There are no flowers within my reach.
花は有っても手が届かぬ
The flowers are out of my reach.

content: 2. (=人手) a hand; a man

content.content: 手が足らぬ(手不足)
We are short of hands―short-handed.
手が揃っている(手揃いだ)
We have a full number of hands―We are full-handed.
手を配る(手配りする)
to dispose one's men
手を分ける(手分けする)
to form parties
手を分けて(迷子を)捜した
We formed search-parties―sent out search-parties.

content: 3. (=手跡) a hand; handwriting; penmanship

content.content: 手が好い、手が悪い
to write a good hand―write a poor hand
鮮やかな手だ
He writes a beautiful hand.
この手紙は手が違う
This letter is in a different handwriting.
手を違えて書いてある
It is written in a disguised hand.
手が上がる
to improve in one's penmanship
口も八丁手も八丁
He speaks and writes with equal facility.

content: 4. (=把手) a handle

content.content: 急須の手
the handle of a tea-pot

content: 5. (=手段) means

content.content: 手を尽す
to try all means
百方手を尽した
I have tried all possible means―tried every means in my power―left no means untried―left no stones unturned.
手を換える
to resort to other means
手を換え品を換えて説いた
I tried to persuade him by every possible means―by every conceivable means.

content: 6. (=手管) an art

content.content: 手の有る女だ
She is an artful woman―a designing woman.

content: 7. (=相撲の手) a trick; a chip

content.content: あの相撲は手が無いから力ずくで勝つのだ
That wrestler knows no tricks, and only wins by sheer strength.
四十八手裏表
all the chips and counter-chips―all the mysteries of wrestling

content: 8. (=将棋の手) a move

content.content: 一手差す
to make a move
もう二三手で勝つところだった
I should have won in two or three moves.

content: 9. (=勝負事の手) a hand; card

content.content: 手が好い、手が悪い
to have a good hand―a bad hand
(計略で)相手の手を見る
to force one's hand
手を見られる
to show one's cards
手が尽きた
I have played my last card.
奥の手
a trump-card―one's best cards―one's last resort―one's last resource
奥の手が有る
to hold trumps in one's hands―have a card up one's sleeve
奥の手を出す
to play one's trumps―play one's best cards
逃げるが一の手
“Discretion is the better part of valour.”

content: 10. (=だます手) a trick; a game; a trap; a snare

content.content: 田舎者は往々あの手でだまされる
Country-people are often imposed upon by that trick.
その手で俺をだます気か
Is that your little game?―So that's your little game.
またもその手でだます気か
Are you at that game again?―at the same old game?
その手は食わぬ(その手は桑名の焼き蛤)
That game won't do with me!―That cock won't fight!
どんなばかでも同じ手を二度は食わぬ
“It is a silly fish that is caught twice with the same bait.”
手に乗る
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap

content: 11. (=手練) skill; performance

content.content: 手を尽す
to exhaust one's skill
お手の内
one's skill―one's performance
あっぱれなお手の内
Your performance does you credit―You have acquitted yourself to your credit.
お手の内拝見
Shall we have a game?
お手の物
one's forte
先生はシェークスピアがおてのものだ
Shakespeare is his forte―Shakespeare is in his line―He has Shakespeare at his fingers' ends.
手が上がる
to improve in one's skill
手が下がる
to fall off in one's skill―get out of practice
手が下がらないように始終稽古する
I practise constantly to keep my hands in.
彼は手に入っている
He is a good hand at the game.

content: 12. (=労) labour; care

content.content: 手のかかる仕事
laborious work
この仕事は手がかかる
The work costs much labour.
手の込んだ細工
elaborate workmanship
手を抜く
to do careless work―slight one's work―scamp one's work―fudge one's work
手を抜いた仕事
careless work

content: 13. (=種類) a kind; a line

content.content: この手の品がまだありますか
Have you more of this line of goods?

content: 14. (=方向) a direction; a hand

content.content: 右手に
on the right-hand side―to the right
左手に
on the left-hand side―to the left
上手に、下手
up―down
火の手
a tongue of fire
火の手が上がる
A tongue of fire shoots up.
火の手が盛んだ
The fire is raging.
けんかの火の手が盛んだ
Words are running high.
手が好い
(手跡なら) to write a good hand―(歌留多なら)―have a good hand
手が悪い
(手跡なら) to write a poor hand―(歌留多なら)―have a bad hand
手が早い
to be quick in action
手が長い
to be light-fingered―His fingers are lime-twigs
手が届く、手が届かぬ
to be within one's reach―out of one's reach
花は有っても手が届かぬ
The flowers are out of my reach.
もう五十に手が届く
He is close upon fifty.
手がふさがっている
My hands are full―I have my hands full―My time is taken up―I am engaged―I am busy.
授業やら著述やらで手がいっぱいだ
My time is wholly taken up with teaching and writing―What with teaching, what with writing, my time is wholly taken up.
手が明いていますか
Are you disengaged?―free?―at leisure?
じきに手が明きます
I shall be free―at leisure―at your service―in a minute.
今ちょっと手が明けられません
I am engaged just now.
ちょっと手が明けられませんか
Can't you spare me five minutes?
この菓子を見ると手が出る
People will help themselves to this cake.
喉から手が出そうだ
He is licking his chaps.
よく手がまわる
They attend to everything―leave nothing undone.
あの旅館ではよく手がまわる
They are attentive to the guests at that hotel.
忙しくて手がまわらぬ
Things are left undone owing to pressure of business―We are hampered by press of business.
そこまでは手がまわらぬ
We cannot attend to such details.
もう手がまわっている
We are watched.
後へ手がまわる
to be arrested―be apprehended
資本に手が付いた
We have touched the capital―broken in upon the capital.
資本に手が付かぬ
The capital is (left) intact.
お手が付いた
He has had connection with her―She is his mistress.
あの男は手が付けられぬ
I do not know what to do with him―I can do nothing with him.
ばかで手が付けられぬ
He is a desperate fool―an egregious ass.
生意気で手が付けられぬ
He is too conceited for anything―conceited enough for everybody.
この仕事は手がかかる
The work costs much labour―It is laborious work.
細工は手が込んでいる
The workmanship is elaborate.
どうにもこうにも手が出ない
I can manage it nohow―I am helpless.
相手が天下の富豪だから手が出ない
We are helpless against a millionaire.
当局者も手が出ない
The authorities are powerless to interfere.
この値段じゃ手が出ない
We are powerless to bid at such a price―the price is paralyzing.
ばくち宿へ手が入った
A raid was made on a gambling-den―A gambling-den was raided by the police.
手が上がる
to improve in one's skill
手が下がる
to fall off in one's skill―get out of practice
手が下がらないように始終稽古する
I practise constantly to keep my hands in.
手が曲る
to incur divine judgment
お手が鳴る
There is a handclap.
つい手が触り足が触り
Chance joined us together.

content: 《b》(手も)

content.content: 手も無く
without any trouble
手も無くできた
It was done without any trouble at all―with the greatest ease.
蛙味か、手も無く魚さ
Frogs taste just like fish.
僕にゃ手も足も出ない
I can manage it nohow―I am helpless.
相手が天下の富豪だから手も足も出ない
We are helpless against a millionaire.
この値段じゃ手も足もでない
We are powerless to bid at such a price―The price is paralyzing.

content: 《c》(手に)

content.content: 電報を手にした
I received a telegram.
本を手にして庭を散歩していた
He was walking in the garden with a book in his hand―book in hand.
この論文は彼の手に成っている
The essay was written by him.
手に入れる
to get―obtain―secure―win―come by―possess oneself of―come into possession of―anything
安く手に入れた
I got it cheap.
好い先生を手に入れた
I have secured (the services of) a good teacher.
どうかしてあの地位を手に入れたい
I am desirous to secure that position.
この金はどうして手に入れたか
How did you come by this money?
女を手に入れる
to win a girl
宿屋の主人が旅人の所持金を手に入れようとした
The landlord attempted to possess himself of the the money in the traveller's possession.
手に入る
to come into possession
珍書が手に入った
A rare volume has come into my possession.
こんな品がどうしてお手に入りましたか
How did the article come into your possession?
この本は値段が安いから学生の手に入る
The cheapness of the price places the book within the reach of the student.
値段が高いから学生の手に入らぬ
The dearness of the price places it beyond the reach of the student.
彼はこの遊戯は手に入ったものだ
He is a good hand at the game.
手に落ちる
to fall into one's hands
二百三高地我が手に落ちて旅順の運命は旦夕に迫った
When the 203-Metre Heights fell into our hands, the days of Port Arthur were numbered.
一等賞は誰の手に落ちたか
Into whose hands did the first prize fall?―Who carried off the first prize?
手に掛かる
to die by one's hand
彼は敵の手にかかって死んだ
He fell by the hand of his enemy.
あの男の手にかかったら大変だ
It would be death to fall into his hands―to place yourself in his power.
高利貸の手にかかった
I fell into the clutches of a usurer.
悪者どもの手にかかって所持品をまき上げられた
I fell among thieves, and was done out of my possessions.
どんな可愛い子でもいつか他人の手にかかる
Your dearest child must, in time, be handed over to the tender mercies of a stranger.
手に掛ける
to kill by one's hand
人を手に掛けて殺す
to kill a man by one's own hand
手にかけて育てる
to bring up a child by the hand
手にかけて教える
to teach a child oneself
手に取る
to take anything in one's hand―examine an article―look over an article
品物を一々手に取って見たわけではない
I did not look over the articles one by one.
手に取るような事実
a palpable fact―a tangible fact
手に取るように見える
It is distinctly visible.
手に取るように聞こえる
It is distinctly audible.
手に取るように想像する
to have a vivid imagination
手に余る、手に合わぬ、手におえぬ
to be too much for one―beyond one's control
子どもらが手におえない
The boys are beyond my control―getting beyond control―getting out of hand.
子どもらは老人の手におえなくなった
The old man finds his boys getting out of hand.
手におえない奴だ
He is too much for me―one too many for me―an ugly customer―an awkward customer.
相手が手におえない
I have caught a Tartar.
仕事が手に余る
The task is beyond my capacity.
手に汗を握って勝負を眺めておった
We watched the contest with breathless interest―with bated breath.
手に乗る
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap
その手にゃ乗らぬ
The game won't do with me!―That cock won't fight!
仕事が手につかない
I can not go about my work.
恋すると仕事が手につかぬ
Love will not let you go about your work.
沖で艪橈が手につかぬ
I can not work the ship at sea.
手に手に得物を携えていた
They were each armed with some weapon that came ready to hand.

content: 《d》(手の)

content.content: 手の届く花は無い
There are no flowers within my reach.
彼の説明はかゆいところに手の届くようだ
His explanations are to the point.
あの女はかゆいところへ手の届くようだ
She anticipates your wants.
あの旅館の客扱いはかゆいところへ手の届くようだ
The hotel leaves nothing to be desired in the way of attentions.
かゆいところへ手の届かぬ思い
I can not get at the exact meaning of the passage―I can not come at the exact truth of the matter.
手の掛かる仕事
a laborious task
手の込んだ細工
elaborate workmanship
手のつけようが無い
I do not know where to begin.
手のつけようの無い奴だ
I do not know what to do with him―I can do nothing with him.
消防隊も手のつけようが無かった
The fire-brigade could do nothing with the conflagration.
火事は手のつけようがなかった
The fire was beyond control.
手のつけようの無いばか者だ
He is a desperate fool―an egregious ass.
手のつけようの無い生意気者だ
He is too conceited for anything―conceited enough for everybody.
手の下しようが無い
I can do nothing.
手の切れそうな札
a crisp bank-note
手の舞い足の踏む所を知らず
One is transported with joy―in a transport of joy―in an agony of joy―in raptures―in ecstasies.
お手の筋
You have guessed right―hit it―hit the right nail on the head.
お手の物
one's forte
先生はシェークスピアがお手の物だ
Shakespeare is his forte―Shakespeare is in his line―He has Shakespeare at his fingers' ends.
成功はお手の物だ
Success is yours―You have the ball at your feet.
お手の内
one's skill―one's performance
あっぱれなお手の内
Your performance does you credit―You have acquitted yourself to your credit.
お手の内拝見
Will you have a game?
お手の内拝見と出た
I challenged him to a game.

content: 《e》(手を)

content.content: 手を出す
to attempt―meddle with―concern oneself with―anything
彼は何でも彼でも手を出す
He meddles with everything―pokes his nose into everything―has a finger in every pie.
いろいろなことに手を出し過ぎる
He has too many irons in the fire.
僕は哲学のようなむずかしいものには手を出さぬ
I do not meddle with such deep things as philosophy.
政治には手を出さぬ
I do not meddle with―concern myself with―politics―I stand clear of politics.
僕は自信の無いことには手を出さぬ
I never attempt a task I do not feel myself equal to.
皆仕事に恐れをなして手を出さぬ
Everybody shrinks from the task.
女に手を出す
to make advances to a woman
どちらから始め手を出したか
Which was the first to make advances?
(けんかで)どちらから始め手を出したか
Which side struck the first blow?―Which side is the aggressor?
相場に手を出す
to dabble in speculation
例の用心家だから容易に手を出さない
He holds back―hangs back―with his usual prudence.
互いに容易に手を出さない
Each waits for the other to attack.
手を出すごとに失敗した
He failed at every turn―He was driven from pillar to post.
手を付ける
to touch―put one's hand to―anything
食物に手を付ける
to touch food
彼は料理に手も付けぬ
He leaves the dishes untouched.
資本に手を付ける
to touch the capital―break in upon the capital
資本に手を付けるな
Leave the capital untouched―Leave the capital intact.
自信の無い仕事には手を付けぬ
I never put my hand to any task I do not feel myself equal to.
手を付けたら後へは退かれぬ
“One who puts his hand to the plough, must not look back.”
物事を半途にするくらいならいっそ手を付けぬ方がましだ
If you do things by halves, you had better leave them alone.
(この娘は俺の預かり物だから)お前達に手を付けさせぬ
You shall not touch her―touch a hair of her.
彼は主人の金に手を付けた
He made free with his master's money.
女に手を付ける
to have connection with an inferior woman
あれは彼が手を付けた女だ
He has had connection with her―She is his mistress.
彼はだらしなく女に手を付ける
He makes free with any woman.
手を放す
(自分の手なら) to let go one's hold―release one's hold―loose one's hold―(人の手なら)―let go of one's hand―leave hold of one's hand―disengage one's hand―free one's hand
手を放せ
Let go your hold!―Let go of my hand!
手を引く
to draw back―beg off―cry off―declare off―back out of a scheme―wash one's hands of an affair
そんな事件はいっさい手を引く
I wash my bands of the whole affair―I cry off.
皆ご免を蒙ると言って手を引いた
Everybody excused himself from the task―begged off the task.
約束を履行するのがいやになって手を引いた者がある
Some declared off the engagement.
計画は見込みが無いから手を引いた
I have backed out of the scheme.
手を切る
to cut one's connections with―sever one's connections with―a man or a woman
悪縁と手を切る
to fling off an evil connection
手を離れる
to be off one's hands―out of one's hands
仕事が手を離れた(片づいた)
The work is off my hands.
品物は僕の手を離れた
The article is out of my hands―in other hands.
彼は父の手を離れても好い年だ
He is old enough to be independent of his father.
手を打つ、手を叩く
(拍手なら) to clap one's hands―(人を呼ぶためなら)―clap hands―(約束をきめるためなら)―strike hands (on a bargain)―strike a bargain―close a bargain
皆手を打って笑った
They clapped their hands for joy.
手を鳴らしたら来ておくれ
You must come when I clap hands.
手を入れる
to correct a writing―touch up a composition―retouch a picture―repair a house
警察でばくち宿へ手を入れる
The police raid into―make a raid on―a gambling-den.
手を下す
to lay violent hands on a man―kill a man―murder a man
自ら手を下したわけじゃない
I did not do it myself.
手をまわす
to sent out emissaries―use spies―resort to espionage
手をまわして探ってみるとそうでないようだ
We have spied out that such is not the case.
手を広げる
to extend one's business
あまり手を広げたのでまとまりがつかなくなった
His business is so extensive that he can not control it.
手を尽す
to try all means―(は手段、手練なら)―exhaust one's skill
百方手を尽した
I have tried every means in my power―left no means untried―left no stones unturned.
手を抜く
to do careless work―slight one's work―scamp one's work―fudge one's work
手を抜いた仕事
careless work
手を抜くようなことは決して致しません
I never do careless work―I never slight my work―I always do my work with scrupulous care.
手を配る
to dispose one's men
手を分ける
to form parties
手を分けて捜す
to form search-parties―send out search-parties
手を負う
to be wounded―sustain a wound
手を濡らす
to get wet
手を濡らさずに魚は取れぬ
There is no catching fish without getting wet.
手を濡らさずに手に入った
I got it without any trouble.
手を換え品を換えて説いた
I tried to persuade him by every possible means―by every conceivable means.
手を換え品を換えて同じことを繰り返す
to ring the changes on anything
飼犬に手を噛まれる
“One who plays with edge-tools will cut himself.”
飼犬に手を噛まれたのだ
He has played with edge-tools and cut himself.
飼犬に手を咬まれしゃんすな
It is ill playing with edge-tools.
(朝顔などに)手をやる
to train a creeping plant
手を合わして(頼む)
On my knees I implore.
手を突いて謝れ
Beg pardon on your knees!―Down on your knees!

content:
で
〈前置詞相当〉［注意］ほとんどあらゆる前置詞に相当す。例えば

content.content: 五十で死んだ
He died at fifty.
目方で売る
to sell by the pound
金で節を売る
to sell honour for money
ぶどう酒はぶどうで造る
Wine is made from grapes.
皆で十
ten in all
肺病で死ぬ
to die of consumption
子どもを牛乳で育てる
to bring up a child on milk
三味線で歌う
to sing to the samisen
金で買う
to buy with money［注意］またこれに相当する英語無き場合あり。例えば
これは何であるか
What is this?
それでよし
That will do.
十円でたくさん
Ten yen is enough.
一等で行く
I go first class.

content:
で〔出〕
〈名〉
1. (=出身)origin

content.content: あの人は名門の出だ
He comes of a good family.
今一人の方は出が悪い
The other man comes of a bad stock.
あの人は大学出だ
He is a university man.

content: 2. (=産出)yield; a crop

content.content: 今年は松茸の出が多い
There is a large crop of mushrooms this year.
でがある
to yield much―go far
もとは十円あるとずいぶん使い出があったものだ
Ten yen used to go far―go a long way.
金は使いでが無くなった
Money now goes only a little way.
この缶詰は出が無い
These cans do not open well.
鵞鳥は切りでがある
A goose cuts up well.
洋食は食いでがある
Foreign food fills.

content: 3. (=出現)appearance

content.content: 今年は松茸の出が早い
The mushrooms have appeared early this year.
たいそう人の出があった
There was a great crowd―a great turn-out.

content:
てあい〔手合〕
〈名〉A set; a lot

content.content: あの手合いと付き合わない
I don't go with that set.
ひどい手合いだ
They are a rascally set.

であい〔出合い〕
〈名〉
1. (=会合)a meeting; a gathering:(=する) to meet; to gather
2. (=男女の密会)a clandestine meeting:(=する) to meet in secret

content:
であいがしらに〔出合い頭に〕
〈副〉Meeting suddenly (as in the dark or on turning a corner)

content.content: 出合いがしらに鉢合わせ
We bumped our heads together on meeting suddenly.

であう〔出会う〕
〈他動〉To meet with (a misfortune); to fall in with (the enemy); to come across (a genuine article); to light upon (a curious fact); to run against (an acquaintance); to encounter (a storm, etc.)

content:
てあか〔手垢〕
〈名〉The dirt on the hand; hand-soil

content.content: 手垢が付く
to be soiled with the hand
手垢を付ける
to soil anything with the hand
手垢の付いた本
a well-thumbed volume―a thumb-marked book

てあき〔手明き〕
〈形〉(To be) disengaged, free, at leisure

であきない〔出商い〕
〈名〉(事)hawking; peddling:(人) a hawker; a peddler:(=する) to hawk; to peddle

content:
てあし〔手足〕
〈名〉
1. Hands and feet; hand and foot; the limbs; the extremities

content.content: 彼は手足が利かない
He has lost the use of his limbs.
人の手足を縛る
to bind one hand and foot
手足を八つ裂きにする
to tear a body limb from limb
僕には手足が出ない
I can't manage it anyhow―I am helpless.
相手が天下の富豪だから手足が出ない
We are helpless against a millionaire.
そんな値段では手足が出ない
We are powerless to bid at such a price―The price is paralyzing.

content: 2. (=手足のように働く人) one's creature

content.content: 彼らは彼の手足だ
They are his creatures.
彼らは彼の手足のように働く
They are at his beck and call.
彼は部下を手足のように操縦する
He has his men at his beck and call.
軍隊は大将の手足のように進退する
The troops move as if they were a part of himself.

content:
てあしまとい〔手足纏い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あしてまとい〔足手纏い〕

content:
てあたりしだいに〔手当り次第に〕
〈副〉At random

content.content: 手当たり次第に本を開く
to open a book at random
手当たり次第に棚の本を取れ
Take any book at random from the shelf.
何でも手当たり次第に
Whatever one can lay one's hands on―Whatever comes in one's way―Whatever comes handy.
手当たり次第に本を読んだ
I read whatever I could lay my hands on.
彼は何でも手当たり次第に盗む
He steals whatever comes in his way.
彼は手当たり次第に人を使う
He orders about whoever comes handy.

content:
てあつい〔手厚い〕
〈形〉Warm (hospitality); hearty (welcome); cordial (reception); hospitable (treatment); handsome (reward)

content.content: 手厚いもてなしを受けた
I received a warm hospitality―I met with a hearty welcome―I was accorded a cordial reception.
手厚い恩賞があった
There was a handsome reward―They were handsomely rewarded.

content:
てあつく〔手厚く〕
〈副〉Warmly; heartily; cordially; hospitably; handsomely

content.content: 人を手厚くもてなす
to treat one with warm hospitality―treat one with every mark of cordiality―give one a hearty welcome―accord one a cordial reception
手厚く世話をしてくれた
They took every possible care of me.
手厚く礼をした
I rewarded him handsomely―gave him a handsome reward.

content:
てあて〔手当て〕
〈名〉
1. (=給与) an allowance

content.content: 月百円の手当てをしておく
I allow him 100 yen a month.
手当てが好い
They have a good allowance.
充分に手当てがしてある
They have a full allowance.
特別手当て、臨時手当て
a special allowance―extra pay
時間外に働けば特別手当てが出る
You get extra pay for overtime work.
戦地手当て
a field allowance
戦時手当て
a war allowance

content: 2. (=扶養) provision

content.content: 遺族の手当てをする
to provide for a bereaved family
戦死者の遺族には政府の手当てがある
If a man falls in battle, the government provides for his family.
遺族には充分に手当てがしてあるから食うには困らない
The bereaved families are well provided for.

content: 3. (=病人などの世話) care; attention; treatment

content.content: 病人の手当てをする
to care for the sick―attend to the patient―treat the patient
医者が病人の手当てをする
The doctor attends to the patient.
病人には相当の手当てをするように
See (that) the invalid (is) properly cared for!
負傷者の手当てをせよ(させよ)
Attend to the wounded!―She the wounded attended to!
行ってみると医者がけが人の手当てをしておった
I found the surgeon attending to the injured.
一刻も早く病人の手当てをせよ
You must lose no time in attending to the patient.
この病気は早速手当てをしないと手後れになる
The disease requires prompt attention―The case calls for prompt treatment.
傷の手当てをする
to dress a wound―bind up a wound
応急手当て
emergency treatment―first-aid treatment―first aid
応急手当てをする
to give one first aid
戦友が応急手当てをした
A comrade gave him first-aid treatment.
応急手当てはどうすればよいか
What is to be done as first aid?

content: 4. (=警察の捜索) search

content.content: 犯人は目下手当て中
The police are searching for the culprit.

てあぶり〔手焙り〕
〈名〉A hand-warmer

content:
てあみ〔手編み〕
〈形〉Knit by hand

content.content: 手編みの靴下
hand-knit socks

content:
てあらい〔手荒い〕
〈形〉Rough; violent

content.content: 手荒いことをする
to use violence―resort to violence
この子は何をしたとてそんな手荒いことをするのか
What has the boy done that you should resort to such violence?
人を手荒く扱う
to treat one roughly―handle one without gloves
手荒い扱い
rough handling―rough usage
手荒く扱ったために品物が損じている
The goods are damaged by rough handling.
道具などをドタンバタンと手荒く扱う
to bang about the furniture
人を手荒く引張りまわす
to pull and haul a man
競争の相手などに手荒く当たる
to punish a competitor

content:
てあらい〔手洗い〕
〈名〉Washing one's hands

content.content: 手洗鉢
a wash-basin
手洗水
water for washing hands―water to wash one's hands with

てあらいばち〔手洗鉢〕
〈名〉A wash-basin

content:
であるく〔出歩く〕
〈自動〉To gad about

content.content: 内を外にして出歩いている
He is always on the gad―He is a stranger at home.

content:
てあわせ〔手合せ〕
〈名〉
1. (=勝負) a game; a match; a bout; a contest

content.content: 一つ手合わせをしようか
Shall we have a game?

content: 2. (=売買、取引) a sale; a bargain; a deal; dealings; transaction; business:(=する) to do business; to transact business; to deal

content.content: 手合わせができた
We have struck a bargain―closed a bargain.

content:
てい〔体〕
〈名〉Air; appearance

content.content: 職人体の男だった
He was a man of workmanlike appearance.
彼はさあらぬ体で傍観しておった
He was looking on with an unconcerned air.
ほうほうの体で逃げ出した
He retreated with precipitation―beat a precipitate retreat.
彼は散歩に行く体にして出かけた
He went out apparently for a walk.
転地の体にして旅行に出かけた
He started on a journey ostensibly for change of air.
主人は病死の体にして届けた
The master's death was reported as natural.
体の好い放逐だ
It is a virtual dismissal.
体の好い泥棒だ
It is disguised robbery.
体の好い詐欺だ
It is a masked fraud.
体の好い強姦さ
It is committing a rape by help of money.
体の好いことを言っている
He says plausible things―talks plausibly.
体好く断る
to decline with thanks
原稿は体好く断って返した
The manuscript was returned with thanks.
体好く追い出せりゃよいが
He can not be decently turned out.

content:
てい〔底〕
〈名〉
1. (=そこ) the bottom
2. ［数学］ The base
3. (=類) a kind

content.content: 神人も許さぬていの行いである
It is such conduct as is not allowed by God or man.

content:
てい〔弟〕
〈名〉A younger brother

content.content: 兄たり難く弟たり難し
There is nothing to choose between the two―They are six of one and half-a-dozen of the other.

content:
てい〔艇〕
〈名〉A boat

content.content: 艇庫
a boat-house

content:
てい〔邸〕
〈名〉A mansion; a residence

content.content: 大隈侯爵邸
the mansion of Marquis Okuma
公爵邸
a ducal palace
大臣邸
a ministerial residence
邸内
in the grounds

content:
ていあつ〔低圧〕
〈名〉(蒸気なら) low pressure:(電気なら) low tension

content.content: 低圧蒸気機関
a low-pressure steam-engine
低圧電流
a low tension current

content:
ていあん〔提案〕
〈名〉A proposition; a proposal; an overture:(=する) to propose; to make a proposition; to make overtures

content.content: 先方から提案がある
We have a proposition from the other party―The other party has approached us with a proposition.
講和の提案をする
to make overtures of peace―hold out the olive-branch

content:
ていい〔帝位〕
〈名〉The Imperial Throne

content.content: 帝位に即く
to accede to the Throne―come to the Throne
帝位を継ぐ
to succeed to the Throne
帝位に登る
to ascend the Throne―mount the Throne
大正天皇を継ぎて帝位に即き給う
He succeeded Taisho―Tenno―on the Throne of Japan.
帝位に坐す
to sit on the Throne
帝位に在り
He is on the Throne.
帝位を辞す
to abdicate the Throne
帝位を譲る
to abdicate the Throne in favour of one's successor
帝位を争う
to pretend to the Throne―fight for the Throne
帝位を奪う
to usurp the Throne
帝位を覬{のぞ}む
to aspire to the Throne―have designs on the Throne
万世一系の帝位
a Throne occupied by one dynasty from time immemorial

content:
ていいん〔定員〕
〈名〉The full number (of persons):(職員などのは) the full strength (of a staff):(電車などのは) a fixed number (of passengers):(軍艦などのは) complement:(軍隊のは) establishment; footing:(議会などを有効ならしむるに必要な定員は) a quorum

content.content: 戦時定員、平時定員
war establishment―peace establishment
連隊は戦時定員になっている、平時定員になっている
The regiment is on a war footing―on a peace footing.
この軍艦の定員は何名ですか
What is the complement of the ship?
この電車の定員は何人か
What is the fixed number of passengers for this car?―the seating capacity of this car?
この電車は定員以上の乗客を載せている
The car is overloaded.
出席者は定員に満たぬ
The members present do not make a quorum.
出席者定員に満たぬため議会は流会になった
The meeting was abandoned for want of a quorum.

content:
ていえん〔庭園〕
〈名〉A garden

content.content: 庭園地
a garden-plot
庭園術
gardening―horticulture
庭園師
a gardener
屋上庭園
a roof-garden

content:
ていおう〔帝王〕
〈名〉A sovereign; a monarch:(総称すれば) crowned heads

content.content: 世の帝王
the crowned heads of the world
明治天皇は世の帝王に珍しき名君にましました
Meiji Tenno was one of the wisest rulers among the crowned heads of the world.

content:
ていおん〔低音〕
〈名〉Bass

content.content: 低音四絃琴
a bass-viol
低音ラッパ
a bassoon

content:
ていか〔低下〕
〈名〉Fall:(=する) to fall; to drop; to sink; to go down; to fall off

content.content: 晴雨計のにわかに低下するを見る
I observed the mercury suddenly fall―drop.
学生の英語が著しく低下した
The English of the students shows a marked fall―The students have markedly fallen off in their English.

content:
ていか〔低価〕
〈名〉A low price

content.content: 低価で売る
to sell at a low price

content:
ていか〔定価〕
〈名〉A fixed price

content.content: 定価で売る
to sell at a fixed price
定価の二割引きで卸す
to sell wholesale at 20 percent, discount (on the fixed price)
定価表
a price-list―a priced catalogue

ていか〔提架〕
〈名〉A handbarrow; a wheelbarrow

content:
ていかい〔低徊〕
〈名〉Wandering about:(=する) to wander about

content.content: 低徊去るに忍びず
I lingered.

content:
ていかい〔停会〕
〈名〉Suspension of meeting:(=する) to suspend a meeting

content.content: 議会が停会になった
The Diet is suspended.
議会の停会
suspension of the Diet

content:
ていがく〔停学〕
〈名〉Suspension from school:(英国の大学にては) rustication

content.content: 停学を命ずる
to suspend a student from school
停学を命ぜられる
to be suspended from school

content:
ていがく〔定額〕
〈名〉A fixed amount; the required amount

content.content: 定額の学費を貰っている
I have a fixed amount for school-expenses.
定額に達する
to come up to the required amount
定額に達せぬ
to come short of the required amount
定額を超過する
to exceed the required amount

ていかん〔定款〕
〈名〉Articles of an association

ていかん〔帝冠〕
〈名〉The Imperial crown

ていかんし〔定冠詞〕
〈名〉The definite article

content:
ていき〔定期〕
〈名〉A fixed period; a stated period; a regular interval:(=の) regular; periodical:(=に) regularly; periodically; at fixed periods; at stated periods; at regular intervals

content.content: 集会は定期にある
The meetings are held at fixed periods―at stated periods―at regular intervals.
定期集会
a regular meeting
定期休業日
a regular holiday
定期航路
a regular service―a regular line―(of steamers)
横浜桑港間には定期航路の船がある
There is a regular line of steamers between Yokohama and San Francisco.
定期船
a (regular) liner
鹿島丸は欧州通いの定期船だ
The Kashima Maru is a European liner.
非定期船
a tramp―an ocean-tramp
定期試験
a regular examination―a periodical examination
定期刊行
periodical publication
定期刊行物
a periodical
定期風
a periodical wind―a monsoon
定期取引
a periodical transaction―a time-transaction―a time-bargain
定期預金
a fixed deposit
定期乗車券
a season-ticket
定期米
rice sold on time
定期払い
payment on term
定期渡し
delivery on term

ていき〔定規〕
〈名〉Prescription; regulation:(=の) prescribed; regular

content:
ていき〔提起〕
〈名〉Institution:(=する) to institute (a suit); to raise (a question, etc.)

content.content: 訴訟を提起する
to institute a suit against one―institute legal proceedings against one―proceed against one―bring an action against one
異論を提起する
to raise an objection
問題を提起する
to raise a question

content:
ていぎ〔定義〕
〈名〉A definition

content.content: 定義を下す
to give a definition―define a term
この語に定義が下し難い
The word is hard to define―indefinable.

ていぎ〔廷議〕
〈名〉A court council

content:
ていぎ〔提議〕
〈名〉A proposition; a proposal; an overture:(=する) to propose; to make a proposition; to make overtures

content.content: 先方から提議がある
We have a proposition from the other party―The other party has approached us with a proposition.
この規則の廃止を提議した者がある
Some one proposed the abolition of the regulation.
会員の提議によってこの規則は廃止になった
The regulation was abolished on the proposition of a member.
講和を提議する
to make overtures of peace―hold out the olive-branch

content:
ていきあつ〔低気圧〕
〈名〉Low atmospheric pressure; atmospheric depression

content.content: 低気圧の中心
the centre of depression―a storm centre
低気圧の中心はいつも南洋に生じて北進する
Storm centres always form among the South Sea Islands, and move northward.
政界に低気圧の兆候あり
There are symptoms of a political storm.

content:
ていきゅう〔低級〕
〈形〉Low-grade; low

content.content: あそこの芝居は低級だ
The play there is a low-grade performance.
低級読者に訴える雑誌ばかりだ
The magazines all appeal to the low-grade reader.
低級趣味に媚びる演劇だ
The play panders to low taste.

content:
ていきゅう〔庭球〕
〈名〉Tennis; lawn-tennis

content.content: 庭球をやる
to play tennis
彼は庭球が上手だ
He is a good tennis-player.
庭球試合
a lawn-tennis tournament
庭球場
a lawn-tennis court
庭球部
the lawn-tennis department

ていきゅう〔涕泣〕
〈名〉Weeping:(=する) to weep; to shed tears

content:
ていきょう〔提供〕
〈名〉An offer:(=する) to offer; to make an offer; to produce, furnish (evidence); to place (anything) at one's service; to place (money) at one's disposal

content.content: 本品は半価にて提供す
The article is offered to the public at half-price.
提供に応ずる
to accept an offer
彼は悦んで提供に応じた
He readily accepted the offer―jumped at the proposal.
提供を謝絶する
to decline an offer
法廷で証拠物件を提供する
to produce evidence―furnish evidence―in court
本が読みたくば僕の蔵書を提供する
If you wish to read, I shall place my library at your service.
金が要るならご入用だけ提供する
If you want money, I shall place at your disposal any sum you may need.

content:
ていぎょう〔定業〕
〈名〉A regular occupation

content.content: 彼は定業が無い
He has no regular occupation―He is at a loose end.
定業に就く
to settle down to a regular occupation―find a regular employment

ていきん〔提琴〕
〈名〉A violin; a fiddle

content:
ていけい〔定形〕
〈名〉A fixed form; a regular form

content.content: 定形無き
amorphous

content:
ていけい〔提携〕
〈名〉Concert; coalition:(=する) to act in concert with, act in line with, fall in line with (a Power); to join hands with (a rival); to make common cause with (an enemy); to coalesce with (a rival party)

content.content: 英国は仏国と提携してドイツに当たった
Britain acted in concert with―acted in line with―France against Germany.
他の列国は英仏と提携した
The other Powers fell in line with Britain and France.
日本は列国と提携して太平洋掃海の任に当たった
Japan, in concert with the powers, kept the Pacific clear of the enemy.
彼とは久しく反対の位置に立って来たが今度提携しようと思う
I intend to join hands with my old rival.
源平相い提携して第三者に当たる
The two rivals make common cause with each other against a third enemy.
甲派が乙派に提携を申込む
One party proposes to coalesce with the other―One party proposes a coalition with the other.
提携論者
a coalitionist

ていけい〔梯形〕
〈名〉
1. ［幾何］ A trapezoid
2. ［軍事］ An echelon formation

ていげき〔帝劇〕
〈名〉The Imperial Theatre
